loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de semillas,la socia lo vende en el mercado,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las semillas.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues with her business buying and selling seeds in the market.  She works from 8am until 6pm and through this small business is able to support her children.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell seeds.  She is asking for the loan to buy seeds at wholesale.  She is happy with the loan and committed to making her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds at wholesale.

loans.name: Lidia Juvita

texts.es: Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Sumaqcha, tiene 57 años, es madre de 4 hijos,  esta en Finca Perú desde hace 10 años, cuando se inició en Finca ella tenia muy poco capital, ahora con todo el trabajo que pudo realizar en su tienda de abarrotes pudo salir adelante, cumplió su sueño de terminar de construir su casa, y lo que también le llena de satisfacción es haberles ayudado en los estudios de sus hijos, ella ahorra, las cosa han cambiado mucho desde que esta en Finca y recibe los préstamos, siente que ella va a progresar mucho mas y tratara de subir los escalones del éxito. Ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.
texts.en: Lidia is a member of the “Señor de Sumaqcha” communal bank.  She’s 57 years old and the mother of four children.  She’s been in Finca Perú for the last 10 years.  When she started with Finca she had very little capital.  Now with all her work she’s managed to succeed wither grocery store and get ahead.  She reached her dream of finishing building her house and another thing that fills her with satisfaction is having been able to help her children with their schooling.  She saves up and things have changed quite a bit since she’s been in Finca receiving loans.  She feels that she’s been making much progress and she will attempt to ascend the steps toward success.  The loan now will be sued to buy groceries.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Norma Violeta

texts.es: Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Sumaq Soncco, tiene 45 años, es madre de 3 hijos, se dedica a la  venta de dulces y la elaboración de los mismos, ella en Finca pudo aprender mucho en su estadía así como ahorrar, la responsabilidad, la puntualidad y valorarse como mujer, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de Harina, azúcar, huevo  y manteca.
texts.en: Norma is a member of  the Communal Bank "Señor de Sumaq Soncco."  She is 45 years old and the mother of 3 children años.  She works making and selling sweets.  With Finca, she has learned a lot in her position such as responsibility, punctuality, how to save and how to value herself as a woman.  Now, she will invest this loan in the purchase of flour, sugar, eggs, and lard.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, eggs, and lard.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is requesting a loan in order to buy more cattle to offer for sale. He is a married man dealing in the cattle trade in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He dreams of building a permanent house and ensuring the education of his children. His primary challenges include the high cost of cows and stringent restrictions on cattle movement.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to offer for sale

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a married man with three children ranging in age from 7 to 13 years. Describing himself as focused, he has operated a retail store selling second-hand clothes (commonly known as "mitumba" in the local language) for eight years. Jeremiah's business is located is a busy area, and his primary customers are local residents. His biggest business challenge is delays in customer payments.

Jeremiah will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. His business goal is to venture into a container-selling business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Estalin Damian

texts.es:
ESTALIN DAMIAN tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en Guaranda provincia de bolívar.

 ESTALIN DAMIAN trabaja de mesero en las noches en un restaurante de parrilladas. Solicita el crédito para comprar libros y pagar las pasantías. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá estar tranquilo porque va ha tener el dinero para poder realizar las pasantías.
 Las compras de los libros lo hará en Riobamba. El sueño es poder ser un buen mecánico automotriz, y tener un negocio propio.

Enfrentamos desafíos en este caso la competencia pero sin embargo va a poner todo el empeño para ser un buen profesional y lo reconozcan.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar y cuidar a los padres.
texts.en:
Estalin Damian, 21, is single and has no children; he lives with his parents in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.  He works nights as a waiter in a grilled meat restaurant and has requested the loan to buy textbooks and pay for his apprenticeship.

With help from the loan he will be able to be at peace because he’ll have money to complete his apprenticeship.  He will buy the books in Riobamba.  His dream is to become a good auto mechanic and to have his own business.

The challenge faced in this case is competition however he will put all his effort into becoming a good, well-recognized professional.  In his free time he enjoys playing and caring for his parents.

loans.use: to buy textbooks and pay for his apprenticeship.

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es: María, de 33 años, soltera, con 5 hijos de los cuales 4 de ellos están a su  cargo y 1 es independiente, de oficio comerciante originaria de Chichigalpa municipio de Chinandega. Su negocio es venta de frutas y verduras. Aunque no es un local  que no cuenta con muchos lujos, pero es el negocio con el cual mantiene a sus hijos  ,no tiene otros ingresos. Los canastos de mimbre y plásticos son sus exhibidores de frutas y verduras pero aun así en medio de su pobreza busca como salir adelante tratando de darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. Tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, antes de dedicaba al comercio ambulante; solicito el crédito para invertir en el negocio con la compra de cebollas, chayotes, papas, pepinos y otras clases de verdura que son necesarias para surtir su tramo. su meta a corto plazo es seguir en el negocio y meter a estudiar a sus hijos, a mediano plazo es comprar un camioncito para el transporte de la mercadería y largo plazo comprar su propia casa ya que a donde vive es de su mama.
texts.en:
María, 33, is single and has five children four of which are still in her care and one is independent.  She is a merchant from Chichigalpa, Chinandega Municipality.  Her business is selling fruit and vegetables.  Although her locale has no luxuries it’s the business that supports her children; she has no other source of income.  Wicker and plastic baskets are her display cases for fruit and vegetables but even in the midst of her poverty she seeks ways to get ahead and try to give her family a better standard of living.  

She’s been in this business for five years; she used to be an ambulatory street vendor.  She requested the loan to invest in her business buying onions, chayote, potatoes, cucumbers and other kinds of vegetables that are necessary to stock her stand.  

Her short-term goal is to stay in business and enroll her children in school.  Her medium-term goal is to buy a small truck to transport her merchandise and her long-term goal is to buy a house of her own since she currently lives in her mother’s house.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to stock her business.

loans.name: Alex German

texts.es:
Alex Germán tiene 20 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con la esposo y con el hijo de 1 mes de edad en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Alex es asistente jurídico, además es digitador en un cyber. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar un computador.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la computadora para poder  realizar  trabajos que antes realizaba en el cyber.

La compra lo realizará  en Quito y los trabajos los hará en Guaranda. El sueño es poder tener el título en marketing. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son en el sector social conocer y relacionarse con otras personas. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el fútbol.
texts.en:
Alex Germán is 20 years old, married, and has one son.  He lives with his wife and son, who is one month old, in the Guaranda province of Bolívar.

Alex works as a legal assistant as well as doing data entry in an Internet cafe.  He is requesting this loan to be able to purchase a computer.

With the help of the loan, he will be able to purchase the computer and do the work that he previously had to do in the Internet cafe.

He will make the purchase in Quito and he will do the work in Guaranda.  His dream is to be able to obtain a degree in marketing.  The challenges that he faces are in the social realm--networking with other people.  In his free time, he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a Kiva borrower. She has four children with ages ranging from 5 months to 7 years. She describes herself as kind. She operates a grocery stall where she sells vegetables and fruits such as cabbages, kales, carrots, mangoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the small room where she does her daily business operation. She will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more vegetables and pay for a room for business operation. Her business goal is to run a big wholesale grocery store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and pay for the construction of a room for business operation.

loans.name: Juan Carlos Escobar Moreira

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 31 años de edad  es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los tíos en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Juan trabaja en la venta de libros. Solicita el crédito para comprar electrodomésticos cómo refrigerador, microondas, plancha.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que necesita para la casa. Las compras lo realizará en guaranda. 
El sueño es poder mantenerse en el trabajo par que no le falte el dinero.

El desafío al que se enfrenta es crecer como profesional y no tener problemas.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol  es arquero,  pertenece a un equipo y es arquero en las ligas barriales.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 31, is single and has no children; he lives with his uncles in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.  Juan works selling books and is asking for the loan to buy home appliances like a refrigerator, a microwave oven and an iron.

With help from the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for the house.  He will make his purchases in Guaranda.  His dream is to stay in business so that he will not lack money.  The challenge he faces is to grow as a professional and not have any problems.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer; he’s a goalie and belongs to a neighborhood league.

loans.use: to buy appliances like a refrigerator, a microwave oven and an iron.

loans.name: Vicente Jacinto Bravo Perez

texts.es: Vicente de 53 años vive (machala ecuador) el decidió ponerse una tienda desde que se izo de compromiso . su esposa le ayuda abministrar el negocio cuando el hace trabajo de albañil. Trabaja todos los días con esfuerzo y dedicación. A futuro el desea tener su negocio grande  y tener en buen estado a su familia. Con el préstamo comprara ( arroz aceite etc).
texts.en: Vicente is 53 and lives in Machala, Ecuador.  He decided to start a store since he made a commitment to himself.  His wife helps him manage the business when he works as a bricklayer.  He works every day with effort and dedication.  In the future, he hopes to have a larger business and take good care of his family.  With this loan, he will buy rice, oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, rice, and oils.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a 57-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a fisherman for 20 years after starting with capital of 600,000. His major hardships are price fluctuations and the stringent regulations on fishing by the state. However, Augustine has a vision of diversifying his business to include a retail shop and buying land to grow crops. 

Augustine needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Eljen

texts.en:
Eljen is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Eljen makes and sells home-made ice cream using a motorcycle with a side box for the ice cream container. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the raw ingredients needed for making home-made ice cream.

Eljen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed for making home-made ice cream.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 44, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a construction foreman who earns about USD 5 per day. His wife and two children are employed in the garment factory. They earn about USD 3 per day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Channy is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase construction materials to use in his construction work. This purchase would enable him to get enough materials to use and generate more income to support the family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to use in his construction work.

loans.name: Maria Helena

texts.es:
María de 50 años, madre soltera con dos hijos independientes, comerciante, originaria de Chinandega. Su negocio es un tramo de ropa en general en el mercado de la ciudad  con 6 años de estar  funcionando, lo puso con capital propio y apoyo económico del padre de sus hijos. Sus comienzos fueron muy difíciles pues no tenía un local propio se dedicaba a vender de manera ambulante, pero con tiempo y arduo trabajo logro tener un  punto fijo en el mercado para vender ropa.
Solicito el crédito para comprar ropa para dama, caballero, camisetas, pantalones, faldas ,short y mercadería en general. tiene buena referencia crediticia en otras instituciones  financieras, su metas invertir más al negocio y hacer mejoras de vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and a single mother of two independent children.  She works in commerce and is from Chinandega.  Her business is a small general clothing store in the city market.  With 6 years of being in business, she started with her own capital and financial support from the father of her children.  In the beginning, it was very difficult; she didn't have her own location, so she sold door to door.  However, with time and hard work, she was able to have a fixed place in the market to sell clothing.

María is requesting the loan to purchase women and men's clothing, T-shirts, pants, skirts, shorts, and general merchandise.  She has good credit references from other financial institutions.  Her goals are to invest more in the business and to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: para comprar ropa para dama, caballero, camisetas, pantalones, faldas ,short y mercadería en general.

loans.name: Kleber Jacinto Espinoza Caiminagua

texts.es: Klever de 34 años vive (machala ecuador) el decidió ponerse una tienda desde que se izo de compromiso . su esposa le ayuda abministrar el negocio cuando el hace trabajo de albañil. Trabaja todos los días con esfuerzo y dedicación. A futuro el desea tener su propia casa y tener en buen estado a su familia. Con el préstamo comprara ( arroz, aceite, bebidas etc).
texts.en: Klever is 34 and lives in Machala, Ecuador.  He decided to start a store since he made a commitment to himself.  His wife helps him manage the business when he works as a bricklayer.  He works every day with effort and dedication.  In the future, he hopes to have his own home and take good care of his family.  With this loan, he will buy rice, oil, drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and drinks.

loans.name: Luis Severo Gomez Espinoza

texts.es: Luis de 47 años vive ( machala ecuador) el desde muy pequeño se dedicaba a la venta de mariscos.el logro ponerse una tienda en la  que vende pescado. Con muchas ganas y esfuerzo se dedica a trabajar todos los días solo. A futuro el desea tener una casa bonita y distribuir  pescado por mayor. Con el préstamo comprara ( pescados ).
texts.en: Luis is 47 and lives in Machala, Ecuador.  Since he was very young, he has made a living selling seafood.  He was able to start a store selling fish.  With a lot of determination and effort, he works alone every day.  In the future, he hopes to have a nice house and be a wholesale fish distributor.  With this loan, he will buy fish.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 45-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and buy a car. 

Joshua has been a carpenter for 20 years now after starting with capital from the savings made out of his farming activities. His major hardships are price fluctuations, customers not paying on time, and inadequate capital to purchase raw materials. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas, hiring employees to help expand his business, and moving his business to a permanent location. Joshua needs a loan to buy timber for the workshop.

loans.use: to buy timber for the workshop.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 

Rebecca has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Rebecca has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en: Duncan is a married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 1 year to 12 years. He describes himself as a responsible and hardworking man. He operates a retail store where he provides services of printing, photocopying, etc. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located within a bus town and his primary customers are small companies. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. He will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy another printer. His business goal is to expand his business into a publishing company within five years.

loans.use: to buy another printer.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en: Eddy is a 39-year-old married lady with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling crude oil for 18 years after using her savings from farming as start-up capital. Her challenges are high fuel and transportation costs and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas. Eddy needs money to buy crude palm oil for resale.

loans.use: to buy crude palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Raymundo Pozo Huayta

texts.es:
Raymundo vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos a los cuales ama muchísimo en la ciudad de Camana; ciudad que se caracteriza por tener playas hermosas, clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de los riquísimos camarones y por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz, considerado uno de los mejores del  mundo. Como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Tallarín Verde” y  en su tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos. 
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación el trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, el le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 12 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 70 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque atiende de manera ambla a los clientes y sobre todo porque es muy honrado.
Raymundo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoramientos en su vivienda en especial reforzar las paredes y el techo, lo que le permitirá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir trabajando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:”Darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Raymundo lives with his wife and two children, whom he loves very much, in the city of Camana.  This city is characterized by having beautiful beaches and a warm climate.  It is known for its delicious shrimp and its agriculture, especially for its rice, which is considered among the best in the world.  Like a good Peruvian, he likes food a lot, and one of his favorite dishes is the delicious "tallarín verde."  In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends.

With a lot of effort and dedication, he works driving a motorcycle taxi.  He works around 12 hours a day, and he can serve up to 70 customers in a day.  He believes his business is going well because he treats his customers well, and above all, he is very honest.

Raymundo is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, and he is thankful for the help they have offered him.  He will be able to make improvements to his home, specifically to reinforce the walls the walls and the roof, which will let him give a better quality of life to his family and to keep working to fulfill his biggest dream: "to give his children a good education."

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Lideres En Accion Group

texts.es:
Enit Melly, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene tres hijos. Ella forma parte del grupo "Lideres en acción" que está formado por 7 socios, quienes la eligieron como la tesorera del grupo.
Desde hace siete años, inició su negocio instalando una bodega en su domicilio, gracias a su trabajo y a su empeño, ella ha logrado aportar y apoyar económicamente en los gastos familiares.
Su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco, inició con un poco de golosinas, luego fué aumentando las bebidas y actualmente está surtiendo su bodega con abarrotes.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Enit Melly, 36, has 3 children.  She is a member of the communal bank "Lideres en Acción," which has 7 members who chose her to be the group's treasurer.

Seven years ago, Enit started a grocery store in her home.  Thanks to her work and effort, she has managed to support her family by contributing financially toward the household expenses.

Her business has gradually grown.  She started out selling a small amount of candy, and later she started selling drinks.  Now she is stocking her store with groceries.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of groceries to stock her store.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of products to stock her store

loans.name: Rosa Ines Franco Posligua

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Cielo Azul  se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

La señora Rosa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo desde su casa. Tiene  63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero aun viven con ella, también vive con una nieta de 10 años que estudian en  escuela y es como su hija. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella para ganarse la vida se dedica a  la venta de materiales de pesca como por ejemplo redes, anzuelos, piolas entre  otras muchas cosas que se requieren para realizar una buena pesca en alta mar, trabaja tres días a la semana ofreciendo sus productos a los pescadores una vez que llegan de alta mar, ella cada quince días viaja hasta el centro de Manta a comprar lo necesario para que cuando lleguen sus clientes tener de todo para sus trabajos en el mar,  viene realizando esta actividad ya por dos años y le ha oído muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, grapas, entre otros.
 
Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su nieta que es su tesoro.
texts.en:
The “Cielo Azul” (Blue Sky) communal bank meets every 15 days in Jaramijo Canton.  This place is known for the beautiful beaches that bathe this beautiful place.  Most residents here are hardworking and dedicated to tasks related to the sea.

Rosa is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because thanks to the loans she started a business that makes it possible for her to earn a living from home.  She’s 63 years old, married and has five children who are all adults now but still live with her.  She also lives with a 10 year old granddaughter who attends school and is like a daughter to her.  Her husband is a fisherman.

To earn a living she sells fishing supplies like nets, fishhooks and rope among many other things needed to carry out good fishing on the high seas.  She works three days a week selling her products to fisherman once they return from the high seas.  She goes to downtown Manta every fifteen days to buy what she needs so that when her customers arrive she will have everything needed for work at sea.  She’s been in business for two years and has done very well.

This loan is to buy nets, rope, fishhook and power snaps, among others.  Her dream is to give her granddaughter, who is her treasure, the best.

loans.use: to buy nets, rope, fishhooks, power snaps, etc.

loans.name: Alda Lucia

texts.es: La señora Alda, trabajadora, con espiritu de emprendedurismo se dedica a su oficio como modista ya hace mas de 16 años, mismo que ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia. Asegura Alda que el mantener su negocio propio como modista no le ha sido muy facil pero este al igual que los creditos otorgados por Afodenic han sido los medios para ella ahora ofrecerle a sus hijos y demas familares una bendicion tan grande como lo es de contar con su vivienda propia. Aprovechando el proyecto que el gobierno central de nuestro pais esta otorgandole a los habitantes de su barrio, como lo es la instalacion de aguas fluvial con el obejtivo de mejorar el nivel higienico de todas esas familias. Doña Alda señala el destino que le dara a este nuevo Financiamiento el cual es invertirlo en  la instalacion de servicios higienicos en su hogar misma instalacion que le dara a su familia mejores condiciones de salud.
texts.en:
Alda is a hard worker with entrepreneurial spirit and has been a fashion designer for more than 16 years. She has been the principal breadwinner for herself and her family
Alda assures us that maintaining her own fashion design business has not been easy, but this loan and the ones before it, given to her by Afodenic, have been a blessing for her and her family as she has been able to own her own house. She would also like to take advantage of a project promoted by Nicaragua’s central government to offer the inhabitants of her neighborhood the installation of running water with the objective to improve the level of hygiene of all of these families. With the loan she is requesting, Alda will install a washroom in her house, which will improve her family’s health and quality of life.

loans.use: to install a washroom in her house.

loans.name: Gpf Yitéré Gollé Group

texts.fr:
L e GPF  Yitéré Gollé  dont le nom qu’elle ont donné au groupement signifie » la vision du travail » regroupe 6  braves femmes qui font du commerce de divers produits. Elles sont venu solliciter leur 1er crédit à l’IMCEC afin d’améliorer leur activité de petit commerce.
La présidente, Aissata  est une dame de 39 ans qui fait de la vente de chaussures et d’habillement. Elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans ce domaine. Elle est mariée et a 5 enfants qui ont entre 15 et 5 ans. Elle n’a pas de charges sinon  personnelles, mais travaille quand même pour améliorer les conditions alimentaire sa famille.
Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle aimerait équiper sa chambre à coucher.
texts.en: The GPF Yitéré Gollé (the name means "the vision of work" is comprised of 6 brave women who sell diverse products. They are asking for a first loan from the IMCEC in order to improve their commercial activity. The president, Aissata, is a 39 year old woman who sells shoes and clothing. She has been working in this industry for 3 years. She is married and has 5 children between the ages of 5 and 15. She has no debts but works to improve the food conditions of her family. She would like to use the revenues from her business to purchase furniture for her bedroom.

loans.use: purchase shoes, clothing and diverse other products to re-sell

loans.name: Bello Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Bello Horizonte, están en el Cuarto Ciclo y está constituido por 16  integrantes; es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido y responsable. Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas, trabajan en conjunto en  la realización de actividades.
Teresa, es la presidenta del grupo, ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante y de luchar por su familia, es por ellos que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para darles todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, en lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela.
En vistas a tener mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, ella solicita el crédito a Kiva y fundación paraguaya, para que pueda surtirse con más prendas para vender.
texts.en:
The committee is called Bello Horizonte and it’s in its 4th loan cycle. The committee is made up of 16 members. This group is well known for being united and responsible. The members have great entrepreneurial spirits, they are all up to date on their payments and work together to achieve goals.

The president of the group, Teresa, is a woman who aspires to get ahead and fights for her family. This is why she gives it her all, so she can offer them a life without hardship. She sells all kinds of clothing and has a good clientele. 

With the goal of offering more variety to her clients, she is requesting a loan from Kiva and Fundacion Paraguaya so she can stock up on more clothing.

loans.use: buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children. 

Vilma has a egg shop that sells duck eggs by the tray. She has had this business for six years. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy duck eggs to sell.

Vilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy duck eggs to sell.

loans.name: Genny Amada

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Cielo Azul  se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Genny, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijas de 12, 8 y 4 años, las dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido se dedica a realizar fletes en una tricimoto. 

Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí trabaja todos los días, empezó  poco a poco su negocio con la ayuda de los créditos, lleva dos años con su negocio y gracias a él ha podido ayudar a su marido en los gastos que genera el hogar y los estudios de sus hijas.

Este crédito es para surtir aun mas su tienda, quiere comprar varios quintales de arroz y azúcar ya que con lo del invierno pueden escasear. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la ayuda para seguir adelante.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud ya que esto es lo más importante.
texts.en:
The “Cielo Azul” (Blue Sky) communal bank meets every 15 days in Jaramijo Canton.  This place is known for the beautiful beaches that bathe this beautiful place.  Most residents here are hardworking and dedicated to tasks related to the sea.

Genny, 30, lives here.  She has a spouse and three daughters who are 12, 8 and 4 years old.  The two oldest attend secondary and elementary school.  Her husband is a delivery man; he has a trimotor vehicle.

She has a small, home-based grocery store.  She works there every day.  She started her business gradually with help from the loans.  She’s had the business for two years and thanks to it has been able to help her husband with household costs and with her daughters’ schooling costs.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She wants to buy quintals of rice and sugar because they can become scarce in winter.  She’s been in the communal bank since its inception and she likes it because it helps her continue making progress.  Her dream is to be able to continue moving forward and to enjoy good health which is the most important thing.

loans.use: to buy quintals of rice and of sugar.

loans.name: Fuerza Femenina Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Fuerza Femenina debido a que se consideran mujeres fuertes con ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, está integrada por  12 mujeres que trabajan arduamente para que dia a dia puedan salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo ayuden a sus familias.
Maria es una de las integrantes del comité, y comenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles de variadas clases, como ser empanadas, sandwich, milanesas y otros tipos de comidas. Sus ventas cada vez va en mas asenso, por lo que le gustaria poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
Ella solicit el préstmo para la compra de carne, pollo, condimentos aderezos,  y demás inumos para poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma darle a sus clientes un buen servicio.
texts.en: The committee is called Fuerza Femenina (Feminine Strength) because they consider themselves strong women with the will to work and get ahead. There are 12 female members that work hard daily so that they can get ahead, and through their work, help their families. Maria is a member of the committee and tells us that she sells all kinds of food, like empanadas (meat pies), sandwiches, milanesas (breaded meat) and other types of foods. Her sales are growing, so she would like to continue investing in her business. She is requesting a loan to buy beef, chicken, seasoning condiments and other ingredients so she can continue working, and that way, offer her clients good service.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Jovenes Unidos Group

texts.es:
El Comité Jóvenes Unidos, es un comité integrado  por 9 jóvenes interesados en trabajar en equipo. Se formo con la iniciativa de un miembro del grupo. Son jóvenes con mucho entusiasmo, que quieren salir adelante y día a día luchar por un mejor porvenir. Ellos están estudiando, son muy trabajadores,  y muy sacrificados, decidieron trabajar en grupo para ganar un poco de ingresos para invertir es sus estudios y así poder alivianar los gastos en sus respectivas familias.
Eva es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a la peluquería y nos comenta que es muy buena profesional, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre acude hasta ella. Su meta es seguir trabajando y estudiando, y de esa forma poder tener un futuro digno y también ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuague, tintes, esmaltes y demás insumos que necesita para poder seguir trabajando. Ellos están muy contentos por la ayuda que están recibiendo de fundación paraguaya y de kiva.
texts.en:
Jóvenes Unidos [United Youth] communal bank has 9 young members who are interested in working as a team. They came together on the initiative of one member. They are very enthusiastic young people who want to move forward and fight each day for a better future. They are hardworking and self-sacrificing students. They decided to work as a team to make some income and be able to alleviate their respective families' expenses.

Eva is one of the group's members. She is a hairdresser and tells us that she is very professional; therefore, she has a very good clientele for her services. Her goal is the keep working and studying and, in this way, be able to have a decent future and also help her family. 

She is requesting this loan to buy shampoo, rinse, dyes, nail polish, and other supplies that she needs to keep working. They are very happy with the support they are receiving from the Paraguayan foundation and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her hair salon.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 41-year-old married lady with four children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Florence's personal goal is to educate her children and build a permanent house. She has been in salt trading for 12 years, after starting on a small scale with $500. Her major hardships are customers not paying on time, seasonal weather, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas and hiring employees to help expand her business. Florence needs this loan to buy equipment to mine salt.

loans.use: To buy equipment to mine salt.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Margie has a shop that sells rice by the kilogram. She has had this business for six years and is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has three children. 

Bernadith has a food and retail shop, or sari-sari store, where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for six years and is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Bernadith has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bernadith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Linguère De Keur Mambaye Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Linguère de Keur Manbaye" est constitué de 5 femmes, toutes mariées.Elles exercent des activités de commerce de produits agricoles, de tissus, de poisson et de légumes.Elles ont une expérience de sept ans dans ce domaine. La présidente ( en rayures rouges) est mère de quatre enfants dont les deux vont à l'école. Elle supporte les frais de scolarité de ces derniers et parvient en même temps à subvenir à ses propres besoins. Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, les femmes du groupement sollicitent un prêt de 990 000f pour acheter du mil, de la patte d'arachide, des légumes, du poisson séché et des tissus. Elles ambitionnent de renforcer d'avantage leur commerce.
texts.en: The "Linguère de Keur Manbaye" group is comprised of 5 women, all married. They all have retail activities related to agriculture, cloth, fish and vegetables that they have been involved with for 7 years. The president (seen in the photo wearing stripes) is a mother of four children, two of whom attend school. She supports their schooling fees as well as covering her own costs of living. In order to improve their businesses, these women are asking for a loan of 990,000f (approximately 2000 USD) in order to purchase millet, peanut butter, dried fish and cloth. They aim to increase their retail activity.

loans.use: purchase millet, peanut butter, vegetables, dried fish and cloth

loans.name: Linguère De Falokh Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Lingère de FALOKH" est constitué de 5 femmes qui sont toutes mariées.Elles s'activent dans un commerce de produits alimentaires comme les fruits, les légumes ainsi que des denrées de consommation courante. Elles achètent en gros et se partagent les produits. Ce commerce leur permet de prendre en charge leurs besoins ainsi que ceux de leurs enfants notamment leurs frais de scolarité.Le chef du groupe (en bleu , à droite) est mère de cinq enfants dont les 3 vont à l'école. Elle vend des oranges, des mangues et des légumes sur une table installée devant sa maison. Elle appui fortement son mari dans les dépenses alimentaires. Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite un prêt de 990000f pour acheter des fruits, des légumes, du mil et de la patte d'arachide.L'ambition du groupement est d'élargir leur commerce à d'autres produits plus rentables.
texts.en:
Group "Lingère de FALOKH" is composed of five women, all married. They run retail businesses for food products such as fruits, vegetables, and other grocery items. They purchase wholesale and split products between them. This trade allows them to support themselves and their children, notably to pay for school expenses.
The group leader (wearing blue, to the right) is a mother of five children, three of whom attend school. She sells oranges, mangoes and vegetables on a table set in front of her house. She helps her husband a lot with food expenses.
To increase their working capital, the group is requesting a 990,000 XOF loan with which they will purchase fruits, vegetables, millet, and groundnut butter. The group’s ambition is to extend their business to other, more profitable products.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, millet and groundnut  butter.

loans.name: Edgar Gerardo

texts.es: Edgar  es de Palacaguina- Estelí  tiene 48 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos,  el se  dedica al comercio desde hace 2 años regresando de costa rica donde trabajaba en un mercado de dependiente ahí logro juntar un poco de dinero y al llegar a Nicaragua decide invertir en una pulpería donde es apoyado  por su esposa, también tiene un taller de ladrillos que acaba de instalar, el espera que su negocio  le genere ganancia y así poder ampliarlo. Edgar realiza el préstamo con el objetivo de hacer crecer su negocio y poder surtir su pulpería comprando más mercadería como pan, leche, avena,granos basicos, jugos, productos de limpieza, aceite, sopas, salsas etc. Para diversificarla a ofertas, también aspira como planes futuros  comprar solares para construir viviendas  para alquilarlas.
texts.en:
Edgar is from Palacaguina, Estelí.  He’s 48 years old, married and has two children.  He’s been a merchant for the last two years since he returned from Costa Rica where he worked as an employee in a market.  He managed to save up some money and when he returned to Nicaragua decided to invest in a grocery store where his wife helps him.  He also has a brick making shop that he’s recently opened and he hopes that the business will generate profits in order to expand it.

Edgar is taking out the loan to make his business grow and to be able to stock his grocery store with more merchandise like bread, milk, oats, basic grains, juice, cleaning supplies, oil, soup, sauces, etc. to diversity offer.  In the future he also hopes to buy empty lots to build houses on to rent.

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, oats, basic grains, juice, cleaning supplies, oil, soup and sauces.

loans.name: María  Luisa

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Cielo Azul  se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este hermoso lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos  a la señora María, tiene 47 años, es casada y fruto de esta relación tienen seis hijos tres mayores  de edad y tres de 13, 9 y 3 años, dos estudian en escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella a pesar de que los mayores ya son comprometidos. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella tiene un negocio de venta de sodas y jugos en su casa, con el primer crédito que recibió del banco comunal y unos ahorros que tenia decidió empezar este pequeño negocio con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar, es un negocio que poco a poco lo ha aumentado y ahora con este nuevo crédito quiere surtir una pequeña tienda de comestibles.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes y muchos otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda. Esta desde el inicio del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado para empezar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando día a dia su negocio con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
The “Cielo Azul” (Blue Sky) communal bank meets every 15 days in Jaramijo Canton.  This place is known for the beautiful beaches that bathe this beautiful place.  Most residents here are hardworking and dedicated to tasks related to the sea.

We met María, 47, here.  She’s married and has six children; three of them are adults and the other three are 13, 9 and 3 years old.  Two attend school.  All her children still live with her even though the older ones are engaged.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She has a business at home selling sodas and juice.  With the first loan she got from the communal bank and with some savings she had she started this small business hoping to help her husband cover household expenses.  It’s a business that she’s been gradually increasing and will now use this loan to stock the small grocery store.

This loan is to buy rice, sugar, detergent and many other basic staple items to stock her store.  She’s been in the communal bank since its inception and she likes it because of the help they’ve given her to start her business.  Her dream is to continue increasing business day to day with help from the loans.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, detergent and other staple items.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa, es el grupo integrado por 16 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, ellas siempre se esfuerzan al maximo para poder ayudarse y de esa forma poder salir adelante.  El comite actualmente se encuentra en el decimo noveno ciclo del comite .
La Sra Nidia integrante del comite, nos comenta que es Repostera, tiene 41 años,tiene 2 hijos, esta casada con el Sr Felix quien es constructor de obras. Ella nos comenta que es un trabajo muy bueno, que le ha ayudado a darle a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan, tambien a ayudar a su marido con  los gastos del dia a día.
La Sra Nidia solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, levadura, huevo, etc. Con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y generando los ingresos necesarios para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Kuña Guapa is the communal bank made up of 16 very hard-working and determined women.  The always put forth the maximum effort to help each other and get ahead.  The bank is currently in its nineteenth funding cycle.
Sra. Nidia is a member of the communal bank.  She tells us that she is a confectioner.  She is 41 years old, has 2 children and is married to Sr. Felix, who is a construction contractor.  She also tells us that it is a good job which has helped her to give her family everything they need and helped her husband with the daily expenses.
Sra. Nidia is requesting the loan to purchase flour, yeast, eggs etc.  With these items, she will be able to keep working and generating the income she needs to keep working.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making sweets.

loans.name: La Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “La Esperanza 3” .Las integrantes agradecen la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación  Paraguaya,  ya que las mismas tendrán nuevas oportunidades para emprender un mejor trabajo, colaborando con los ingreso de su hogar y así brindarle a sus hijos un mejor bienestar. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en  el Segundo Ciclo con 16 integrantes.
La Directora General del comité es la Sra. Victorina, está casa con el Sr. Florencio quien trabaja como carpintero, tiene dos hijos pequeños y viven el mismo barrio que las demás integrantes de comité. Ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, que trae de diferentes partes. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus prendas es que ella ha podido ayudar a su marido con los gastos del día a día y de esa forma hacer un poco más ligera la carga de los gastos.
Ella solicita la ayuda de kiva y de fundación paraguaya, para la compra de prendas, las cuales desea tener para poder aumentar el stock de mercaderías que tiene y así atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “La Esperanza 3” (The Hopeful Three). The members are thankful for the opportunity provided by Fundación Paraguaya since they have new opportunities to start better work, contributing to the household income to give their children a better future. Right now the group is in the second loan cycle with 16 members. 

The general director of the communal because is Victorina. She is married to Florencio who works as a carpenter. She has two small children, and they live in the same neighborhood as other members of the communal bank. She tells us that she sells all types of clothes which are worn in the different regions. Thanks to the good quality of her products she has been able to help her husband with the daily expenses and, in that way, lighten the burden of the expenses. 

She is asking for Kiva’s and Fundación Paraguaya’ help to buy products which she wants to have into order to increase her merchandise stock and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell later.

loans.name: Qaid

texts.en:
Qaid is 71 years old. He lives in a rural area in Sana'a, Yemen. He is married and has seven children. He is a butcher who works hard during the whole day. He has been in business for more than 10 years and gained a sufficiently rich experience to continue his business successfully. His is a small community and he is very kind to customers. He started his business by purchasing goats and sheep. This enabled him to open his small butcher shop. Now he is looking to expand his business selling his products. His aspiration is to provide his children with the best life.

So, Qaid requested a loan of 300,000 Yemeni rials from AMB to buy livestock for his butcher shop in order to expand his business. In the future, he would like to have a farm of sheep and cows in order to improve his living condition.

loans.use: to buy livestock for his butcher shop in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Jinkee

texts.en:
Jinkee is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has children. 

Jinkee has a food and retail shop, or sari-sari store, where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years and is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Jinkee has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jinkee hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos, 44, is married and resides with his wife and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been carrying firewood to sell for over two years, earning approximately $5 per day. His wife runs the grocery store at home and earns approximately $5 per day. One of Sos's children is a construction worker who can also earn $5 per day. 

In order to provide convenient living conditions for his family, Sos is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase timber to rebuild his present house to make it bigger and stronger. In the future, he would like to help his children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: To purchase timber to rebuild his present house to make it bigger and stronger.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a hard-working 25-year-old man living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent home. For four years, he has been running a retail shop. His major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and high transportation costs; however, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas and moving it to a more permanent location. William needs a loan to buy stock such as sugar and salt for resale,

loans.use: To buy stock such as sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 51-year-old married man. He has children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a retail shop and faces the problems of price fluctuation, high fuel and transportation costs, and customers not paying on time.

George's dream is to educate his children, buy land to grow crops, and expand his business into new markets. George needs this loan to boost his business by buying more stock, such as cooking oil and sugar.

loans.use: To boost his business by buying more stock, such as cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Ayidote 5 Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE 5 est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Brigitte (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 57 ans. Brigitte est mariée à un certain Crespin et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. En dehors de ses enfants, Brigitte a un autre enfant à charge. Brigitte vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison.  Brigitte n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Brigitte vend depuis une dizaine d’années, des repas (riz accompagné de sauce aux poissons, etc.) à son domicile. Brigitte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Brigitte sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE 5. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
AYIDOTE 5 is a four-person group, whose members reside in the same city district in Benin; they also belong to the same local finance group. The group leader, Brigitte (who is raising her hand in the picture), is 57 years old. Brigitte is married to Crespin and is a mother of four; all her children attend school. In addition to her children, Brigitte also supports one other child. The couple provides for the household together. Brigitte never went to school.
To meet her various financial needs, Brigitte has been selling meals (rice with sauce such as fish sauce) from her home for about ten years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. To satisfy her customers and to grow her business, Brigitte and the other members of group AYIDOTE 5 are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. They will use this loan to better answer customer demand and to increase their profit. Their first loan was punctually repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, fresh fish, and condiments

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Moussa est un homme marié à 2 femmes.Il est père de 7 enfants dont les 4 vont à l'école.Il est un ancien chauffeur reconverti en commerçant de pièces détachées automobile. Il est installé à côté de la gare routière de sa localité et cette position lui assure une bonne clientèle. Ses revenus lui permettent ainsi d'entretenir sesdeux épouses, ses enfants et de prendre en charge ses propres besoins. Il sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter de l'huile moteur, des démarreurs, du liquide et de la colle. Il ambitionne d'élargir son magasin.
texts.en:
Moussa is married to two wives. He is a father of seven; four of the children attend school. A former driver, he changed career and now sells auto parts. His shop is located next to his town's bus station, which guarantees him good business. His revenues therefore allow him to support his two wives, his children, and himself.
He is requesting a loan of 500,000 XOF to purchase motor oil, starters, liquid coolant, and glue. He ambitions to expand his store.

loans.use: to buy motor oil, starters, liquid coolant, and glue.

loans.name: Bozor

texts.ru: Бозор проживает в городе Вахдат. Он женат. Ему 51 год. Бозор более 17 лет занимается изготовлением специальной деревянной посуды (табаки чуби) для национального блюда (шакароб) и многих других национальных изделий. Он берет кредит для расширения своей деятельности особенно производство деревянной посуды.
texts.en:
Bozor lives in the village Vahdat. He is married. He is 51 years old. 

Bozor has been engaged in production of special wooden dishware (tabaki chubi) for the national dish (shakarob) and many other national products. He takes a loan to expand his business, especially the production of wooden dishware.

loans.use: to purchase boards, wood and other necessary tools

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo en el barrio Kuña Kyre'y de la ciudad de Caaguazú, son 21 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, cada una con un deseo de progreso y estabilidad económica. Las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, trabajan en equipo, se ayudan mutuamente y son un grupo solidario donde la responsabilidad es conjunta y el compromiso es asumido por todas.
Aurea forma parte del grupo y nos cuenta que tiene un copetín, donde vende de todo tipo de cosas, como ser galletitas, gaseosas, golosinas, y demás productos. Su meta es seguir creciendo y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de golosinas, galletitas, bebidas y demás insumos, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the neighborhood of Kuña Kyre'y in the city of Caaguazú. This committee is made up of 21 hard-working, fighting women, each one wanting progress and economic stability. This group possesses a great entrepreneurial spirit, helps each other out and works together so that the responsibility is taken on together as is the commitment. 

Aurea is a member of the group and tells us she has a little shop where she sells all kinds of things, like cookies, sodas, candy and other products. Her goal is to continue growing her business so she can help her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy candy, cookies, drinks, and other products so she can continue working and offering a variety of products to her clients.

loans.use: buy products for her little shop.

loans.name: Lewis Deogratias

texts.en:
Lewis is a 66-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

Lewis is a tea and coffee farmer who has worked for over 30 years. He started with buying land and his personal savings. He faces the problems of price fluctuation, high fuel and transportation costs, and seasonal weather. His dreams are of self-education and diversifying the business. Lewis needs this loan to buy fertilizers for his tea and coffee plantations.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his tea and coffee plantations.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has eight children, with ages ranging from 21 to 32 years old. She describes herself as determined and aggressive. 

Margaret operates a food market, where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for 27 years. Her business is located near a manufacturing industry, and her primary customers are industrial employees. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high price of ingredients such as flour and sugar. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more ingredients to prepare meals to sell. Her business goal is to run another, similar outlet within five years.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare meals to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 34 years old and a mother of three children. She lives in Hioma, Uganda, and owns a business selling fresh foods and vegetables. 

She faces the challenge of seasonal weather variations, especially the dry season, when foodstuffs become expensive and not readily available in the markets. Her family goal is to educate her children, and her business goal is to expand to new markets. Eva wants to use the loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: To buy fresh food.

loans.name: Hogar De Niños Group

texts.es: Dunia Isabel es miembro del Grupo Solidario Hogar de Niños, tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos, todos sus hijos dependen de ella y reside en la Ciudad de Juticalpa, en el departamento de Olancho. Desde hace 3 años trabaja vendiendo ropa Interior, las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante, su horario de atencion es por la tarde ya que por la mañana trabaja en el hogar de niños, los sabados y domingos vende durante todo el dia. Su ventaja es que tiene una muy buena clientela y que es muy conocida en su localidad. El préstamo que solicita Dunia lo necesita para comprar mercadería de ropa interior nueva. Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos se gradúen y poder tener su casa propia. Una de las metas de Dunia es tener su propio local para instalar su negocio y así ya no tendrá que andar vendiendo de forma ambulante. Dunia tiene más de tres años de solicitar préstamos en FAMA y ha pagado puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Dunia Isabel is a member of the “Hogar de Niños” (Children’s Home) communal bank.  She’s 45 years old, single and has three children who are all dependent on her.  She lives in the city of Juticalpa in Olancho Department.

She’s been working selling underwear for the last three years.  She sells in an ambulatory fashion and her work schedule is in the afternoons since she works at in the children's home during the morning.  Saturdays and Sundays she sells all day.  Her edge is that she has a very good clientele and that she’s very well-known in her community.

The loan Dunia is asking for is needed to buy new underwear.  One of her dreams is that her children graduate and to have a house of her own.  One of Dunia’s goals it to have a locale of her own to install her business so that she won’t have to sell in an ambulatory way and longer.  Dunia has been asking for FAMA loans for more than three years and has made her installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: La Unión Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras La Unión es del chaco y actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, tienen muchas ganas de seguir dentro del programa, trabajar juntas y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias, y darles todo aquello a los que ella no pudieron tener acceso.
Blanca es una de las integrantes, y nos comenta que se dedica a la lavandería. Lava ropa ajena de muchos de sus vecinos, y gracias a este trabajo puede darle a su familia lo que necesitan. Comenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo muy digno, y por sobre todo muy honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jabones, enjuagues de ropas, suavizantes y demás insumos necesarios para que pueda seguir trabajando y creciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank of female entrepreneurs, La Union, is from Chaco and is currently in its first loan cycle. The members are eager to continue the program. They work together and, in that way, are able to help their families and give them everything that didn’t have. 

Blanca is one of the members. She tells us that she works doing laundry service, and she washes many of her neighbors’ clothes outside. Thanks to this work she can give her family what they need. She says that she is very proud of what she does, since it’s dignified work and above all honest. 

She is asking for a loan to buy soap, clothing rinse, fabric softeners, and other things that she needs in order to be able to continue working and growing.

loans.use: to buy soap, clothing rinse, fabric softeners, etc.

loans.name: Najeeb

texts.en: Najeeb is 41 years old, married and has three children. They live together in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a call centre to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. He started his business with limited capital and saved money to open a small call centre. He describes his business environment as competitive, because many people do the same business. He describes his business as more service than financial profit, so his clients are satisfied with him. He has applied for a loan of 150,000 Yemeni rials from AMB to buy additional products such as mobile recharge cards and call phones for his business. In the future, Najeeb hopes to have an internet café in addition to the call centre.

loans.use: to buy additional products such as mobile recharge cards and call phones for his business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Lorna is peddling Natasha and Avon products like clothing and perfumes. She has had this business for four years. Lorna is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to build her stock of Natasha and Avon products.

Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy Natasha and Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 33-year-old single mother living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a primary schoolteacher who has served for over 10 years. 

Alice faces the problem of high taxes and other fees. Her dream is to educate her children, build a permanent home, educate herself, and buy land on which to grow crops. Alice needs this loan to complete the building of her residential house.

loans.use: To complete the building of a residential house.

loans.name: Jennielyn

texts.en:
This is Jennielyn, 45, a resident of Bacoor Cavite, Philippines. She’s married to Ruben, her business partner, and has three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Jennielyn is a rice dealer. She earns money by getting her supplies at wholesale prices and selling rice by sacks or by the kilo. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Jennielyn earns a minimum of 1,800 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Jennielyn is requesting a loan of 26,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to pay for additional stock for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands the business. 

Jennielyn hopes to grow her business in the coming years, and she hopes to give her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work with her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock needed for her rice-selling business.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis de 34 años vive con su cónyuge y su hija de 12 años de edad al sur de la ciudad. Allí tiene su propio negocio de ebanistería, donde elabora toda clase de muebles de madera como juegos de alcobas, de sala, comedor escaparates, armarios etc. Su experiencia la adquirió desde el año 2008 trabajando para talleres cercanos a su vivienda, hasta que decidió aventurarse al montaje de su propia microempresa. Sus primeros clientes fueron sus vecinos y algunos amigos, hoy estos mismos lo han referenciado y tiene muchos clientes fijos en la ciudad y en el departamento de la Guajira, ubicado al norte de Colombia. Su competencia es normal y se sostiene por la calidad de sus productos, precios justos  y el cumplimiento a los pedidos de sus clientes. En su taller genera 4 empleos incluyendo el suyo propio y trabaja 10 horas diarias,  hasta las 7:00 p.m. de lunes a sábados. Su meta es lograr ser mas solvente para dedicarse a la gerencia de su empresa y al control y promoción de su mercado, para que algún día su hija sea una profesional muy exitosa. Su desafío actual es el insuficiente capital de trabajo, para lograr mas rápidamente cumplir sus metas de ampliar el espacio donde funciona su área productiva. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará de contado y en un mayor volumen que el acostumbrado, madera, clavos, pegantes para dar respuesta efectiva a su clientela con diseños y productos mucho más competitivos.
texts.en:
Luis, 34, lives with his spouse and 12 year old daughter in the south of the city.  He has his own cabinet making shop there where he makes all kinds of wood furniture like bedroom, living room and dining room sets, display cases, armoires, etc.  He’s acquired experience since 2008 working for shops near his house until he ventured into his own micro business.  

His first customers were his neighbors and some friends.  Today, these same ones have recommended him to others and he now has many regular customers in the city and in La Guajira Department located in northern Colombia.  His ability level is normal and he stays in business due to the quality of his products, his fair prices and by meeting customer expectations.  

His shop generates four jobs including his own and he works 10 hours daily until 7pm, Monday to Saturday.  His goal is to become more solvent so that he can concentrate on managing his firm and to control and promote in his market so that one day his daughter can become a very successful professional.  His current challenge is insufficient working capital to quickly reach his goal of expanding the space where his productive area functions.

He is applying for a Kiva loan at present, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to pay cash for larger amounts than usual of wood, nails and adhesives to effectively meet customer demand with much more competitive designs and products.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue and nails in larger amounts.

loans.name: Mabel Medina Gómez

texts.es: Mabel tiene un negocio en el centro de la ciudad, donde se dedica a la venta de refrescos y mecatos. Ella es una mujer casada, tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 20 y 26 años. Su experiencia de negocio la inició con una tienda, pero le quedó difícil atender 2 negocios a la vez y por eso escogió continuar ella misma con la refresquería, mientras la tienda, que exigía mas tiempo y esfuerzo, la dio en arriendo y con ella genera otro ingreso; en la medida de sus posibilidades   su hija, que estudia, la ayuda en sus tiempos libres.  Su esposo tiene un almacén donde vende  tornillos y repuestos y  entre todos reúnen los ingresos, para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, por eso han logrado que sus hijos salgan adelante. Su meta es propiciar el que su hija se convierta en una profesional de la enfermería, apoyándola económicamente en sus estudios, por eso esta familia trabaja unida para responder a este desafío. En la refresquería de Mabel,  las mercancías rotan cada 4 días, la rentabilidad sobre las ventas es no menor del 20% y maneja un margen de contribución no menor del 29,6%, indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su crecimiento. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, agua saborizadas dulces y productos de aseo personal en general. Con esta inversión planea aumentar su capital de trabajo gradualmente y tener un inventario apropiado que responda a las necesidades de su clientela, lo cual se constituye en el éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Mabel has a business in the center of the city where she sells beverages and snacks.  She’s a married woman and has two children who are 20 and 26 years old.  Her business experience started with a store but it was difficult to tend to two businesses at once so she decided to continue with the snack shop because the store required more of her time; she decided to lease it out and earn another income that way.  Her daughter attends school and helps her out as much as possible in her free time.  Her husband has a store where he sells screws and spare parts and among them all they earn income to meet household needs; this is how they’ve managed to raise their children.  Her goal is to see that her daughter becomes a professional nurse so she supports her schooling and this is why the family works so hard together to respond to this challenge.

In the snack shop, Mabel’s merchandise turns over every four days and her profit margin over sales is no less than 20%; these are financial indicators from which we can project her growth.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she will use to buy soft-drinks, juice, beer, flavored water, candy and personal hygiene items in general.  With this investment she plans to increase working capital gradually and have an appropriate inventory to meet customer needs which is what this investment’s success is based on.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her snack shop.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formo por medio de una de las miembros, quien era integrante de un comité, informo a sus vecinas acerca del programa de comité de mujeres, y de esa manera invito a vecinas y amigas de su comunidad a formar parte de ella. De esa manera se inicia dicho comité. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa, pero su meta es llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
La Sra Sirli tiene 31 años de edad, está casada con el Sr  Carlos juntos tienen 3 hijos. Sirli es Peluquera en su casa, y nos cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que siempre ofrece muy buenos servicios a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de crema para cabellos, tintes, shampoo, enjuagues y demás insumos con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y creciendo como profesional
texts.en:
This group was started by a female member who informed her neighbors and friends in the community, about a program for women. She then invited them all to be part of it. This is how this group was formed. They are currently in their 1st loan cycle, but their goal is to reach the highest level of the program. 

Sirli, 31, is married to Carlos and they have 3 children. Sirli is a hairdresser who works at home and because she always provides good service to her clients, has a very good clientele. 

She is requesting a loan to buy hair cream, color, shampoo and conditioner and other supplies she needs to continue working and growing as a professional.

loans.use: buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 38-year-old married man. He has been fixing and selling watches for 10 years. This lengthy experience has earned Ihab the trust and support of his customers. 

Ihab is a hard-working man. He started introducing new products to his shop, such as stationery & toys. This is good for his daily income and will reflect positively on his social and  financial situations.

Ihab is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to improve his business through introducing new products to his customers. He will increase the different models of watches he sells as well as increase his selection of toys and stationery.

He is sure that this loan will help a lot in improving his family's and business situation. Ihab hopes to open another branch in the future, and he hopes it will be bigger and more productive.

loans.use: To improve his business by introducing new products to his customers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 55-year-old married woman. She has seven children, with ages ranging from 26 to 35 years. She describes herself as a determined and focused woman. 

Esther operates a food market, where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for 14 years and employs two staff members. Her business is located near a busy manufacturing industry, and her primary customers are industrial employees. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high price of ingredients such as flour and sugar. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more ingredients for the meals she sells. Her business goal is to venture into business as a cereals supplier within five years.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare meals to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora, 56, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She and her husband Nelson, a taxi driver, have two children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Leonora operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm-sized ones to much larger doormats, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up for every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, they are one of the most common products that you can buy, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney (a small bus) down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 3500 PHP in sales every week. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 41,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread, and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Leonora hopes to increase production and dreams of being able to give her everyone in her family a good life through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en:
Alfonso is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children. 

Alfonso has a food shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Alfonso has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alfonso hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 39-year-old married man, the father of five children. He has been working in the transportation sector since 2000. Most of the time, he transports furniture and many other necessary materials. Haytham is well known in his region with a good reputation for hard work. He is always on time and he is a man of his word.
