Haytham is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to renew his transportation license and do necessary maintenance on his truck. He has already been an Al Majmoua borrower for seven cycles with a good standing. Most of his previous loans helped a lot in improving his social situation. This loan will also help improve his situation in addition to providing a good living for his family. Haytham hopes to buy another truck in the future.

loans.use: to pay for renewing his transportation license and doing necessary maintenance on his truck.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
This is Ana, 45, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ana operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ana dreams to grow her business in the coming years and hopes to have a good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Mansueta has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish by the kilogram. She has had this business for six years. She is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to stock additional dried fish to sell.

Mansueta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mansueta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela tiene 30años de edad, es madre soltera y con mucho sacrificio y sobre todo amor saca adelante a su hijo de tan solo cuatro años de edad; él es su adoración por ello Gabriela da la vida para darle lo mejor y sobre todo que sea Feliz, junto a su pequeño viven en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, playas hermosas, por su agricultura y la generosidad de sus pobladores. Gabriela es muy trabajadora, anteriormente trabajaba como promotora en una entidad financiera, pero luego de ahorrar y sobre todo porque necesitaba estar más cerca de su hijo, logro tener su negocio de venta de abarrotes desde hace 2 años, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de cálida, atiende de manera amable a los clientes y sobre todo que es muy conocida en su barrio.

Gabriela está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar andamios, toldos, sillas, mesas para mejorar su negocio y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo, una mejor cálida de vida y tener una bodega mas grande”.
texts.en:
Gabriela, 30, is a single mother.  With much sacrifice and above all love she raises her son who is only four years old.  He is her love and Gabriela would give her life in order to give him the best and above all so that he is happy.  She lives wither little one in the city of Imperial which is noted for having hot weather, beautiful beaches, for its farming and the generosity of its residents.  

Gabriela is very hardworking.  She used to work as a promoter for a financial firm but after saving up and above all because she needed to be close to her young son she managed to have start a grocery selling business two years ago.  She believes that she does well in her business because she offers quality products, tends to her customers kindly and because she’s very well known in her neighborhood.

Gabriela is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to buy scaffolding, tarps, tables and chairs to offer better service which will lead to higher income and she can continue striving toward her great dream: “To provide a good education for her son, a better quality of life and to have a bigger store.”

loans.use: to buy scaffolding, tarps, tables and chairs, among others.

loans.name: Yrma Gloria Tarqui Mamani

texts.es:
Yrma tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de un pequeña de 12 años con el cual vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país el cual es el “candelabro de Paracas y las Islas Ballestas”, asimismo tiene como una de las actividades principales la pesca y la agricultura. Como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Cau Cau”; el estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar “Medicina Veterinaria”.

Con mucha dedicación Yrma trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es conocida en su barrio y porque es amable con  los clientes.

Yrma está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio (ropa de temporada de otoño), lo que le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos; así podrá seguir trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño.” Darle una buena educación a su Hija”.
texts.en:
Yrma, 39, is the mother of a 12 year old little girl she lives with in the city of Pisco, a city noted for having one of the country’s most important tourist attractions: the Paracas Candelabrum and the Ballestas Islands.  It also has as important activities fishing and agriculture.  Like all good Peruvians, she enjoys our country’s cuisine very much and one of her favorite dishes is the very delicious “Cau Cau” [tripe stew].  She studied up to fifth year of secondary school but would have liked to study veterinary medicine.

With much dedication, Yrma works in her business selling clothes.  She works about 10 hours daily and can care for up to 30 customers a day.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s well-known in her neighborhood and because she’s nice to customers.

Yrma is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business (clothes for the fall season) that will allow her to provide more variety of products to her customers and improve her income so that she can continue working toward her great dream: “To give her daughter a good education.”

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Progresistas” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Ellas son mujeres con gran espíritu de progreso y trabajo. Son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que desean salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Sara es una de estas mujeres, ella nos comenta que se dedica a la peluquería, y que ya tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre acude a ella para solicitarle sus servicios. Ella se define como una persona muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, esmaltes, y demás insumos que ella utiliza en su trabajo. Ella agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que ella y su grupo están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Progresistas” ["Progressive Women"] committee was formed through the union of a group of neighbors in the city of Santaní. They are women with a great spirit of hard work and progress. They are very hard-working and enterprising people, who want to get ahead and help their families. 

Sara is one of these women. She comments that she works in hairstyling, and she already has a well-defined base of customers who always come to her to ask for her services. She defines herself as a very enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead. 

She is requesting the loan to buy hair dyes, shampoo, rinses, nail polish and other supplies which she uses in her work. She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity that she and her group are receiving.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Genebe

texts.en:
Genebe is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has children. 

Genebe has a food and retail shop, or sari-sari store, where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and  beverages. She has had this business for five years. Genebe is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to additional stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Genebe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genebe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 38-year-old single woman. She has two children aged 12 and 14 years. Judith describes herself as a diligent woman. 

Judith operates a food market, where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a densely populated area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the shortage of fish. She will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy more fish to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn Del Rosario

texts.es:
Evelyn es una joven de 24 años de edad es madre soltera y con mucho amor y sacrificio saca adelante a su hija, vive en casa de su madre la cual la ha a poyado mucho sobre todo ahora que Evelyn es madre; la vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, playas hermosas, por su agricultura y la generosidad de sus pobladores. Evelyn es una joven muy luchadora y sobre todo saco mucha fuerza cuando se quedo sola con su hija, todo ello la motivo para iniciar su negocio de venta ropa de manera ambulatoria al inicio fue un poco difícil, pero poco a poco se fue acostumbrando sobre todo porque le gusta mucho el vender, tiene el negocio desde hace ya dos años, es muy detallista y siempre tiene pedidos de sus clientes, pero desde hace cuatro meses también ha iniciado la venta de dulces con lo cual tiene un ingresos más para su hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque trae novedades en cuanto a la ropa y en cuanto a los dulces ella cree que le va bien porque los prepara de manera muy sabrosa.

Evelyn está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio de ropa y implementar mejor su negocio de dulces, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando cada día para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 24, is a young, single mother who with much love and sacrifice is raising her daughter.  She lives in her mother’s house who has supported her very much especially now that Evelyn is a mother.  The house is located in the city of Imperial, a city noted for its hot weather, beautiful beaches, agriculture and for the generosity of its residents.

Evelyn is a very tenacious young woman who drew strength from within especially when she was left alone with her daughter.  All of that motivated her to start a business selling clothes in an ambulatory fashion which was very difficult at first.  She’s had the business now for two years.  She is very detail oriented and always has pending orders from customers but starting four months ago she also started selling candy which is another source of income for the home.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s very kind to customers and because she brings novel items of clothing and with respect to the candy she thinks she does well because the way she makes them they are very delicious.

Evelyn is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy more merchandise for the clothing sales business and to better stock her candy business which will allow her to improve income and continue working day to day to reach her greatest dream: “To provide a profession for her children and to have a larger business.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes) and to start a candy selling business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
This is Pedro, 48, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. He is married to Margarita. Pedro and his wife manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Pedro operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos' worth of cooking oil or an egg. He earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business,Pedro is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. Pedro hopes to be able to expand soon and maintain his good health. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. This is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Filomena has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Filomena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Filomena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Tabunco Fran Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Tabunco Fran” está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran pastelería, venta de frutos secos, venta de ropa nueva y ropa usada, venta de juguetes, servicio de radio taxi y preparación de comida rápida, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
María presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste con una polera manga corta de color blanco, además usa unos pantalones color beige de rayas y chalas color negro. Su cabello es corto y de color castaño oscuro, además de estatura baja.
Ella se dedica a la repostería, específicamente preparando tortas y pie de limón. Desde hace tres años, comenta que aprendió de manera autodidacta.
Sus ventas las realiza desde su casa a conocidos, familiares y amigos, quienes solicitan sus preparaciones, de acuerdo a sus gustos o celebraciones. Promociona sus servicios de repostería de boca en boca.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes comercios mayoristas, supermercados y proveedores, para comprar sus utensilios e ingredientes.
Con el crédito comprará un quintal de harina, gas y moldes para torta, estos últimos los encargará a la ciudad de Santiago.
Las metas para su negocio son instalarse con un local establecido, en el cual pueda preparar y ofrecer sus productos.
María vive junto a sus dos hijas de 25 y 21 años de edad, ambas estudian en la Universidad.
Uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es realizar algún curso de repostería, para perfeccionarse en su negocio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del cual forma parte, comenta que se siente muy cómoda, ya que los integrantes están motivados y comprometidos con cada uno de sus negocios. 
En cuanto a las capacitaciones, éstas le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de ventas e inversión.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “Tabunco Fran” and is made up of 17 entrepreneurs, each owning a different business. Some of those include, bakery, dried goods sales, new and used clothing sales, toy sales, radio taxi service and fast food sales, among others. They are all from the city of Talca.
Maria is the president of the Communal Bank group and is in the 1st row of the photo, 4th from the left, wearing a white short sleeve shirt, beige pants with stripes and black sandals. She has short dark brown hair and is short. 
She’s been making baked goods, specifically, tarts and lemon pies, for 3 years. She taught herself. She sells from her home to acquaintances, family members and friends, made to order or for celebrations. She promotes her bakery business by word of mouth. 
She buys her ingredients in different wholesale stores, supermarkets and suppliers to buy utensils and ingredients.
With the loan, she will buy gas, 46 Kg of flour and cake molds, the latter she’ll order from the city of Santiago. 
Her business goals are to find an established place where she can prepare and sell her baked goods. 
Maria lives with her 2 daughters, 25 and 21, both in university. 
One of her personal goals is to take a baking course to perfect her skills. 
She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity afforded her by Fondo Esperanza, as she’ll be able to invest in her business. In terms of the group, she tells us she feels very comfortable as the members are motivated and committed to their businesses. In terms of the training, she has learned new sales and investment strategies. 
Talca is part of the region of Maule, which is located in the central area of the country. It is the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region, being the most important city of the Chilean Central Valley. In Chile there exists a curious reference to Talca, the saying, "Talca, Paris y Londres" (Talca, Paris and London). Among the reasoning for this saying, some think it’s a derivation of something said by an Englishman, "Talca parece Londres" (Talca looks like London; when pronounced in Spanish, “looks like” sounds like the word “Paris”) because of the abundant fog that covers the Chilean city in winter time, just like the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: buy gas, 46 Kg of flour and cake molds, the latter she’ll order from the city of Santiago.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new car to invest in a new business. He is willing to invest this car in renting to tourists who highly request cars for rent during touristic seasons. It will have a very good effect on his financial situation.

Moustafa is a 37-year-old married man, the father of five children. He opened a small snack shop in 2009 which he developed through Al Majmoua loans into a special well-known snack spot. Moustafa has 12 years of experience in this field which reflects positively his customers' trust and support. He hopes to open a bigger restaurant in the future.

Moustafa has been a Al Majmoua borrower for six cycles. Most of these loans were invested in his business and he comes with very impressive feedback.

loans.use: to buy a new car to invest in a new business

loans.name: María Virginia

texts.es:
María tiene 56 años, es una mujer que le gusta la agricultura, le gustan sus animalitos y les cuida mucho. María vive con su hija y sus nietos en un sector fuera de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

María se dedica sola a la crianza de pollos, este negocio ayuda para sustentar los gastos de alimentación de sus nietos y su hija, es el sexto crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a utilizar en la compra de pollitos para criarlos, engordarlos y venderlos.

MAría sueña con tener galpones grandes de pollos.
texts.en:
Maria, 56, is a woman who likes farming.  She likes her farm animals and she cares for them very well.  She lives with her daughter and her grandchildren in an area outside of Ibarra in Imbabura province.

Maria only raises chickens.  This business helps her cover the household expenses of feeding her grandchildren and her daughter.  This is the sixth loan that she is requesting from Fodemi and it is the same loan that she will use to buy chicks to raise, fatten, and then sell.

Her dream is to have large chicken coops.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and fatten so that her business will increase

loans.name: Francisco Benitez

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco tiene 43 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá en su propia casa, está casado con la Sra. Felicia con quien tiene dos hijos, él tiene un taller mecánico de vehículos pesados hace 9 años. Anteriormente él trabajaba para otra persona pero con el tiempo fue adquiriendo sus propias herramientas y así se independizo.
Actualmente posee su propio taller que está situado en un lugar muy bien estratégico. El nos comenta que en el negocio recibe la ayuda de su hijo. Su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos, los cuales desea usar para las refacciones que hace. El agradece por la oportunidad de progreso que recibe de la fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 43, lives in his own house in the city of Itá.  He is married to Felicia, and they have two children.  He has had a mechanic shop for heavy vehicles for nine years.

He previously worked for another person, but in time he acquired his own tools and became independent.  He currently has his own shop in a good, strategic location.  He tells us that he gets help in the business from his son.  His goal is to continue working.  That way he will continue helping his family.

He is requesting the loan to buy replacement parts, which he wishes to use for the repairs he does.  He is grateful for the opportunity to make progress that he is getting from the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his shop.

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 27 años, se describe como una persona feliz, trabajadora y emprendedora que le gusta salir adelante por el bienestar de sus hijos. María vive con su madre y sus dos hijos en un sector fuera de la ciudad de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

María se dedica a bordar en manteles, centros de mesa, blusas, negocio que en el omento es muy difícil debido a que hay mucha competencia y María necesita mantener a sus hijos, es por eso que realiza su sexto crédito en Fodemi, que será invertido en la compra de rollos de tela e hilos por cajas para incrementar su producción y sacar nuevos modelos para que sus productos sean de calidad y sean aceptados en el mercado y de esta manera podrá sustentar los gastos de su familia.

María sueña en reconstruir su casa y comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
María, 27 years old, is described as a happy, hard-working, and entrepreneurial person who likes moving ahead for the well-being of her children. María lives with her mother and her two children in an area outside of the city of Ibarra in the province of Imbabura.

María embroiders tablecloths, table centerpieces, and blouses, a business which is very difficult at this time because there is a lot of competition, and María needs to support her children. This is why she is taking out her sixth loan with Fodemi, which will be invested in the purchase of rolls of cloth and boxes of thread in order to increase her production and come out with new items so that her products are of high quality and will be accepted in the market. In this way, she will be able to cover her family's expenses.

María dreams of rebuilding her house and buying a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of cloth and boxes of thread

loans.name: Rosa Margarita Garcia Torres

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 58 años de edad, es madre de un hijo de 20 años de edad, vive junto a él en la ciudad de Pisco ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país el cual es el “candelabro de Paracas y las Islas Ballestas”, asimismo tiene como una de las actividades principales la pesca y la agricultura. Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina” y en su tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear sobre todo para distraerse un poco. Ella solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado tener una carrera relacionada a las confecciones textiles.

Rosa trabaja en su negocio d eventa de ropa y libreria, ella le dedica a su trabajao alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 50 clientes en el dia, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y ofrece productos de calidad.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio (ropa de temporada de otoño y utlies de escritorio), lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, asi seguirá trabajando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño.” Darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Rosa is 58 years old and is the mother of a 20-year-old son. She lives with him in the city of Pisco, a city characterized as having one of the most important tourist attractions in the country, the Paracas candelabra and the Ballestas Islands. Also, fishing and farming are some of its principal activities. Like a good Peruvian, she enjoys the typical food of our country very much, so one of her favorite dishes is the delicious "Ají de Gallina" (chicken with chili peppers). In her free time, more than anything she likes to go out for a walk in order to divert herself a little. She only studied through the fifth level of secondary school, but she would have liked to have a career related to textile production. 

Rosa works in her business selling clothing and books. She works about 10 hours a day and can wait on up to 50 customers in a day. She thinks that her business is going well because she is friendly with the customers and she offers quality products.

Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business (clothing for the fall season and office supplies), which will allow her to have more variety in the products she offers. Thus, she will be able to improve her earnings and her quality of life, and in this way she will continue working in order to fulfill her biggest dream - to give her son a profession.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (clothing and writing implements)

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El señor Julio está casado su Señora es Alicia con quien tiene una despensa que atiende ella misma. Además de eso él tiene un local  al lado de su despensa, que es un taller de reparación de  bicicletas. Cuentan que tienen 3 hijos, quienes son los que los mueven a luchar día con día.
Son clientes antiguos de la fundación con 7 créditos cancelados en fecha. Se dedican a este trabajo hace más de 15 años. Son personas muy trabajadoras y gracias a la actividad que realiza han podido salir adelante e ir creciendo  en su micro- Empresa.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás insumos, los cuales les servirá para mantener bien abastecida su despensa. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Julio is married to his wife Alicia, who has a store she runs herself.  Additionally, Julio has space next door to the store that is a bicycle repair shop.  They have three children, who motivate them to move forward day after day.  They are old clients of the foundation with 7 loans completed on time.  They have done this type of work for more than 15 years.  They are very hard working people and thanks to this work they have been able to move forward and grow their small business.  Julio requests the loan to buy food, drinks, dairy, pastries, and other products that will help stock the store.  He is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for this opportunity he is receiving because it will help him a lot.

loans.use: buy products for his store.

loans.name: Beliza Sugey

texts.es:
Beliza convive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de diez años de edad, en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, sus impresionantes Dunas y por la “laguna de Huacachina”, conocida como el oasis de América”. Beliza como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida de nuestro país, por ello su palto favorito son los riquísimos “tallarines rojos”.

Con mucho esfuerzo logro tener sus negocio de venta de gallinas en el mercado de su ciudad desde hace cuatro años,  ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 50 clientes, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo ofrece productos de calidad.

Beliza está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar utensilios nuevos, como cuchillos, machetes de cocina, tablas de picar para su negocio, así podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio con utensilios en buen estado y sus clientes tendrán más confianza, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Beliza lives together with her husband and her young son, 10 years old, in the city of Ica. This city is characterized by its warm climate, its impressive sand dunes and the "Huacachina lake," known as "the oasis of the Americas." As a good Peruvian, Beliza likes the food of our country very much. Her favorite dish is the delicious "red noodles." 

With great effort she has been able to have her own business for the past four years, selling chickens in the market of her city. She dedicates herself to her work about 8 hours a day, and she can serve up to 50 customers. She believes that it is going well for her in her business because she is very friendly with the customers, and above all, she offers quality products. 

Beliza is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to your help she will be able to buy new utensils, such as knives, kitchen machetes, and cutting boards for her business. Thus, she will be able to offer better service with utensils in good condition, and her customers will have more confidence. This will permit her to keep working to fulfill her greatest dream: to have her own house and give her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy new utensils such as knives, kitchen machetes, and cutting boards.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
This is Marisa, 39, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a married to Richard, an employee, and the mother of two children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marisa maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Marisa is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Marisa hopes to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El comité “María de los Ángeles” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también hacen actividades en conjunto para que de esa forma puedan afrontar cualquier inconveniente.
Clemencia es una de las miembros del grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser chanchos y gallinas. Comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pues es de tiempo completo, pues debe de estar pendiente de sus animales todo el tiempo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados con lo cual podrá alimentar a los animales que cría. Ella agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “María de los Ángeles” group was formed when several neighbors from the Santaní community joined together.  All the members of the group carry out independent activities, but they also do things together in order to confront any challenges they might encounter.

Clemencia is one of the members of the group, and she tells us that she dedicates herself to raising animals such as pigs and chickens.  She notes that it is hard work that takes up all of her time, as she must tend to her animals on a continuous basis.

She requests this loan for the purchase of feed for the animals she raises.  She is thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for the help she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Las Roseñas Group

texts.es:
"Las Roseñas"se originó a través de promociones  que se realizaron en el barrio de las integrantes. Todas ellas son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar,  fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La sra Victorina es Presidenta del grupo, es comerciante, tiene venta de productos en general, su deseo es seguir progresando con la Fundación Paraguaya y que el grupo se vaya fortaleciendo cada día más, manifiesta que se siente muy a gusto en su comité y espera muchos beneficio más que la Fundación le están ofreciendo continuamente.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, harina, fideos, pan y demás insumos de primera necesidad, que es lo que más se vende. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por la ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Las Roseñas originated through promotions in the members' neighborhood.  All of them are from the same area, acquaintances and neighbors.  The goal of each one is to work, promote the spirit of solidarity, and reach the highest level of the program.

Victorina is the president of the group.  She is a merchant and sells general products.  Her desire is to continue progressing with Fundación Paraguaya and for the group to strengthen more every day.  She says she feels very comfortable in her communal bank and hopes for many more benefits, which the foundation is offering her continually.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of sugar, flour, noodles, bread, and other basic necessities, which is what she most sells.

She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the help she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, noodles, bread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mirando Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Mirando el Futuro” está conformado 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran chocolatería, amasandería y confección de ropa, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Gladys presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la tercera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, ella usa su cabello corto, el cual es de color castaño oscuro. Usa una blusa estampada en forma de ondas con colores blanco y café. Además lleva cruzada una pequeña cartera café y usa su reloj pulsera en la mano izquierda.
Ella es modista, por lo que se dedica a confeccionar y reparar ropa desde hace 40 años. Ha confeccionado diferentes tipos de vestimentas, incluso vestidos de novia. Gladys trabaja desde su casa, ya que habilitó un pequeño taller de costura en una de las habitaciones de su hogar. Ahí cuenta con una máquina de coser de costura recta y una maquina de costura overlock. 
Los materiales que necesita para su negocio, específicamente las telas. Las compra en la ciudad de Santiago.
Comenta que sus clientes solicitan sus servicios, para realizar ropa de colegio, trajes para fiestas y también reparaciones de ropa. 
Gladys trabaja de lunes a domingo, durante las tardes, sin embargo debido a la gran demanda que tiene, a veces dedica más tiempo trabajando hasta la madrugada.
Con el crédito comprará hilos, telas y mandará a repara una de sus maquinas. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, se deben a que los ingresos generados le permiten ayudar económicamente a su familia. Además comenta que quiere arreglar algunas habitaciones de la casa.
Gladys vive junto a su marido, su nieta de 27 años y bisnieta de 7 años de edad. Uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es viajar a la ciudad de Punta Arenas, Chile. 
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones del Banco comunal, comenta que le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de contabilidad y distribución de sus ingresos. Por otro lado, el grupo del cual forma parte es muy comprometido y unido.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Mirando el Futuro" ("Looking to the Future"). It is composed of 19 entrepreneurs, who devote themselves to various lines of work, among them chocolate making, a bakery, and making clothing. All the members are from the city of Rancagua.

Gladys is president of the group. In the photo she is in the third row in the third place from right to left, with short dark brown hair and a white and brown wave-patterned blouse. She also has a small brown purse across her chest and a wristwatch on her left hand.

She is a dressmaker, and she has made and repaired clothing for 40 years. She has made various kinds of clothing, including wedding dresses. Gladys works from her home, since she fitted out a small dressmaking workshop in one of the rooms of her house. There she has one lockstitch sewing machine and one overlock sewing machine.

She buys the materials she needs for her business, specifically the fabric, in the city of Santiago.

She notes that her customers ask for her services to make school clothing and party outfits, and also to repair clothing.

Gladys works every day during the afternoon. Nevertheless, due to the great demand she has, sometimes she spends more time working until dawn.

With the loan, she will buy thread and fabric, and will send out one of her machines for repair. 

She is motivated to continue the business is due to the income it generates, which allows her to help her family financially. She also notes that she wants to fix up some of the rooms in her house.

Gladys lives with her husband, her granddaughter, 27 years old, and her great-granddaughter, 7 years old. One of her personal dreams is to travel to the city of Punta Arenas, Chile. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, since it has allowed her to invest in her business. With respect to the trainings delivered at the communal bank's meetings, she notes that they have helped her to learn new accounting and income distribution strategies. On the other hand, the group she is part of is very committed and united.

Rancagua is in the Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins region. It is a modern city and the capital of the main producer and exporter of and fruit and wine in Chile. It is also a mining city, since the world's largest underground mine, "El Teniente", with 4,500 km of tunnels, is located in its mountain range.

loans.use: to purchase thread and fabric, and to send one of her machines out for repair

loans.name: Jose Julio Perez Nieto

texts.es:
Jose tiene 50 años y tiene un pequeño de 14 años por el que se esfuerza día a día para poder sacarlo adelante junto a su esposa. Actualmente ellos se dedican a la venta de desayunos y refrescos en las mañanas, lo que requiere que se despierten muy temprano para que realicen la preparación de los alimentos que ofrecerán a sus clientes. Esta pequeña y humilde familia vive en la ciudad de Ica, Perú, lugar reconocido por el intenso sol en el transcurso del año y por ofrecer un viaje en tubulares a las inmensas dunas que esta ciudad posee.

El y su esposa atienden durante 6 horas solo en la mañana, básicamente su labor consiste en la preparación y venta de alimentos a las distintas personas que transitan por la calle en donde venden. Jose sabe que le va bien en su negocio porque cada vez sus clientes lo recomiendan más, lo que le ha permitido establecerse mejor.

Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Jose podrá realizar la compra de una parrillera y una cocina industrial con el fin de mejorar la calidad y disminuir el tiempo de cocción de sus productos, lo mismo que les permitirá ahorrar su tiempo. Jose sabe que con mucho esfuerzo logrará su gran sueño, tener un gran restaurant en el centro de la ciudad de Ica y así poder incrementar muchísimos más sus ingresos diarios.
texts.en:
Jose is 50 years old and has a 14-year old child who, working with his wife, is the reason he fights each day to get ahead.  Currently, they dedicate themselves to selling breakfast and beverages in the mornings, which requires them to rise very early so they can make the food they will offer to their customers.  This small and humble family lives in the city of Ica, Perú, a place known for the intense sun throughout the year and for offering tubing trips on the huge dunes that the city has.

He and his wife work for 6 hours only in the morning and, basically, their labor consists of making and selling food to the different people who travel the street where they sell.  Jose knows that business is going well for him because his customers recommend him more each time, which has allowed him to better establish himself.

With the help of the Kiva loan, Jose would be able to buy a grill and industrial oven with the aim of improving quality and reducing the time it takes to prepare his products.  This, at the same time, will help him save time.  Jose knows that, with much effort, he will manage his grand dream of having a large restaurant in the center of the city of Ica, and this way he will be able to increase his daily income much more.

loans.use: to buy a grill and industrial oven.

loans.name: Marcos Fleitas

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcos es de Ciudad del Este, es casado con la Sra Basilia, ambos tienen 2 hijos pequeños que se van a la escuela y quienes dependen de ellos.
Marcos  se dedica a la venta de Materiales de construcción. Se inicio en esta actividad vendiendo Ladrillos que fabricaba un amigo, además de esa actividad ellos tienen una casa de decoraciones y alquileres de sillas y mesas para cumpleaños. Gracias al trabajo que realizan están educando a sus hijos y saliendo adelante con sus obligaciones.
Marcos solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción, con los cuales podrá abastecerse y de esa forma seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Marcos is from Ciudad del Este, is married to Basilia, and they have 2 small children who go to school and still depend on them.

Marcos dedicates himself to selling construction materials.  He started in this activity selling bricks made by a friend.  In addition to this, they have a business selling decorations and chair and table rentals for birthday parties.  Thanks to the work they do, they are educating their children and getting ahead with their obligations.

Marcos requests a loan to buy construction materials, with which he will be able to supply his business and continue working as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Josselin

texts.es: Josselin es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Sumaqcha, tiene 23 años, es madre de una hija, se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, le gusta mucho Finca porque aprende  mucho acerca de compartir, la autoestima, ha formado muchas amistades en su Bancomunal, y cada capacitación aprende mucho acerca de cómo invertir, esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para poder iniciar un negocio. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la zapatos.
texts.en:
Josselin is a member of the "Señor de Sumaqcha" communal bank. She is 23 years old and has a daughter. She works selling shoes by catalogue. 

She likes Finca a lot because she learns a lot about sharing and self esteem and she has formed a lot of friendships in her communal bank. With each training session she learns a lot about how to invest.

She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given to be able to start her business. Now she will invest this loan in the purchase of shoes.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Maria Orzusa

texts.es:
María tiene 27 años vive con sus padres en casa propia en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Ella es cantinera en una escuela de su ciudad, en lo que la ayuda su mama.
Están en la Institución hace más de 6 años, comentan que tienen muy buenas relaciones con los profesores y alumnos y por las minutas que preparan para la venta que son muy ricas y sobre todo muy higiénicos. Los productos que venden son empanadas, milanesas, sopa paraguaya bebidas como gaseosas  jugos naturales frutas como manzana, banana, pera.
Solicito el préstamo para la compra de productos en general, como ser bebidas, carnes, golosinas, condimentos, y demás productos para seguir trabajando. Ella esta agradecida con la fundación y con Kiva por la oportunidad de progreso que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
María is 27 years old and lives with her parents in their own home in the city of Carapeguá.  She is a grocer in a school in her city, which her mother helps her with.

They have been with the Institution for more than 6 years, and comment that they have a very good relationship with the professors and students because of the delicious snacks they prepare to sell; also, most of all, because their business is very clean.  The products they sell are empanadas, milanesas, Paraguayan soup, beverages such as sodas, natural juices, and fruits such as apples, bananas, and pears.

She requests this loan to buy general products such as beverages, meats, candy, condiments, and other products to continue working.  They grateful to the foundation Kiva for the opportunity to progress they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Sumaqcha, tiene 24 años, es madre de un niña, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, esta casada, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace mas de 6 meses y este tiempo ella ha aprendido mucho de cómo hacer negocio, agradece a Finca porque le ayudaron mucho a poder ahorrar y formar un capital, ahora esta creciendo en todo aspecto. Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Karen is a member of the "Señor de Sumaqcha" communal bank. She is 24 years old, married and has a daughter. She works selling beauty products by catalog. 

She has been working with Fina Perú for 6 months and in this period she has learned a lot about doing business. She is grateful to Finca because they have helped her a lot to be able to save up money and to develop capital. Currently she is growing in all respects. She will invest this loan in the purchase of beauty products.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en: Analie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Analie has a shop that makes and sells snacks like macaroni and fruit salad. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks like fruit salad. Analie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Analie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks like fruit salad

loans.name: Yanett

texts.es: Yanett es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Sumaqcha, tiene 32 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, es madre de un niño, esta muy contenta en Finca porque aprende mucho acerca de cómo llevar su familia y su negocio, le gusta porque esta progresando y desea en un futuro tener una casa propia. Ahora con este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza.
texts.en: Yanett is a member of the Señor de Sumaqcha cooperative bank.  She is 32 years old and dedicates herself to selling beauty products.  She has been a member of Finca Perú for 3 years and is the mother of one child.  She is very content in Finca because she learns a lot about how to manage her family and her business, and because she is progressing and wants, in the future, to have her own house.  She will use this current loan to invest in the purchase of beauty products.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Camino al Éxito”, está conformado por 15 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran preparación de pan amasado, venta de abarrotes, artículos de bazar, preparación de comida rápida y costuras. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Colina, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Candy presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila, inclinada hacia delante y un poco agachada. El corte de su cabello es una melena y es de color castaño claro. Además usa una polera manga corta, la cual es de color azul marino. 
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo ropa nueva de adultos y niños, de acuerdo a cada temporada. Trabaja en este negocio, desde hace dos años. Sus productos los vende desde su casa.
Su horario de trabajo es durante las tardes de lunes a domingo.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras y comercios, en los cuales los precios sean más baratos.
Con el crédito comprará materiales de construcción para habilitar una habitación de su casa en un local. Además invertirá en mercadería para su negocio. 
Una de sus metas es contar con una gran cantidad de mercadería, espera invertir en ropa más exclusiva. 
Candy vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijas de 7 y 3 años de edad, su hija mayor asiste al colegio y su hija pequeña asiste al jardín infantil. Uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es comprar una camioneta, la cual le permitiría trasladar su mercadería, de esta manera vendería en sectores rurales o periféricos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el préstamo le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal, del cual forma parte comenta que sus integrantes son muy colaboradores y comprometidos.
Colina es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) ubicada al norte de la misma. Actualmente es centro de importantes inversiones, principalmente en el área agro industrial, debido a la instalación de grandes e importantes empresas, que de paso entregan un gran número de empleos a la comunidad. Es también un área de parcelaciones de agrado, lo que ha contribuido a aumentar considerablemente el número de habitantes. También cuenta con espacios adecuados al turismo, tales como termas, deporte en la Laguna Piedra Roja y montañismo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Camino al Éxito” [Road to Success]. It is made up of 15 entrepreneur who work in different areas. Among these are making bread, selling groceries, miscellaneous items, making fast food and sewing. All of them belong to the community of Colina, located in the city of Santiago.

Candy is the president of the communal bank. In the photo she is in the second row, leaning forward and a little bent over. Her hair is shoulder length and light brown. She is also wearing a navy blue t-shirt. 
 
She is a merchant, specifically she sells new clothes for adults and children, according to the season. She has been doing this for two years. She sells her products from her house. Her work schedule is afternoons Mondays through Sundays. She buys her merchandise at distributors and stores, where the prices are cheaper. With the loan, she will buy construction materials in a locale in a room in her house. She will also invest in more exclusive clothing. 

Candy lives with her husband and two daughters, aged 7 and 3. Her oldest daughter goes to high school and her youngest daughter goes to nursery school. One of her personal dreams is is to buy a pick up truck which will allow her to transport her merchandise. That way she could sell in rural or marginal areas. She is very happy and grateful for the support offered by the Fondo Esperanza, since the loan will allow her to invest in her business. 

In regards to the communal bank she belongs to, she says tha the members are very cooperative and dedicated. Colina is a community in the metropolitan area (where Santiago is the capital of Chile), located in the north of town. Right now it is the center of important investment, mainly in the area of agricultural industry, because of large installations and important businesses. These also bring a lot of jobs to the area. There are also a lot of subdivisions in the area, which contributes to the number of residents.  It also has areas with a lot of tourism, such as thermal springs and sports in the the Laguna Piedra Roja and mountain climbing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to remodel a room in the locale in her house. She will also invest in merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Nelida Rodriguez

texts.es:
La señorita Nelida es de la ciudad de Santaní, vive con su abuela quien  tiene 55 años de edad. Ella se dedica al faenamiento de Chanchos y además de eso tiene un copetín al costado de una  ruta muy transitada.
Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha día a día por un mejor  porvenir y un bienestar para ella y su familia. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo como comerciante.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder abastecer su copetín con gaseosas, golosinas, galletitas y demás insumos que son los que más ella vende. Está muy contenta por la ayuda que está recibiendo y le gustaría poder continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Nelida is from the city of  Santaní. She lives with her grandmother who is 55 years old. She slaughters pigs and she also has a food stall next to a very busy route.

She is described as a very hardworking and enterprising woman who fights day to day for a better future and for her own wellbeing and her family's. Her goal is to keep working and in this way keep growing as a merchant. She is asking for a loan to stock her food stall with sodas, cookies and other items that she sells the most. She is very happy with the help she is receiving and she would like to be able to keep working.

loans.use: to buy items for her food stall.

loans.name: Lucila Carlonita

texts.en: Lucila Carlonita is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Lucila Carlonita has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Lucila Carlonita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lucila Carlonita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is taking out another Kiva loan of 60,000 KES to boost her tailoring business. With the loan, she wants to purchase sewing threads, linings, needles, canvas and another sewing machine. With the previous loan she was able to expand and meet her customers' demand. She dreams of establishing a dress-making school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sewing threads, linings, needles, canvas and another sewing machine.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Cynthia has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She is also into mineral water refilling. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Cynthia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cynthia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Jesus Tasayco Hernandez

texts.es:
Jesus tiene 19 años, es un joven muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo tiene un clima cálido, hermosas playas y sus pobladores se caracteriza por tener una buena sazón para la preparación de cualquier platillo. En su tiempo libre a Jesus le gusta escuchar música y jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos, también  le gusta degustar uno de sus platillos favoritos que es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”. Con mucho esfuerzo Jesus logro estudiar una carrera Técnica y por ello el es Técnico Electricista.

Con mucha dedicación el trabaja como chofer de Taxi, trabaja alrededor de 12 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el dio, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy respetuoso con los clientes.

Jesús está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su vehículo y poder comprar llantas y algunos accesorios para su vehículo, de esta manera el podrá tener un vehículo en buen estado y más seguro para los clientes a los cuales ofrece sus servicio, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para poder cumplir su gran sueño:”Estudiar una carrera universitaria y tener un local de servicios de mantenimiento de vehículos”.
texts.en:
Jesus is 19 years old. He is a very hard-working and enthusiastic young man, and lives in the city of Chincha. This city is known for being the birthplace of great Peruvian sport heroes. As well, it has a warm climate, beautiful beaches, and its inhabitants are known for the good way they use seasoning in the preparation of any dish. 

In his free time Jesús likes to listen to music and play soccer with his friends and neighbors. He also likes to sample one of his favorite dishes, the very delicious "arroz chaufa" (Chinese-style fried rice). 

With much effort, Jesús managed to study for a technical career, and he is an electrical technician.  He works as a taxi driver and shows great dedication. He works around 12 hours daily, and can serve up to 20 customers in a day. He thinks his business is going well because he is very respectful to his customers.

Jesús is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to do maintenance work on his vehicle, and be able to buy tires and some accessories. This will enable him to have a vehicle that is in good condition and safer for the customers he serves. This will allow him to have greater income and continue his daily struggle to fulfill his great dream: "To study for a university degree and have a vehicle maintenance shop."

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada, tiene 49 años, es madre de 4 hijos, ella es madre soltera, desde que su esposo se fue ella ha tratado de salir adelante sola, manifiesta que sin la ayuda de Finca ella no hubiera podido, esta muy agradecida. Para Victoria Finca Perú es mas que una entidad que da préstamos, para ella son como su familia, así ella pudo salir adelante, trata de hacer todo lo que puede, se dedica a viajar a las ferias llevando ropa y zapatos, los domingos vende comida por su casa, ahora siente que su negocio ha crecido, y ahora con el préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y ropa.
texts.en: Victoria is a member of the Alborada communal bank. She is 49 years old and the mother of 4 children. She is a single mother; since her husband left, she has tried to get ahead by herself. She reports that without the help of FINCA, she would not have been able to do so, and she is very grateful. For Victoria, FINCA Peru is more than an entity that provides loans; for her they are like her family. In this way she has been able to get ahead, trying to do everything she can. Her business is traveling to the markets with clothing and shoes. On Sundays, she sells food from her home. Now she feels that her business has grown, and now with the loan she has requested she will invest in buying clothing and groceries.

loans.use: to buy clothing and groceries.

loans.name: Juan Rodriguez Arroyo

texts.es: Juan, tiene la edad  de 65 años, está casado,  vive con la esposa y un hijo. El con el crédito pretende comprar  las bolsas para hacer el almacigo y además ayudar con la mano de obra para realizar el almacigo, también comprar  insumos  como abonos, herbicidas, fumigaciones, El tiene pensado comprar la semilla y las bolsas para hacer el almacigó y con los insumos  poder obtener una plantación de muy buena calidad,  y así poder venderla a un excelente precio al mercado de la localidad, así poder  obtener más ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juan, 65, is married and lives with his wife and one son. With this loan he plans to buy bags to transplant coffee, to hire workers to help with transplanting the seedlings, and also to buy inputs like compost and fumigation. He wants to buy seeds and bags to make the seedlings and with the inputs he will get a very high quality planting so that he can sell at an excellent price in the local market. This will earn him more profits and give him a better quality of life and financial stability. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy inputs for transplanting coffee plants.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia a es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada, tiene 51 años, se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares y ropa, es madre de 3 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 13 años, ella esta muy bien en Finca porque le ayudan a  tener una base para mantener un negocio próspero, casi todo lo que sabe lo pudo aprender con Finca Perú. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de ropa y útiles escolares.
texts.en: Teodosia, 51, is a member of the village bank Alboroda. This mother of three sells clothing and school supplies. She has worked with Finca Peru for 13 years, and likes it because they help her to have a basis for maintaining a prosperous business. Almost everything she knows she learned at Finca Peru. Now with this loan she will invest in the purchase of clothing and school supplies.

loans.use: to buy clothing and school supplies.

loans.name: Cheikh Tidiane

texts.fr: Cheikh est un homme marié, père de 3 enfants dont l'un fréquente l'école. Il exerce le métier de menuisier métallique et tient un atelier sur la route principale de son quartier. Il fabrique des tables, des chaises, des lits qu'il vend à ses clients. Il sollicite actuellement un pret de 400000f pour acheter du fer. Son ambition est de moderniser son équipement.
texts.en: Cheikh is a married man and the father of three children, one of whom is in school. Cheikh works in the metal furniture trade and has a workshop on the main road in his district. He makes tables, chairs, and beds that he sells to his customers. He is currently requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy some iron. His ambition is to modernize his equipment.

loans.use: to buy iron

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada, tiene 49 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 12 años, ella en Finca ha podido formar su personalidad, los consejos de tantas promotoras le ayudaron a poder salir adelante las capacitaciones para ella son primordiales, recuerda mucho que antes ella tenia muy poco capital ahora esta muy bien las cosas le van mucho mejor, ella ha cumplido con muchos cargos en la Junta Directiva de su Banco Comunal, ahora ella es Fiscal y trata de hacer su función de la mejor manera. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en al compra de ropa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Alborada" communal bank. She is 49, and the mother of two children. She sells clothing, and has been working with Finca Perú for 12 years. 

In Finca she has been able to develop her character. The advice of so many field representatives has helped her to succeed. The training is fundamental for her.  She well remembers that before, she had very little capital; now she is doing very well, and things are going much better for her.

She has carried out many responsibilities on the Board of Directors of her communal bank. Now she is treasurer, and tries to perform her role in the proper way. She will use the loan she is applying for to purchase clothing.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 63 años,  es madre de 2 hijos y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 17 años, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, con los préstamo que le dan ella pudo incrementar su negocio, pudo mejorara la fachada de su casa, con las capacitaciones le ayudan a como hacer un buen presupuesto, y como  distribuir bien el dinero para que le pueda alcanzar para las necesidades básicas, esta muy feliz perteneciendo a la gran familia de Finca. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar y bebidas.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the village bank Amaquella. She is 63, a mother of 2 children and has been a member of Finca Peru for 17 years. She sells groceries. With the loans she has been able to increase her business and improve the facade of her home. The trainings help her to make a good budget and distribute her money well so that she can meet all of her basic needs. She's very happy to be part of the big Finca family.

Now she will use a loan to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and drinks.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and drinks.

loans.name: Chan Sary

texts.en:
Chan Sary, 58, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of buying fish paste and smoked fish to resell for over ten years, earning approximately USD 8 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns approximately USD 7 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Chan Sary is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and fuel to use in her family's farming work. 

In the future, she would like to purchase more farmland for growing rice in the dry season and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger in order to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and fuel to use in her farming work.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes, en este tiempo ha visto que su vida como su negocio ha mejorado mucho, el ahorro para ella tiene mucha importancia y eso lo pudo aprender en Finca, se pudo comprar una congeladora, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para 6 meses.
texts.en: Lorenza is a member of the village bank Amaqella. She is the owner of a grocery store and has seen during this time that her life and her business have improved a lot. Saving is very important to her, and she was able to learn this from Finca. She bought a freezer and now will use the loan to buy groceries for 6 months.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale.

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.ru: Мехрангез более восьми лет предоставляет услугу, она в основном занимается шитьем. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Mehrangez has been sewing to order for more then eight years. She is 29 years old, married and has two children. She is taking out this loan to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Mahmatali

texts.ru: Махматали житель района Джиликул. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его дети маленькие. Он занимается растениеводством. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 27 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений для урожая пшеницы и моркови.
texts.en: Mahmatali is a resident of Jilikul region. He is 43 years old, married and has six children. His kids are still young. Mahmatali is a farmer and has been growing crops for 27 years. He is taking out this loan to purchase fertilizer for planting wheat and carrots.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Arzigul

texts.ru: Арзигул проживает в районе Джиликул. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии Арзигул работает 27 лет. Кроме того она занимается растениеводством. Кредит берет для посева картошки и кукурузы.
texts.en: Arzigul lives in the Jilikul region. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. Arzigul has a college degree in education and has been working as a teacher for 27 years. She also farms to supplement her income. Arzigul is taking out this loan to plant potatoes and corn.

loans.use: to plant potatoes and corn

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Nelly es soltera, tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Curuguaty, ella es comerciante, tiene una tienda donde vende prendas de vestir, y demás tipos de prendas de toda variedad. Ella desde muy joven se dedica en este trabajo con su madre.
En el año 2,009 empezó su propio negocio con la ayuda de su madre en el mismo salón donde se encuentra ubicado actualmente. Nos comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que siempre está muy bien abastecida con todo tipo de prendas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de uniformes escolares, con lo cual podrá abastecerse, ya que está empezando la época de clases y es necesario que este abastecida para la demanda.
texts.en:
Nelly is 20 years old and single. She lives in the city of Curuguaty and is a shopkeeper. She has a store where she sells articles of clothing, including all varieties of clothing. She has been doing this work with her mother since she was very young.

In 2009 she started her own business with her mother's help in the same space where she is currently located. She tells us that she has a very good customer base because she is always well stocked with all types of clothing.

She is requesting a loan to purchase school uniforms to stock her store. This is because the school session is beginning and she needs to be stocked up to meet demand.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms.

loans.name: Sissigbe Group

texts.fr: SISSIGBE est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Emma (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Emma est mariée à un certain Pierre. Emma n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, trois restent à la charge de Emma et de son mari. Emma vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Emma mène comme activité la vente d'emballages vides, de maïs et de la farine de manioc de façon secondaire à son domicile. Emma exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. Emma s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Emma sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SISSIGBE un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit reçu antérieurement a été  bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Sissigbe group is composed of four persons living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Emma (raising her hand in the photo) is 34 years old. Her husband’s name is Pierre. Emma did not attend school. The spouses have five children, some of whom are in school. Three of the children are still in the care of Emma and her husband. Emma lives together with her husband and children and, jointly with her husband, provides for various household needs. In order to support herself, Emma sells empty containers and also, as a secondary activity, corn and manioc (cassava) flour out of her home. Emma has been in this business for five years. Emma stocks up in a region of Benin. With the goal of better responding to growing customer demand and increasing her revenues, Emma, together with the other members of the Sissigbe group, is requesting her second loan from ALIDé. Their first loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy empty containers,  bags of corn and manioc flour.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. 
Josephine has a shop that sells firewood by the bundle. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stock of firewood for sale.
Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of firewood for sale

loans.name: Guerrero Rosero

texts.es:
Juan es una persona tranquila, justa, muy amigable pero sobre todo responsable en su trabajo. Juan vive con sus papas en un sector cercano a San Gabriel en la Provincia del Carchi.

Juan trabaja solo en la crinaza de cerdos, este negocio empezó con la compra venta de chanchos hace tres años, con Fodemi realiza su tercer crédito el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de medicina y alimentación para las chanchitas paridoras y también para mejorar la infraestructura de los corrales, este proceso de inversión ayudará a Juan a que su negocio crezca y mejoren sus ingresos económicos que a su vez ayudarán a mantener o a sustentar los gastos de su hogar.

Juan desea seguir trabajando con la crianza de animales, para que con la ganancia pueda construir una casa propia y poder formar una familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a quiet, fair, very friendly person, but above all responsible in his work. Juan lives with parents in an area near San Gabriel in Carchi province.

Juan works alone, raising pigs. He started this business three years ago, with the buying and selling of pigs. He is undertaking his third loan with Fodemi, and he will use it it to buy medicine and feed for his breeder sows, and also to improve the infrastructure of his pens. 

This investment will help Juan's business grow and his income improve, and at the same time help maintain and support his household expenses.

Juan wishes to continue raising animals, so that with his earnings he can build his own house and be able to raise a family.

loans.use: To buy medicine and feed for his breeder sows, and improve the infrastructure of his pens.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes sells cooking utensils and cassava in Mpohor near Takoradi. She has been in this business for 2 years now. She is married. Her husband is a driver and they have 6 dependents.  Agnes uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will need a loan to purchase more cooking utensils and cassava for sale. With the new profit, Agnes hope to build a shop to enable her to sell her utensils.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils and cassava for sale

loans.name: Felictas Fortunata
