Angelina hopes to give her children a good future and a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy computer parts and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en: Rochelle is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Rochelle provides transportation services using a motorcycle with a sidecar. Her husband is the driver. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for her motorcycle. Rochelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rochelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Christ Est Vivant Group

texts.fr: Le groupe CHRIST EST VIVANT est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Diane est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Diane est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un tourneur du nom de Gildas. Diane n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Diane vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Diane vend depuis dix ans des mèches, des produits cosmétiques et des tissus de façon secondaire dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Diane s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Diane sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe CHRIST EST VIVANT, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The CHRIST EST VIVANT group is made up of four people who live in the same neighborhood. The is the third time that this group has asked ALIDé for financial help, in order to increase their level of activity. The group's representative, Diane, has her hand raised in the photo. Diane is 30 years old and married to a turner named Gildas. Diane did not go to school. The couple has three children, all of whom go to school and are in their care. Diane lives with her husband and children. The couple share the household's various expenses. 

To help meet the family's needs, for the last ten years Diane has sold hair extensions and cosmetic products, along with fabric as a secondary business, in her neighborhood. This activity allows her to meet her needs without too much difficulty. Diane obtains her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase turnover and revenue, Diane and the other CHRIST EST VIVANT members are asking ALIDé for a third loan. The two previous loans were fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, cosmetic products, and fabric.

loans.name: Aliboi

texts.ru: Алибой энергичный молодой человек. У него 3 маленьких детей, которых он очень любит. Алибой занимается откормом скота, сейчас его скот находиться на пастбище в горах. Также у него есть небольшой ларек с продуктами питания, так как животноводство имеет не постоянный доход, для этого он и имеет дополнительный доход от продажи продуктов питания. Он получает у нас второй кредит и с каждым разом старается увеличивать поголовье скота.
texts.en: Aliboi is an energetic young man.  He has three small children, whom he loves very much.  Aliboi is involved in fattening up livestock, which is currently at a pasture in the mountains.  He also has a small kiosk, where he sells food products.  Because animal husbandry does not have a consistent income, he earns an additional income from sales of food products.  This is his second loan, and he tries to increase his livestock headcount each time.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура- женщина 44 лет, замужем, имеет двоих детей.Её муж нигде не работает,занимается птицеводством и откормом баранов.Она сама работает гладильщицей в швейной фабрике.С наступлением весны Манзура стала чувствовать себя не важно поэтому хочет провезти стационарное лечение, поэтому решила получить кредит. Её сын хочет сам погашать кредит матери, он работает мастером по евро ремонту квартир, и его доход вполне хватает на погашение требуемого кредита. Манзура благодарна инвесторам  KIVA, за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Manzura is a 44 year-old woman, who has two children.  Her husband is not employed anywhere and is involved in poultry farming and fattening up sheep.  Manzura works as an ironing lady at a sewing factory.  With onset of spring, Manzura started to feel unwell, and this is why she wants to obtain this loan in order to get a hospital treatment.  Her son wants to repay his mother's loan by himself.  He works as a contractor, specializing in euro-repairs of apartments, and his income is quite sufficient to repay the requested loan.  Manzura is grateful to the Kiva investors for the support and understanding.

loans.use: to obtain medical treatment

loans.name: Eduardo Atilio De La Cruz Espino

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre que tiene una pequeña de 16 años por la que se desvive día a día y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro y parejo para darle lo mejor. Él disfruta mucho pasar tiempo con ella y llevarla a pasear en el auto que posee. Eduardo vive en la ciudad de Ica, actualmente no vive con su hija debido a que es separado, pero está muy contento por poder verla y visitarla el mayor tiempo posible.

Eduardo es un hombre que trabaja diariamente brindando el servicio de transporte público en su propio auto en el cercado de la ciudad de Ica, actualmente labora un promedio de 10 horas diarias y sabe que le está yendo bien porque es una persona responsable y prudente al momento de conducir su automóvil. 

El sabe que su auto ya está un poco viejo y es por eso que desea  realizarle el mantenimiento general y también realizar el cambio de llantas que necesita, con este arreglo podrá realizar su trabajado de manera más segura y así con el tiempo tramitar la compra de un nuevo auto y así su hija podrá convertirse en una gran profesional , su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a man with a 16 year old daughter for whom he works daily and is prepared to work hard to provide the best for her.  He really enjoys spending time with her and taking her for rides in his car.  Eduardo lives in the city of Ica.  He doesn’t live with his daughter because he is separated, but he is very happy to be able to see her and visit her as much as possible.

Eduardo works every day, providing public transportation with his own car around Ica.  He works ten hours a day and knows that things are going well for him because he is a responsible and prudent person when he drives.

He knows that his car is a bit old and so he wants to perform general maintenance and also replace the tires.  These repairs will allow him to work more safely and eventually allow him to buy a new car.  He wants to see his daughter become a professional.  This is his greatest dream.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Jonathan Gerardo

texts.es: Jonathan Gerardo, tiene la edad 22 de  años, está soltero y vive con sus padres. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de una vaca de leche para vender la leche y hacer queso también para la venta. El cuenta con dos vacas más en su poder y lo que pretende es fortalecer el proyecto. El quiere producir más leche y queso y un poco de natilla,  para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus padres y crecer con el proyecto de vacas de leche. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jonathan Gerardo is 22; he is single and lives with his parents. With the loan, he is seeking to buy a dairy cow in order to sell milk and make cheese, which he will also sell. He already has two cows, and what he seeks to do is strengthen his project. He wants to produce more milk and cheese, and a little bit of custard, in order to later sell it in the local market or surrounding villages. He wants to generate greater profits for his own wellbeing and that of his parents, and expand the dairy cows project. It is the first loan that he receives from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans with state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de 52 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa exterior e interior y también tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende al detal dulce de leche o arequipe.  Ella es una mujer  que tiene 6 hijos en las edades de 26 a 31 años y entre ellos hay dos pares de mellos;  todos ellos son su alegría y sueña con que cada día de su vida prosperen paso a paso.  En sus 16 años de experiencia ha trabajado mucho, inicialmente antes de dedicarse a esta actividad comercial,  trabajó empleada en una familia, pero cuando crecieron sus hijos no quisieron que ella continuara en esta actividad; así fue como con el producto de su liquidación, invirtió en prendas que vendió entre sus amigas y con las cuales les fue muy bien y con ellas logró hacer crecer su mercado y logró diversificar su oferta. Sus compras las hace en el centro de la ciudad cuando hay ofertas  importantes, promociones y saldos,  que le salen a un mejor precio. Por eso cuando las vende le gana dinero, sin recargar tanto a sus clientes, que le compran a crédito. En su negocio dos de sus hijos recuperan su cartera, contribuyendo así con el desempeño del negocio. Sonia también tiene otra actividad productiva, pues compra galones de arequipes de 2 a tres veces por semana y los envasa en porciones unitarias en vasos de una onza. Este último negocio ha tenido mucha acogida entre sus clientes, que los compran como golosinas para que sus hijos dispongan de ellas y se deleiten. La familia que Sonia conforma con sus hijos es muy unida, por eso en cada paso que da ella es respaldada; con ellos  comparte gastos y le ayudan en todo. En su venta de arequipe no necesita de activos fijos, pues no maneja inventarios. Como Sonia es una mujer tan cociente de la oportunidad también se dedica a la venta de frituras, que traslada a otro barrio donde tiene un punto de ventas,  atendido por uno de sus hijos y estos son ingresos adicionales que también recibe. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancías variadas en promoción. Su credikiva es una inversión exitosa,  porque le permite tener un dinero disponible para responder a pedidos, ya que  los plazos otorgados a sus clientes,  muchas veces no le facilitan el dar una respuesta oportuna a los nuevos compradores a crédito y esto con su credikiva será posible.
texts.en:
Sonia, 52, sells clothes and underwear and also has a business selling “dulce de leche” or “arequipe” [caramel].  She has six children whose ages range between 26 and 31 years; among them is a pair of twins.  All of them are her joy and she dreams that they will make progress step by step every day of their lives.

In her 16 years of experience she has worked very hard.  Initially before going into this commercial activity, she worked as a domestic employee for a family but when her children grew up they didn’t want her to continue with this activity so she used the money she got from her severance pay and bought some articles of clothing that she sold among her friends.  She did very well with them and managed to increase her market and to diversify her offer.

She does her purchases in the center of the city when there are important sales, promotions and close-out sales that mean better prices.  This way when she sells them she earns money without having to charge her customers who buy on credit so much.  Two of her children help out collecting payment thus contributing to the business’ operation.

Sonia has an additional productive activity because she buys gallons of arequipe twice or three times a week that she repackages in single serving containers of one ounce each.  This last business has been very well received by her customers who buy them as treats for their children to enjoy.

The family that Sonia forms with her children is very united which is why every step she takes is supported; she shares expenses with them and they help her out in everything.  Her arequipe sales don’t require fixed assets since she keeps no standing inventory.

Because Sonia is aware of opportunities, she also sells fried fast food that she takes to a different neighborhood where she has a sales point one of her children tends to and this is additional income she also receives.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she will use to buy assorted merchandise that’s on special promotion.  Her Kiva loan is a successful investment because it allows her to have money on hand to respond to orders because the time frame she offers her customers sometimes prevents her from being able to respond in a timely fashion to new credit customers and with the Kiva loan this will be possible.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise that's on special promotion.

loans.name: Orostamo

texts.ru: Оростамо жительница района Хамадони. Она замужем. Ей 41 год. У нее трое детей. Оростамо предоставляет услугу, она портниха. В основном она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Кредит берет для покупки двух швейных машинок и тканей.
texts.en: Orostamo lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Orostamo offers seamstress services, sewing mainly traditional dresses. She is taking this loan to buy two sewing machines and fabric.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines and fabric

loans.name: 20 De Julio Group

texts.es:
20 de julio es el grupo formado por 20 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción, ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que siempre se esfuerzan al máximo para poder ayudar a sus familias y sus hijos. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Marcela es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y nos comenta que siempre tiene muy buena venta, ya que está muy bien abastecida y surtida. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma seguir creciendo como microempresario.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, para mantener surtido su negocio, y de esa forma continuar trabajando y ayudando a su familia. Agradecen todas las miembros por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
“20 de Julio” (July 20) is a group formed by 20 women from the city of Asunción.  They are very hardworking, enterprising people who always strive to the maximum degree to help their families and their children.  The group is currently in the third cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women Program.

Marcela is one of the group members.  She sells all sorts of clothes and comments that her sales are very good because she’s well stocked.  Her goal is to be able to continue working and growing as a micro businesswoman.

She requested the loan to buy clothes to keep her business stocked and continue working to help her family.  All the members are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Nubia Esther Iglesias Gonzalez

texts.es: Nubia compró con su credikiva electrodomésticos menores, que vendió a crédito a sus clientes y aumentó su cartera de cuentas por cobrar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará lavadoras, porque próximamente adicionará a sus ingresos el servicio de lavadoras que ofrecerá especialmente a amas de casa para que puedan descansar un poco de la lavada manual y a pleno sol. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente:  “Mis agradecimientos por confiar en mi negocio . Me fue muy bien durante el crédito. “
texts.en: Nubia used her Kiva loan to buy small appliances that she sold to her customers on credit thus increasing her accounts receivable portfolio.  She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy washing machines because she will soon add washing machine services to her income.  She will offer the service especially to housewives so that they can rest a bit from manual washing under the hot sun.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following:  “Thank you for trusting in my business.  I did very well during the loan.”

loans.use: to buy washing machines.

loans.name: Kuldar

texts.ru:
Кульдар 57 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Кульдар на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки дойной коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Кульдар в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 6 овец. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кульдар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец.  Доходы от кредита Кульдар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kuldar is 57 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has been raising livestock for 15 years, having started her business with a purchase of a dairy cow. Thanks to Kuldar's dedicated work, today her farm has 1 dairy cow, 1 calf, and 6 sheep. In order to continue developing her business, Kuldar has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners  for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy additional sheep. She plans to use her profits from this loan to further increase the size of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Reina Jenny

texts.es: La Sra. Reina  tiene 20 años y es soltera no tiene hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de calculadoras, ella vende de manera ambulante por las calles de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Reina utilizara este préstamo para la compra de variedad de calculadoras científicas por mayor  para su negocio, Reina   enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay muchas vendedoras con los mismos productos,  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, Reina sueña por su negocio es conseguir un puesto fijo de venta, es una persona joven y emprendedora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene.
texts.en: Reina, 20, is single and has no children.  She’s a street vendor selling calculators in the streets of the city of Cochabamba.  This loan is her first sequence within our institution.  Reina will use this loan to buy an assortment of scientific calculators at wholesale for her business.  The challenge Reina faces in her business is competition because there are many sellers of the same products.  She will use profits to improve her quality of life.  Reina's dream for her business is getting a fixed sales point.  She is a young, enterprising person who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided because this is the only activity she has to support herself.

loans.use: to buy calculators.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Roxana tiene 23 años y es soltera no tiene hijos, ella se dedica al canto tiene una agrupación musical donde amenizan todo acontecimiento social también viajan a realizar presentaciones a las provincias de la ciudad de Cochabamba  La Sra. Roxana es la vocalista del  grupo,  este  préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Roxana utilizara este préstamo para  la compra de un instrumento musical que es el bajo, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es requerimiento de un bajo para el grupo, Roxana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varios grupos musicales como el de ella pero se siente feliz ya que siempre tienen contratos, y utilizara los beneficios en la compra de mas instrumentos musicales, Roxana desea que su grupo sea reconocido internacionalmente, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado. En la Foto esta con su agrupación ya que ella nos proporciono la foto,  ella es la persona que se encuentra en el centro de la fotografía.
texts.en:
Roxana, 23, is single and has no children.  She is singer in a music group that entertains at all kinds of social events; they also travel to perform in the city of Cochabamba’s provinces.  Roxana is the group’s vocalist and this loan is her first sequence within the institution.  Roxana will use this loan to buy a musical instrument: a base guitar.  The reason for asking for the loan is that the group needs a base guitar.

The challenge Roxana faces in her business is competition since there are several musical groups like hers but she feels happy because they always have contracts and she will use profits to buy more musical instruments.  Roxana wants her group to be recognized internationally.  

She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.  She appears in the photo with her group since she provided us with the photo.  She’s the person in the center of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a base guitar.

loans.name: Epifamia Arana Morla

texts.es: Epifamia de 58 años vive (suburbio Guayaquil ) ella decidió ponerse un negocio de costura el cua le va bien .aparte se dedica a hacer comidas para fiestas como quinceañeras. Ella trabaja todos los días sola . a  futuro ella desea comprarse un  horno especial  y poner su negocio en otra parte . Con el préstamo comprara ( telas, ropa).
texts.en: Epifamia is 58 and lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. She decided to start a sewing business, which is going well. Aside from that, she earns a living making food for parties, such as for the 15th birthday galas for young girls. She works alone every day. In the future, she wishes to buy herself a special oven and relocate her business. With the loan she will buy fabrics and clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and clothing

loans.name: Popo

texts.en:
Popo is married and has two children who attend school. Her husband 'works as a driver. Popo operates a food vending business and sells her goods from home. Her primary customers are neighbors and passersby. 

Popo is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Popo aspires to establish a restaurant business in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to establish another business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sitam

texts.ru: Ситам проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 69 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена и сын находятся в Российской Федерации на заработках. Сам он занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Sitam lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 69 years old, married, and has four children. His wife and son are currently working in Russia. Sitam raises livestock and is taking this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio  tiene 35 años no es casado pero convive con su pareja con la cual tiene 3 hijos que son  de las edades de 6, 4 y 1 años, se dedica a la  agricultura su parcela se encuentran ubicada en la localidad de Sombrerito, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Sergio utilizara  este préstamo  para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y cosecha de arroz la razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumento de capital, el Sr. Sergio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y utilizara los beneficios par mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, El Sr. Sergio es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sergio, 35, isn’t married but lives with his spouse with whom he has three children who are 6, 4 and 1 years old.  He’s a farmer and his parcel is located in Sombrerito.  This loan is his first sequence within the institution.  He will use it to buy seeds for the potato crop and rice harvest.  The reason for requesting the loan is to increase working capital.

The challenge Sergio faces in his business is to rise out of poverty.  He will use profits to improve his and his family’s quality of life.  Sergio is a very hardworking person who feels happy and grateful for the support provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Jose Livardo Parraga Basurto

texts.es: Jose de 54 años vive ( suburbio Guayaquil ) . jose hace 12 años perdio su empleo por motivo de esto el convenció a su esposa para poner un retaurante que hasta ahora le ha ido bien. El trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación con su esposa . a futuro el desea que su negocio se mantenga bien como ahora. Con el préstamo comprara ( sillas mesas etc) .
texts.en: Jose, 54, lives in El Suburbio, Guayaquil. Jose lost his job 12 years ago, so he convinced his wife to start a restaurant. So far, it has gone well for him. He works very hard and with dedication along with his wife. In the future, he hopes his business remains good like it is now. With the loan, he will buy chairs, tables, etc.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables

loans.name: Jose Gerardo Montero Morera

texts.es: José Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 53 años de edad, está casado y vive con sus dos hijos y la esposa .El pretende con el crédito asistir el café. El  pretende invertir en insumos como, abonos, herbicidas, fumigaciones y mano de obra para octener el máximo de ganancias y rendimiento. El quiere obtener un café en perfectas condiciones  y una exelente produccion y asi obtener la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y el de su familia y así tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Gerardo, 53, is married living with his two children and his wife.  He intends to use the loan for his coffee crops.  He intends to invest the loan in supplies like manure, herbicide, fumigation and labor costs to obtain the maximum possible profit and yield.  He wants to obtain coffee that’s in perfect conditions as well as an excellent production to thus obtain the greatest possible amount of profits for his and his family’s wellbeing and thus attain better economic stability.

This is his first loan from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks but Fudecosur offered the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Domingo Jose

texts.es: Domingo de  31 años, casado, comerciante y técnico medio en administración, originario de Chinandega, su negocio es una pulpería con dos años de experiencia, lo puso con capital propio y apoyo de su esposa, antes trabajo por más de tres años  en una empresa privada la cual cerro. En vez de seguir buscando empleo en empresas privadas decidió poner su propio negocio con la liquidación que le dieron y fue de esta manera que junto con su esposa trabajan por sacar adelante su pulpería.; solicito el crédito para comprar granos básicos, pollo, carnes, jugos , gaseosas, enlatados, productos de limpieza etc. Su meta principal es terminar su carrera universitaria de contabilidad financiera y mejorar su pulpería.
texts.en: Domingo, 31, is married; he’s a merchant and a mid-level management technician from Chinandega.  His business is a grocery store that he’s had for two years.  He set it up with his own capital and help from his wife.  Prior to that he worked for two years for a private firm that went out of business.  Instead of continuing to look for work in private firms he decided to use the liquidation he was given to open his own business and this is how together with his wife they work to succeed with their grocery store.  The loan he requested is to buy basic grains, chicken, meats, juices, soft-drinks, canned goods, cleaning supplies, etc.  His goal is to complete his university career in financial accounting and to improve his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, chicken, meat, juice, soft-drinks, canned goods, cleaning supplies, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Exitosas” es un grupo que está conformado por 09 socios comprometidos, la cual llevan 04 meses trabajando con el Programa- Prosperidad. Siendo Yolanda la secretaria del grupo. Yolanda de 55 años de edad es separada con 05 hijos, 01 de ellos aún dependiente. Hace más de 05 años que Yolanda se dedica a la venta de ropa la cual trabaja sobre pedidos ya que por el momento no cuenta con un local propio. Aparte realiza trabajos manuales de donde obtiene un ingreso mas para su hogar. Con su trabajo y dedicación a podido apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y aumentar su capital de trabajo. Con el fin de seguir creciendo en su negocio solicito el crédito para comprar prendas como polos, casacas, chores, etc. y de esta manera tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. Yolanda tiene como objetivo poner una boutique donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas. La Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Exitosas” agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Exitosas” (Successful Women) communal bank is composed of nine committed members who have been working for four months in Programa-Prosperidad.  Yolanda is group secretary.  She is 55 years old, separated and has five children one of which is still dependent.

Yolanda has been working selling clothes for over five years.  She works based on prior orders and does not have a locale of her own at present.  She also does crafts work to earn extra income for her home.  With her work and dedication she’s been able to support her children’s education and increase working capital.

Aiming to continue growing in her business she’s asked for a loan to buy clothes like polo shirts, jackets, shorts, etc. in order to offer her customers.  

The “Mujeres Exitosas” communal bank are grateful for the loan granted since it makes their progress possible.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Ann has a shop that sells variety of fish; her husband is a fisherman. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. 

Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Florencio has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell. 

Florencio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Florencio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for resale

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Liezel provides multipurpose cab services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the multipurpose cab. 

Liezel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Liezel hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the multipurpose cab

loans.name: Jetypeka Group

texts.es:
El comité “Jetypeka” tiene más de 1 año de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas. Ellas anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.
Celsa es una de las miembros del grupo, y ella se dedica a la venta de variadas clases de prendas, lo cual la ha ayudado a poder mantener a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan para una mejor vida. Su sueño es poder tener un local grande donde pueda ofrecer más variedades de prendas a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecerse con más variedad de prendas, ya que se acerca la temporada de frio y quiere poder surtirse bien. Agradece por el apoyo que recibe de la fundación y de Kiva.
texts.en:
The “Jetypeka” committee has been in existence and working with Fundación Paraguaya for over a year.  Most of its members are already carrying out productive activities.  They hope for a better future for their children and this is why they strive doubly hard to provide materials for their growth and development.

Celsa is one of the group members.  She sells assorted articles of clothing which has helped her support her family and give them all they need for a better life.  Her dream is to be able to have a large locale where she can sell a still larger variety of articles of clothing to her customers.

She is asking for the loan to stock up on more clothes since the cold season is approaching and she wants to be well stocked.  She is grateful for the support she gets from the Fundación and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Myrna has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She is also selling rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. 

Myrna requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy snacks, beverages & sacks of  rice to sell.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, beverages & rice

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 4 children. 

Carlos has a food shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 21 years. He requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Carlos has been a member of HSPFI for since 2010.  In the future, Carlos hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Necilyn

texts.en:
Necilyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Necilyn has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

Necilyn requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Necilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Vencent

texts.en:
Vencent is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single and has 1 child. 

Vencent provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Vencent has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Vencent hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Expedita provides motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Expedita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Expedita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 1 child. 

Rodulfo provides motorela or motorcycle with sidecar services. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Rodulfo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rodulfo hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated from her spouse and has 2 children. 

Aida has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that buys & sells canned goods, snacks like rice cakes & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy snacks, beverages & raw ingredients needed for making rice cakes.

Aida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en:
Milicent is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 3 children between the ages of 1 and 21 and 1 is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Geoffrey and he works as a driver. 

Milicent operates a clothes selling business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Milicent's other source of income includes selling tea leaves. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Milicent will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. Milicent aspires to expand her chicken house in the future. She joined Yehu because of its affordable interest rates.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has 5 children. 

Edna has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Emelie has a retail food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 26 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Emelie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emelie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with four children. 

Virginia is making & peddling snacks like rice cakes, cheese cakes, pan cakes & fruit juices. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. 

Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: La Sra. Vicenta tiene 61 años no es casada pero convive con su pareja, ella junto a su esposo se dedica a la extracción de materiales de construcción y al  lavado de arena y piedra en el rio, después venden el material de construcción, ellos viven en la localidad de Santa Rita. Este préstamo es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Vicenta utilizara este préstamo para para la compra de combustible  y cañerías y así de esta manera facilitara su trabajo. La Sra. Vicenta enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida, y  utilizara los beneficios del crédito para mejorar el  rendimiento de su draga. Se siente muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos para ella y su esposo.
texts.en: Vicenta is 61; she is not married, but lives with her partner. Together with her partner, she makes a living extracting construction materials, and to washing sand and stone in the river. They later sell the construction materials. They live in the town of Santa Rita. This is her fifth loan cycle with the institution. Vicenta will use this loan to buy fuel and piping which will make her work easier. Vicenta faces challenges in her business, which are improving her quality of life, and she will use the benefits of the loan to improve her dredger’s performance. She is very grateful to the institution for the support offered, since this is her partner's and her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy fuel and piping.

loans.name: Lellys Del Carmen

texts.es: Lellys de 31 años de edad vive al suroccidente de la ciudad  y tiene un negocio mediante el cual elabora muebles en bambú, mecedoras que vende en mayor volumen  a su principal mercado, que está ubicada en diferentes ciudades de la Costa Caribe y en la ciudad de Ocaña, en Santander del Norte. Su negocio inició basado en su experiencia en tapicería y la de su cónyuge en el trabajo en bambú; por eso  hace 13 años cuando llegaron a la ciudad de Barranquilla y emprendieron su propia aventura,  que después de su separación, hace 6 años ha estado a cargo de Lellys . En su negocio emplea a 6 trabajadores. La vida de ella está  planeada en torno al crecimiento de su negocio, para que  en un futuro, al llegar sus hijos que son su más anhelado sueño, tenga ingresos sostenibles con los que sostener su bienestar. En la actualidad planea vender mecedoras a crédito, pero tiene el desafío de tener un capital de trabajo suficiente para hacerlo, por eso aplica a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará espuma, telas, varas de bambú, con los cuales elaborará productos solicitados por sus clientes, que son muy puntuales y esto garantiza el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en: Thirty-one-year-old Lellys lives in the southwestern part of the city and has a business where she makes bamboo furniture.  She sells her rocking chairs in high volume to her main market, which is located in different cities on the Caribbean coast and in the city of Ocaña in Norte de Santander.  Her business started based on her experience with upholstery and that of her spouse in working with bamboo.  That's why they came to the city of Baranquilla 13 years ago and started their own venture, which Lellys has been in charge of for six years since their separation.  She employs six people in her business.  Her life is planned around growing her business, so that in the future, when she has the children she has wanted more than anything, she will have enough income to ensure their well-being.  She currently plans to sell her rocking chairs on credit, but she faces the challenge of not having enough working capital to do so.  That is why she is applying for a Kiva loan, which will be her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Using this loan, she will buy foam, fabrics, and bamboo rods, with which she will make the products her customers order.  Her customers are very punctual, which guarantees the success of her investment.

loans.use: to buy foam, fabrics, and bamboo rods

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús Group

texts.es: Juana es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Corazón De Jesús” la cual está conformado por 10 socios siendo la gran mayoría vecinos de la zona.  Juana tiene 55 años de edad y su familia está conformada por ella su conviviente y 03 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para niños y adultos. Este negocio surgió con la idea de obtener mayores ganancias y de esta manera brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, también  brinda servicio de limpieza. Actualmente apoya a sus nietos con su educación. A futuro a Juana le gustaría poner una tienda de abarrotes pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para comprar prendas como chompas, pantalones, casacas, chalinas y colchas. La Alcancía Comunal “Corazón De Jesús” están agradecidos y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien.
texts.en: Juana is a member of the Corazón de Jesús Communal Bank, which is made up of 10 members, the majority of whom are neighbors from the area.  Juana is 55 years old and her family is made up of her, her partner, and three independent children.  She buys and sells clothing for children and adults for a living.  This business grew out of her idea for making more income and being able to offer her family a better quality of life.  She also offers cleaning services.  She currently supports her grandchildren in their education.  In the future, Juana would like to set up a grocery store, as that way she will be sure to make more income.  At the moment, she is asking for this loan to buy clothing, such as sweaters, pants, jackets, scarves, and bedspreads.  The Corazón de Jesús Communal Bank is very grateful and promises to keep working hard.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, pants, jackets, scarves, and bedspreads

loans.name: Glenness

texts.en:
Glenness is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Glenness provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Glenness is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Glenness hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with 4 children. 

Judith has a hardware store that sells water pipes, bolts, electrical wires & steel bars. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of hardware products like water pipes & steel bars to resell.

Judith has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy hardware products

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells home products. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of home products. 

Lilian will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more home products to sell. Her business goal is to run several similar retail stores within 5 years.

loans.use: buy home products

loans.name: Sheiryl

texts.en:
Sheiryl is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Sheiryl has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She is also buying & selling (cell phone) electronic loads. She has had this business for 3 years. 

Sheiryl requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON to sell.  Sheiryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Myrna as a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for PHP  ,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Verna has a shop that sells firewood per bundle. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of firewood to sell.

Verna has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Verna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy firewood

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman. She has 3 children between the ages of 5 and 20 and 1 is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Stephen and he works as a hotelier. 

Janet operates a firewood selling business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby.  Janet's other source of income includes farming.  She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food  and rent bills. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Janet will use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase sacks of firewood for resale.  Janet aspires to expand her chicken house in the future. She joined Yehu because of its affordable financial services.

loans.use: buy firewood

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Erlinda has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 6 months to 2 years. She describes herself to be social.  

Rose operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as onions, oranges, tomatoes and also fish (omena). She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of vegetables and fruits. 

Rose will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more fish, vegetables and fruits to sell. Her business goal is to run a bigger grocery store within 5 years.

loans.use: buy tomatoes and fish

loans.name: Mariana De Las Mercedes

texts.es: Mariana de 55 años vive ( suburbio Guayaquil  ). Ella comenzó este negocio de costura desde que su espozo la abandono. Mariana  se puso el negocio en su casa para haci poder cuidar a sus hijos y nietos. Con dedicación trabaja todos los días. A futuro ella desea tener su casa y un espacio para exhibir su costura. Con el préstamo comprara ( telas, encajes, hilos etc ).
texts.en:
Mariana, 55, lives in suburban Guayaquil.  She began this sewing business when her husband abandoned her.  Mariana set up the business in her house so she could care for her children and grandchildren.  She works with dedication every day.

In the future she wants to have her house and a space to show her sewing.

With the loan she will buy fabric, lace, thread, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lace, and thread.

loans.name: Williams Marcial

texts.es: El Sr. Williams tiene 51 años y es casado con 3 hijos que son de las edades de  16, 14 y 9 años,  el se dedica a la venta de abarrotes va repartiendo víveres a los de su zona y a distintos clientes que tiene el vive por la zona de Tembladerani, este  préstamo es el sexto que tiene dentro de la institución, el Sr. Williams usara este préstamo para compra de abarrotes por mayor y así de esta manera incrementar su  capital de trabajo, el Sr.  Williams enfrenta retos en su negocio que son conseguir más clientes y así de esta manera mejora sus ingresos y utilizara los beneficios para  compra de mercadería y seguir surtiendo la variedad de sus productos, el Sr. Williams es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por al apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Williams, 51, is married with three children, ages 16, 14, and 9.  He works selling groceries.  He distributes provisions to the people of his area and to several customers who live in the Tembladerani area.

This is his sixth loan with the institution.  Williams will use this loan to buy groceries wholesale and in this way increase his working capital.

Williams confronts challenges in his business such as getting more customers and in this way improving his income.  He will use the profits to buy merchandise and continue stocking the variety of his products.

Williams is a very hardworking person.  He is happy about and grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, noodles, and rice wholesale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Alma has a shop that sells fruits & vegetables like carrots & cabbages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of fruits & vegetables to sell.

Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lini

texts.en:
Lini is a 44-year-old married woman. She has 3 children between the ages of 11 and 18 and all are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Ali and he works as a taxi driver. 

Lini operates a juice selling business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality, especially during the rainy season, and her highest monthly expenses are food and rent bills. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Lini will use this KES 40000 loan to purchase sugar and fruits for making juices. Lini aspires to open a retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of its affordable financial services.

loans.use: buy sugar and fruits to make juices

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Evelyn has a shop that sells green bananas & coconuts for copra. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts to sell.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy bananas and coconut

loans.name: Medecia

texts.en:
Medecia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She a widow with 1 child. 

Medecia's main business is buying coconut & selling copra. She has had this business for 14 years.  She also has a food store.  She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts for copra & stocks for her food store.

Medecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2007 .  In the future, Medecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for copra & stocks for her food store

loans.name: Julan

texts.en:
Julan is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married.
 
Julan has a fruit stand that sells a variety of fruits like apples & mangoes. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of fruits to sell.

Julan has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011.  In the future, Julan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits for sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman. She has 3 children between the ages of 27 and 16 and all are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Mgandi and he works as a taxi driver. 

Halima operates a dressmaking business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 12 years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Halima's other source of income comes from her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be delayed payments by clients who take on credit and her highest monthly expense is food. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Halima will use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase canvas, zippers and cloth materials. Halima aspires to purchase another sewing machine in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: buy canvas, zippers and cloth materials

loans.name: Yajaira

texts.es: Yajaira, tiene la edad  de 28   años de edad, está soltera y vive con sus dos hijos. Ella pretende con el crédito sembrar de café la propiedad, la cual esta baldía. Ella  pretende invertir en semilla para realizar el almacigo primero y  luego invertir en insumos como abonos, mano de obra y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha del café y un mejor rendimiento. Ella quiere poner a producir su finca y obtener la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus hijos y así tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yajairais 28, single, and lives with her two children. With the loan, she intends to plant coffee on her property, which is uncultivated.  She intends to invest in seed in order to do the seedling bed first. Then she will buy supplies such as fertilizers and fungicides, and hire labor, in order to get a better coffee harvest and better yield. 

She wishes to put her small farm into production, and earn as much as she can for her well-being and that of her children. In this way, she will be in a more stable financial situation. 

This is the first loan she has received from Fodecosur. She hadn't had other loans before from state banks, but Fodecosur has offered her the loan on better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy seed and supplies for her coffee seedling bed.

loans.name: Elvira Cecilia

texts.es: Elvira de 45 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 14 a 24 años, en uno de los barrios mas alegres de tradición carnavalera de la ciudad: allí tiene el negocio de producir y elaborar muñecos, decorar camisetas y hacer ajuares de bebe.  Elvira nunca se imaginó, que lo que inició por seguirle  la corriente a unas amigas,  que la invitaron a que se capacitara técnicamente en artesanías, hoy se convertiría en su actividad generadora de ingresos.  En la actualidad sus amigas abandonaron esta tarea y Elvira está concentrada en trabajar en las artesanías y como alternativa adicional también hace pedicure y manicures, porque hace todos los cursos que cree le van a servir,  para deleitarse además de producirle dinero. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia casa y en ella un local, donde ubicar sus artesanías,  surgida de un potencial que no había explorado. En la actualidad está entusiasmada con su negocio y planea hacer un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales para elaborar camisetas, pinturas, pinceles, pegantes, sellantes, jeans y tela para trabajar nuevos diseños. Con ello aumentará su oferta de productos y potencializará el aumento de sus ventas y esta es justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en: Forty-five-year-old Elvira lives with her spouse and her three children, who range from 14 to 24 years old, in one of the most cheerful neighborhoods that celebrates Carnival in the city.  That is where she has her business making and designing dolls, decorating blouses, and making layettes.  Elvira never imagined that what she started to humor some friends who invited her to train in craft-making technique would today be the business that generates her income.  Now, her friends no longer do this kind of work and Elvira concentrates on working in craft-making and, as an extra alternative, she also gives manicures and pedicures because she takes all the courses that she thinks will be useful to her to enjoy herself and make money too.  Her goal for the future is to have her own home and to set up a store in it where she can keep her crafts, which is a potential she has yet to explore.  At the moment she is enthusiastic about her business and plans to take out a Kiva loan, which will be her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Using this loan, she will buy materials to make blouses, paint, paintbrushes, glue, stamps, jeans, and fabric to work on new designs.  This will increase the variety of products she offers and will have the potential to increase her sales, which will effectively make her investment a success.

loans.use: to buy materials to make blouses, paint, paintbrushes, glue, stamps, jeans, and fabric to work on new designs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Teresita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Douglas Sogono

texts.en:
Douglas is a 30-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 14 years. He describes himself to be an ambitious, visionary and decisive man. 

Douglas operates a motor vehicle business where he provides transportation services.  He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy urban town and his primary customers are employees of companies and Holiday Inn hotel employees. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for the servicing of his vehicle. His business goal is to purchase another vehicle within 5 years.

loans.use: service his taxi vehicle

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Amie has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Amie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Amie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Hovik

texts.en:
Hovik has been running his own business more than 17 years: he carries passengers from Acharkut village in the Tavush area to Ijevan city and back. He fulfills his journey once a day 6 days a week. 

Hovik has his own bus which he uses for his business, but as this bus is very old, it breaks down very often and Hovik is forced to spend a lot of money to repair it. Therefore Hovik wants to buy a new minibus for his business and so he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan.  The new minibus will allow him to transport passengers safely and more comfortably and to reduce the cost of his business as well.

Hovik is 52 years old.  He lives in Acharkut village in the Tavush area. He is married and has two sons and a daughter, who are all married. With Hovik and his wife live his younger son, daughter-in-law and grandchild.  Hovik has for many years worked as a driver in different organizations. His wife and daughter-in-law work in a  village school and his son works for a monument conservation organization as an inspector.

loans.use: buy a minibus

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, married to a farmer and the mother of five children, has been baking doughnuts for sale in Mpohor, near Takoradi, for eight years.  She uses her income to help support her husband in the feeding and clothing of their children.  Now requesting this loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery, Agnes hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Shernazar

texts.ru: Шерназар- мужчина 30 лет, женат. Они с женой ждут первого ребёнка. Сам имеет свой бизнес, с Худжандского рынка закупает раз в неделю продукты питания по оптовым ценам и продаёт их на своем рынке. Он очень весёлый, энергичный  парень, который любит своё дело. Для завоза лука и картошки оптом он решил получить кредит. На снимке он на месте деятельности.
texts.en: Shernazar is a 30 year-old married man.  He and his wife are expecting their first child.  Shernazar has his own business and buys food products from the Khujand market at wholesale prices once per week and sells them at his local market.  He is a very happy and energetic young man, who loves his business.  He decided to obtain this loan to purchase onions and potatoes wholesale.  The photograph shows Shernazar at his place of business.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Ubalda Andrea

texts.es: Ubalda es una joven de 24 años de edad con una profesion tecnica en contabilidad, casada, y con muchas metas a futuro. Expresa que su edad no ha sido un impedimento para ella poder proponerse metas e independisarse; sino que al contrario aprovechando su juventud para tener un futuro brillante. Actualmente labora como conserge en una de las empresas del Estado de nuestro pais, sin embargo su salario no es tan remunerativo para cubrir sus gastos ya que todo ha aunmentado, es por ello que hoy en dia es en su propia casa de habitacion donde cuenta con su negocio como lo es el alquiler de dos habitaciones, negocio que le ha generado ingresos extras ademas de su salario y el apoyo brindado por su señor esposo. Siendo este su primer ciclo de financiamiento destaca la razon de su credito, el cual lo utilizara en el acondicionamiento de las habitaciones que alquila, con el objetivo de que sean estas su principal fuente de ingresos y de esta manera de que los inquilinos gocen de mejores condiciones y ella pueda aumentar el precio de arriendo. Su plan a futuro es finalizar su carrera y convertirse en una Lic. En Contabilidad para aspirar a mejores ofertas de empleo.
texts.en: Ubalda is a 24-year-old young lady who has professional training in accounting, is married, and who has many goals for the future.  She tells us that her age hasn't been an obstacle to allowing her to set goals for herself and become independent, rather she has taken advantage of her youth to have a bright future.  She currently works as a receptionist in one of her country's state businesses, but her salary is not sufficient to cover her expenses as everything has gone up.  That is why she currently has a business in her own home in the form of renting out two rooms.  This business has generated extra income for her in addition to her salary and the support she receives from her husband.  As this is her first loan cycle, she explains that her reason for taking out this loan is to fit out the rooms she rents with the goal of having them be her main source of income.  Also, by offering her tenants better conditions, she will be able to increase rent.  Her plan for the future is to finish her studies and become a certified accountant in order to seek out better employment opportunities.

loans.use: to fit out two rooms in her home

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Niño Jesús están actualmente en el segundo ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya de la ciudad de Curuguaty, con la 10 integrantes.  Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder ayudar a sus hijos y familiares.
Antonia es una de la miembros del grupo, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a las ventas desde hace ya un tiempo. Antonia tiene una despensa bien surtida, en la cual trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta ya muy entrada la noche, y es así como mantiene a su familia día a día. Su meta es seguí trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo como comerciante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás insumos que más salidas tienen. Ellas estan muy agradecidas con la fundación por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
With ten members, the Divino Niño Jesús communal bank is currently in the second loan cycle of the Fundación Paraguaya's Programa Comité de Mujeres [Women's Communal Bank Program] in the city of Curuguaty. They are women and the heads of their households who do their utmost to be able to help their children and relatives.

Antonia is one of the members of the group, and she has told us how she has worked in sales for a long time. Antonia has a well-stocked store, where she works from very early in the morning to well into the night, and this is how she provides for her family day after day. Her aim is to continue working and in this way to continue to grow as a storekeeper. She is seeking this loan to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other supplies which are the most costly. 

The women are very thankful to the foundation for the opportunity that they have been given.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the store

loans.name: Irma Isabelina Rosario Quezada

texts.es:
Irma es una mujer de 42 años soltera, madre de 4 hijos. Vive con tres de ellos en Santo Domingo que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del país, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada en el 2007. 

Irma tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y bisutería desde hace 7 años; de esta manera sostiene a su hogar. Esta mujer emprendedora quiere hacer una inversión comprando ropa y bisutería para incrementar el surtido de la mercadería que ofrece. Para esto Irma ha confiado en Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre KIVA y ella y de esta manera obtener su primer crédito. Con esto piensa obtener mayores ganancias ya que al tener mayor surtido, incluso puede atraer mayor clientela.

La falta de capital y las oportunidades de crecimiento ha sido un gran obstáculo para esta mujer, y gracias a KIVA y Fundación Alternativa, Irma no solamente obtendrá un crédito sino que podrá obtener capacitación y asesoría de tal manera que pueda tener un crecimiento sustentable.
texts.en:
Irma is a 42-year-old single woman, the mother of four children.  She lives with three of them in Santo Domingo, which is one of the youngest cities in the country.  Currently it has become the connection point between the mountains and the coast.  It is a privileged area, not only for its ethnic riches but also for the landscapes you can see from the moment you enter this beautiful city.  Santo Domingo de los Colorados is currently in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recently formed in 2007.

Irma has had a business selling clothing and costume jewelry for seven years; this is how she supports her household.  This enterprising woman wants to make an investment buying clothing and costume jewelry to increase the stock of the merchandise she sells.  For this Irma has trusted in Fundación Alternativa, the intermediary institution between Kiva and herself, to get her first loan.  With this she plans to get greater profits because with a greater selection she can even attract a larger clientele.

The lack of capital and growth opportunities has been a big obstacle for this woman.  Thanks to Kiva and Fundación Alternativa, Irma not only will have a loan, but she also will be able to get training and advice in such a way that she will have sustainable growth.

loans.use: to buy clothing and costume jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Arca De Noe Group

texts.es: Yesica es miembro del Grupo Solidario Arca de Noé, tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, el primero de 10 y el segundo de 5 años, y su esposo se dedica hacer trabajos de construcción. Ella desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de Golosinas, su horario de atención es de 4:00 p.m. y termina hasta las 10:00 de la noche, Yesica atiende su negocio sola y durante el día también vende lociones y cremas para el cuerpo. Su ventaja es que tiene muchos clientes y que les gusta el producto que ella les ofrece. El préstamo que Yesica solicita lo necesita para comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de golosinas como ser: tacos, baleadas, tajaditas con pollo, pastelitos, etc. Uno de sus sueños es ayudar a sus hijos a que se gradúen y que sean personas de bien. Sus metas es tener un local grande y ahorrar para poder comprar una refrigeradora y una  estufa para fabricar su producto y acondicionar adecuadamente su local. Yesica tiene más de cuatro años de ser clienta de FAMA y ha cumplido puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Yesica is a member of the Solidario Arca de Noé Group. She is 29 years old, married, has 2 children ages 10 and 5, and her husband does construction work for a living. For the past 6 years she has sold snacks and sweets for a living. Her work schedule starts at 4:00 PM and ends at 10:00 at night. Yesica runs her business alone and also during the day she sells body lotions and creams. Her advantage is that she has many customers that like the products that she offers. The loan that Yesica needs is to buy the raw materials for the creation of her treats such as: tacos, baleadas (flour tortillas folded in half with refried beans, cheese, sour cream, and other ingredients inside), fried plantains with chicken, small cakes, etc. One of her dreams is to help her children to graduate and become good people. Her goal is to have a large shop and save to be able to buy a refrigerator and a stove to make her product and adequately air condition her shop. Yesica has more than 4 years of being a client of FAMA and has punctually complied with her payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, flour, cheese, and butter, among other things.

loans.name: Hafizahon

texts.ru: Хафизахон молодая девушка, пока не замужняя, живёт вместе с родителями пенсионерами. Она торгует на продовольственном рынке разнообразными национальными лепёшками. Она покупает товар у хлебопекарных цехов. Для получения большей прибыли ей необходимо увеличить  товарооборот, поэтому она решила получить кредит для закупа лепёшек. Т.к. её торговая точка расположена при входе рынка, у неё всегда стабильная продажа, поэтому она с уверенностью хочет получить кредит и погашать его со своего ежедневного  дохода.
texts.en: Hafizahon is a young woman, not yet married, and lives with her retired parents.  She sells various national flatbread at the food market.  She buys the products from bakeries.  In order to make a large profit, she needs to increase her product turnover, and this is why she decided to obtain a loan to purchase flatbread.  Because Hafizahon's retail outlet is located at the market entrance, her sales are always stable.  This is why she is certain about obtaining this loan and repaying it with her daily profits.

loans.use: to purchase flatbread

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 35 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Алишер зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области он десять лет. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности и увеличения количества скота.
texts.en: Alisher lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 35 years old, married and has three children.  Alisher earns a living by breeding cattle.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan to expand his business and increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to repair a cowshed and buy bulls

loans.name: Barbarita

texts.es:
Barbarita es una mujer de 44 años de edad, es casada y vive con su esposo. Tiene casa propia ubicada en el caserío Pómac III, en el distrito de Pacora. Barbarita vive en la zona rural de Pacora, pero cuenta con los servicios básicos. Su caserio está conformado por aprox. 60 familias.
La actividad a la que se dedica Barbarita es venta de animales y a la comercializacion de algarroba, loche y productos que estén en temporada en la zona de Pacora  y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, trabajando como peón en los fundos aledaños.
El monto del préstamo es de 1000 nuevos soles, que serán invertidos en la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus cerdos y para sus aves de corral.
texts.en:
Barbarita is a woman of 44. She is married and lives with her husband. She has her own house, located in the settlement of Pómac III in Pacora district.

Barbarita lives in the rural area of Pacora, but has basic services. Her settlement is made up of approximately 60 families.

Barbarita sells animals as well as carob beans, squash, and crops that are in season in the Pacora area.  Her husband is a farmer, and works as a day laborer in the neighboring large farms.

The amount of the loan is 1000 nuevos soles, which will be invested in the purchase of balanced feed for her pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married to a businessman and lives near Takoradi.  She operates a breakfast stall, which she has been doing for five years.  She prepares coffee and Milo (a brand of malted milk), which she serves with fried eggs and bread. She uses her income to help to pay their utility bills. 

Mercy is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more eggs, Milo, coffee, and flour needed to prepare her breakfasts. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs, Milo, coffee, and flour.

loans.name: Betty Maritza

texts.es:
Betty Maritza es una mujer de 27 años de edad, casada y vive en casa propia, en el pueblo joven Federico Villareal, en la zona rural de Tucume, contando con servicios básicos. La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercialización de  animales.
La actividad a la que se dedica Betty es a la venta de animales y al servicio de costura, contando con 3 años de experiencia. Su esposo trabaja como agricultor, ayudando de esta manera con los gastos del hogar. El negocio de venta de animales tiene clientela fija.
Con el préstamo actual de 2000 nuevos soles, quiere comprar más animales para comercializarlos y alimento para los mismos.
texts.en:
Betty Maritza is a woman of 27. She is married, and lives in her own house in the new settlement of Federico Villareal, in the rural area of Tucume. She has basic services. The community has a subsistence-level quality of life. The majority of people are self-employed in businesses selling livestock.

Betty sells animals and is a seamstress, with three years of experience.  Her husband works as a farmer, helping in this way with the household expenses. The livestock sales business has a regular clientele.
