With the current loan of 2000 nuevos soles, she wishes to buy more animals to sell, and feed for them.

loans.use: To buy livestock and balanced feed.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es una mujer de 39 años de edad, casada y con 3 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia, en el Caserío Punto Cuatro en el distrito de Mochumí. Vive en la parte rural, pero cuenta con los servicios básicos.
La actividad que realiza Emilia es la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su casa y que quincenalmente negocia en los mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque. Ella cría sus animales en corrales hechos de caña y barro, los alimenta con polvillo, purina y pastos naturales.Adicionalmente Emilia elabora y vende chicha en su domicilio. El esposo de Emilia trabaja como controlador de carros de la Empresa de Transportes Paradero 10 de Lambayeque.
El monto del crédito asciende a 2500 nuevos soles, que serán empleados en la compra de ganado y de eternit para el techo de su vivienda y para la compra de útiles escolares de sus dos menores hijos.
texts.en:
Emilia is a 39-year-old woman, who is married with three children who are financially dependent on her  She lives in her own home in the Punto Cuatro hamlet in the Mochumí district.  She lives in a rural area, but has basic electrical and water services.

The work that Emilia does is raising and selling animals, which she raises in the space behind her home and takes to market every two weeks at the markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque.  She raises her animals in pens made of wattle and daub, and feeds them on an animal feed made from rice, on purine, and on natural grasses.  In addition, Emilia makes and sells chicha, a drink made from corn, in her home.  Emilia's husband works as a car controller for the Paradero 10 Transportation Business of Lambayeque.

The loan amounts to 2,500 new soles, which will be used for the purchase of livestock and roofing for her home, and for the purchase of school supplies for her two youngest children.

loans.use: to purchase animals and construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Estrellas” está conformado por 15 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa, artesanía, venta de abarrotes, repostería y preparación de alimentos, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Bernardita presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila, al centro, ocupando el tercer lugar de izquierda a derecha. Su cabello es de color negro y usa anteojos. Además viste una blusa color blanco, jeans y chalas color café claro. 
Ella se dedica al rubro de la artesanía específicamente a coser, bordar y tejer. Se desempeña en éste negocio desde hace 8 años. Promociona sus trabajos de boca en boca, de acuerdo a lo que exhiben sus clientes. Y los vende puerta a puerta.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras ubicadas en la ciudad de Santiago y Talca.
Con el crédito comprará una maquina multipunto, para realizar las terminaciones de sus trabajos.
Sus metas son instalar su negocio en un local establecido, en el cual también pueda instalar un taller de trabajo.
Bernardita vive junto a su marido e hijo de 22 años, quien trabaja de manera dependiente. Uno de sus sueños es estudiar la carrera de confección y vestuario. Ya que por ahora solo ha realizado cursos de corto tiempo y ella quiere perfeccionarse más y mejor. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que se siente apoyada y el crédito además le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Respecto al grupo comenta que éste es acogedor y organizado.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Estrellas and is made up of 15 entrepreneurs who work in different areas, among which are selling clothing, selling arts and crafts, selling groceries, baking, food preparation, and others.  All of them are from the city of Talca.

Bernardita is the president of the communal bank group.  In the photo she is in the center of the first row, in the third place from the left.  Her hair is black and she wears glasses.  Also, she is wearing a white blouse, jeans, and light brown sandals.  She works in the area of arts and crafts, specifically sewing, embroidering, and weaving.  She has worked in this business for eight years.  She promotes her work by word of mouth in accordance with what her customers show, and she sells door-to-door.  She buys her merchandise from distributors located in the cities of Santiago and Talca.

With the loan she will buy a multipoint sewing machine to finish her jobs.

Her goal is to set up her business in an established place where she also can set up a workshop.

Bernardita lives with her husband and 22-year-old son, who works for somebody.  One of her dreams is to study the profession of dressmaking and wardrobe, because for now she only has taken short-term courses and she wants to perfect herself more and with better results.

She is very happy about and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza because she feels supported.  Also, the loan will allow her to invest in her business.  With regard to the group, she comments that it is welcoming and organized.

Talca is in the Maule region, located in the central part of the country. It is the administrative, economic, and cultural center of the region, being the most important city in the Central Valley of Chile. There is a curious allusion to Talca in Chile, the expression "Talca, Paris, and London." Among the many myths about the matter, some say that it derives from something an English person once said, "Talca looks like London" [Spanish "parece" 'looks like' and "París" 'Paris' sound alike] because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in the winter season, similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy a multipoint sewing machine to finish her jobs.

loans.name: Margelis Del Carmen Barrerto De Avila

texts.es: Margelis de 52 años de edad, es una mujer que tiene dos hijos en as edades de 23 y 25 años, con los que sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas. Ella se dedica al comercio, desde que fue apoyada por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues en un principio contaba con muy poco capital de trabajo para hacer compras en volúmenes, ganar descuentos y responderle a sus clientes oportunamente. Su negocio poco a poco apoyado por esta organización, se fue haciendo más rentable, porque fue paulatinamente expandiendo  sus compras en otros países,  como Estados unidos, Noruega y España y en otras regiones del país desde donde trae mercancía variada como ropa, calzado, bolsos etc. Su mercancía es exclusiva y no es muy económica,  pero tiene clientes que compran lo mejor, pagan lo que el producto cuesta y que además no son sus compradores directos.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, crédito # 28 que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará ropa y calzado, pues se prepara para adquirir en ofertas, promociones y saldos, de estas mercancias que trae buenos descuentos y que trasladará a sus ingresos. Esta es justamente la razó por la cual su credikiva será exitoso.
texts.en:
Margelis, aged 52, is a woman with two children aged 23 and 25 years.  She dreams of seeing them become successful individuals.  

She has been working in retail since she received help from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, as initially she only had a small amount of working capital with which to make volume purchases, earn discounts and respond to her customers in a timely manner.  Helped by this organization, her business has become more profitable bit by bit, because she gradually expanded her purchases to other countries, such as the United States, Norway, and Spain.  She has also expanded to other regions of the country from where she brings a variety of merchandise such as clothing, shoes, bags, etc.  Her merchandise is exclusive, and is not very cheap.  However, she has customers who buy the very best, who pay what the item costs and who aren't themselves direct purchasers.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is her 28th loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she will purchase clothing and shoes.  It will set her up to make her purchases benefiting from offers, promotions and sales on the merchandise that has good discounts, and this will translate to income.  This is precisely the reason that her Kiva loan will be successful.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Lucía Otilia

texts.es:
Lucía es una mujer 55 años, soltera y madre de 6 hijos. Vive en la parroquia de Chillogallo, perteneciente a Quito la capital del Ecuador. Este es un sector populoso ubicado al sur de la ciudad, en este se ubican varios sitios de gran concurrencia de la población como lo son mercados, centros comerciales e incluso uno de los dos terminales terrestres de la capital.

Esta mujer trabaja desde hace algunos años en la venta y crianza de pollos. Ella misma los faena y los vende en el mercado del sector. Para ella ha sido muy duro y sacrificado el criar sola a sus seis hijos, sin embargo ha sabido salir adelante e incluso poco a poco ha ido construyendo una vivienda la cual proyecta arrendarla para de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y poder seguir manteniendo y educando a sus hijos. Para este fin Lucía requiere de un crédito, que sería el segundo en Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre esta mujer y el programa KIVA. En su primer crédito Lucía ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos por ello, es considerada una buena cliente.

Lucía no solamente recibirá el dinero que necesita para cumplir su meta sino que además Fundación Alternativa le brindará capacitación y asesoría, de tal manera que mejore su calidad de vida y crezca como empresaria.
texts.en:
Lucía is a 55-year-old woman.  She is single and the mother of six children.  She lives in Chillogallo parish, in Quito, the capital of Ecuador.  This is a densely-populated sector in the south of the city.  Here there are several very busy places such as the markets, shopping malls and even one of the capital's two [land] transport terminals.

This woman has been working for years raising and selling chickens.  She slaughters the animals herself and sells them in her local market.  Lucía has found it very hard to raise her six children on her own and it has involved a lot of sacrifice.  However, she has known how to get ahead and has even gradually been building a house which she plans to rent out so that she can increase her income and continue supporting and educating her children.  With this goal in mind, Lucía needs her second loan from Fundación Alternativa (the intermediary institution which works between her and the Kiva program).  Lucía was very punctual in making her repayments on her first loan and so she is considered to be a good client.

Lucía will not only receive the money that she needs to achieve her goal but Fundación Alternativa will also provide her with training and advice so that she can improve her quality of life and grow as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to finish building a house to rent out

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara  es una jovial mujer, de condicion separada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 41 a 43 años; ella genera ingresos  prestando los servicios de peluquería, cortes de cabello, tinturado, manicure y pedicure principalmente, en su negocio ubicado en un local arrendado; tiene 3 empleadas y ella también participa en las tareas propias del oficio. Su experiencia data desde hace 40 años en la ciudad de Barranquilla y la perfeccionó en otro país fronterizo, mediante cursos especializados y su trabajo como empleada de un salón de belleza y de su propia peluquería. Cuando regresó a Colombia hace un año emprendió su nueva aventura de negocios compró enseres y herramientas para ofrecer el servicio. Ella vive en su propia casa con algunos hijos con quienes comparte los gastos familiarmente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 2 sillas de peluquería, un lava cabezas, una mesa de manicure, pues desea modernizar su infraestructura para darle la calidad que amerita su clientela que confía en su experiencia. El éxito de su inversión radica en  su experticia en la actividad y su potencial clientela que cada vez crece mucho más.
texts.en: Clara is a jovial woman. She is separated and has 3 children between 41 and 43 years old. She makes income providing mainly hairstyling services, haircuts, coloring, manicures and pedicures in her business at a rented locale. She has 3 employees and she also participates in the professional tasks. Her experience started more than 40 years ago in the city of Barranquilla. She perfected it in a bordering country in specialized courses and in her job at a beauty salon and in her own hair salon. When she returned to Colombia a year ago, she began a new business adventure and bought tools and equipment to ply her trade. She lives in her own home with some children who share the household expenses. Right now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, the first loan she has had from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy 2 styling chairs,a hair washer, and a manicure table because she wants to modernize her infrastructure to give her clientele who trust in her experience the quality they deserve. The success of the investment lies in her experience in the activity and her potential clientele that grows more all the time.

loans.use: to buy 2 chairs for her hair salon, a hair washer, and a manicure table to modernize her infrastructure.

loans.name: Juana Leonor

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon en la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal San Ignacio De Colon.

En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 14 y 4 años, la mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la localidad y hoy tiene un taller de costura en su casa, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para conocidos y particulares, en la actualidad está elaborando uniformes ya que se avecina la época de entrada a clases y es cuando sus clientes más necesitan de sus servicios, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta la noche, con ella trabaja una hermana con la cual comparten las ganancias. Lleva más de 10 años con su negocio y casi nunca le falta trabajo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos, botones y varios materiales de costura que le hacen falta para elaborar sus prendas. Lleva  tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un taller más grande, con mas maquinas y operarias.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the San Ignacio de Colon communal bank meet in San Ignacio, in Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for its hard-working people who farm and raise livestock.

This is where Juana, age 34, lives.  She is in a common-law marriage, and they have two children, ages 14 and 4.  The older one goes to high school, and the younger one is in primary school.  Her husband devotes himself to farming.

Years ago she learned dressmaking at a local academy.  She now has a seamstress shop in her house.  That is where she devotes herself to making all types of clothing for acquaintances and the general public.  She is currently making uniforms because the season for starting classes is approaching.  That is when her customers need her services the most.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until the night.  Her sister works with her, and they share the income.  She has had her business for over ten years, and she hardly ever misses work.

This loan is to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and various sewing materials that she needs to make the garments.  She has been in the communal bank for three cycles, and she likes it because of the help given with the loans.

Her dream is to have a bigger shop with more machines and workers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and various sewing materials.

loans.name: Liliana Alexandra

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal San Ignacio De Colon.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Liliana, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y 4 años, el mayor ya está en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Tanto ella como su esposo son comerciantes, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y sandalias por catalogo y su esposo a la venta de productos para el hogar, se trasladan a otros cantones en su carro ofreciendo ropa, sandalias, mesas, sillas, colchones, ollas, platos y varios productos más, ellos dejan a crédito sus productos y cobran cada ocho días, llevan más de tres años con este negocio y les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar mesas, sillas, ollas, ropa, sandalias y varios productos mas. Ella está en su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que le ofrece la institución.

Su sueño es tener un gran local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of San Ignacio de Colón Communal Bank meet in San Ignacio, in the Colón parish of the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people who work in agriculture and ranching.

Here we met Liliana.  She is 32 years old and married, and from this relationship has two children, ages 6 and 4.  The older one is already in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Both she and her husband are merchants.  She works selling clothing and sandals by catalogue, and her husband sells household products.  They travel by car to other cantons selling clothing, sandals, tables, chairs, mattresses, pots, plates, and various other products.  They leave their products on credit and collect payment every week.  They have been with this business for more than three years and it is going very well for them.

This loan is to buy tables, chairs, pots, clothing, sandals, and various other products.  She is in her third loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because of the help and the profits the institution offers.

Her dream is to have a big place to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, pots, clothing, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Ana Asunción

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal San Ignacio De Colon.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 11 y 9 años  de edad, la mayor estudia en colegio y los dos menores en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella además de ser una muy buena ama de casa también se dedica al comercio,  vende  toldos, sabanas, edredones y varios productos más, su forma de venta es por números, ella entrega y cobra por semanas y al que le toque el turno recibe sus productos.  También en su  casa en las tardes prepara y vende empanadas de verde acompañado de jugos naturales o gaseosas como lo prefieran sus clientes, para lo cual ella instala un pequeño kiosco en las afueras de su casa. Trabaja todos los días en ambas cosas. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil una vez al mes. Tiene cinco  años  que se dedica a estas actividades y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar  toldos, sabanas, edredones y varios víveres para preparar sus deliciosas empanadas. Está en el Banco comunal desde hace siete ciclos y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos.
 
Su sueño es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
San Ignacio, in the Colon parish of Portoviejo city, is a place known for its hard-working people who work in agriculture and livestock.  Here, the members of the "San Ignacio de Colon" communal bank meet every two weeks.

This is where we meet Señora Ana, aged 35.  She is married and has three children from this relationship, aged 13, 11, and 9.  The eldest attends high-school, and the two youngest are in primary school.  Her husband works in retail.

She is a great housewife in addition to working in retail.  She sells awnings, blankets, sheets and various other products.  She sells according to a number system; she makes her deliveries and collects payment by the week, and when your turn comes, you get your products.  In the afternoons, she also makes and sells "empanadas de verde" in her home, together with natural juices or sodas depending on her customers' preference.  To do this, she has set up a small kiosk at the edge of her home.  She works every day on both things.  She goes to Guayaquil once a month to make her purchases.  She has been doing these activities for five years, and things have been going very well for her.

This loan is to purchase awnings, blankets, sheets, as well as various ingredients for making her delicious empanadas.

She has been in the communal bank for the last seven lending cycles, and likes it because the interest is low.

Her dream is to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase awnings, sheets, blankets and food ingredients.

loans.name: Dolores Monserrate

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal San Ignacio De Colon.

La señora Dolores. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 14, 12 y 6 años, los mayores estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar como planchas, colchones, ventiladores, entre otros muchos productos, su forma de venta es a través de cartillas o sistema acumulativo.  También vende de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en  una distribuidora en Portoviejo. Tiene más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos para el hogar y productos Yanbal. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la secretaria del mismo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables y por la ayuda que les brinda el banco.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y aumentar su negocio
texts.en:
In San Ignacio, of the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo,  the members of the San Ignacio de Colon communal bank meet. This place is know for its hardworking and dedicated people who work in farming and cattle raising. 

Dolores is 34 years old. She is married and has three children, aged 14, 12 and 6. The oldest go to high school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her husband is a driver. 

She is a housewife who sells household items such as irons, mattresses, fans and many other products in order to have her own income. She sells as a street vendor or via orders. She also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She works three days a week and sells her products on credit, collecting every week. She gets her products from a distributor in Portoviejo. She has been doing this activity for more than ten years and it is going very well for her. 

This loan is to buy household items and Yanbal products. She is a founding member of the communal bank and its secretary. She likes it because the other members are very responsible and because of the help the bank offers them. 
 
Her dream is to keep working and to expand her business. sueños son seguir trabajando y aumentar su negocio

loans.use: to buy household items and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Gime Zenen

texts.es:
Gime Zenen es un hombre de 19 años de edad, es soltero y sin hijos. Vive en casa de su padre, quien firma como aval este crédito. Vive en el Caserío Guaraguaos, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la zona rural, pero cuenta con servicio de electricidad.
La actividad a la que se dedica Gime es a la crianza y venta de animales pequeños, los cuales al alcanzar su peso y talla ideal, son comercializados en el mercado local. Complementariamente es agricultor en la parcela de su padre, y además arrienda más hectáreas.
El monto del crédito es de 1200 nuevos soles, los cuales serán utilizados para la compra alimento balanceado y purina para sus animales. Gime es una hombre joven con bastantes ganas de salir adelante y un gran potencial empresarial.
texts.en:
Gime Zenen is a 19-year-old man.  He is single and does not have any children.  He lives in his father's home and it was his father who signed as guarantor on his loan.  He lives in the small village of Guaraguaos, in Tambogrande district.  It is a rural area but does have electricity.

Gime's business is raising and selling animals.  When they reach an ideal size and weight, they are sold in the local market.  Gime is also a farmer and farms a plot of land belonging to his father.  He also rents out additional hectares.

Gime is requesting a loan for 1,200 soles which he will use to buy nutritionally-balanced feed and purines for his animals.  He is a young man who has a great desire to make progress in life.  He has great business potential.

loans.use: to buy animals and nutritionally-balanced feed

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal San Ignacio De Colon.

En este lugar vive la señora Angélica, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 13, 12 y 4 años, los mayores estudian en colegio y el otro recién va a empezar el jardín de infantes. El marido es mecánico automotriz.
 
Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días por  semana más que todo por las mañanas, deja a crédito y cobra los fines de semana,  tiene muchos clientes que le realizan sus pedidos ya que les da facilidades de pago. Lleva dos años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa de niños. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha ido mejorando su vida. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the San Ignacio de Colon community bank meet in San Ignacio, in Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its hard-working people who farm and raise livestock.

This is where Angélica lives.  Angélica is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband and three children who are 13, 12 and 4.  Her eldest are in high school and her youngest recently started kindergarten.  Her husband is a motor mechanic.

Angélica is a housewife who, in order to make her own income, sells all kinds of clothing through a catalog.  She makes her sales door to door and works three days a week, especially in the mornings.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment on weekends.  She has a lot of customers who place  orders with her because she provides them with good repayment terms.  She has been in this business for two years and is doing very well.

Angélica is requesting this loan to buy pants (trousers), shirts, blouses and children's clothing.  This is her fifth loan cycle as a member of her community bank and she likes it because the loans have improved her life.  Her dream is to continue in her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothing

loans.name: Mahoukpeou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUKPEOU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Fatima est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Fatima est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Fatima n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Fatima est mariée à un certain Didier. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont deux seulement restent à leur charge. Fatima vit ensemble avec son mari et ses deux enfants à charge. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Fatima vend depuis une quinzaine d’année, du charbon de bois dans son quartier. Fatima s’approvisionne dans le nord du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Fatima sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUKPEOU, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The MAHOUKPEOU group is made up of three people who all live in the same quarter. This is the fourth time that the group has sought financial help from ALIDé, in order to boost their businesses. The group leader, Fatima, has her hand raised in the photograph. She is 46 years old and lives in Benin. She never went to school, and is married to a man called Didier. The couple has five children, all of whom attend school, and only two of whom remain in their care. Fatima lives with her husband and these two children. In order to meet the family's various needs, Fatima has sold charcoal in her quarter for the past 15 years. She sources her goods from the northern part of Benin. In order to satisfy growing customer demand, and to boost revenue, Fatima and the other members of MAHOUKPEOU are seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé. The first three have all been repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal San Ignacio De Colon.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ruth, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos ya todos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos  aun vive con ella y estudia en la universidad, sigue medicina. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, tanto de primera necesidad como también artículos de bazar, papelería, bebidas y helados, allí  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando tiene tiempo pero por lo general ella siempre está en ella ya que allí se entretiene, los productos los recibe en su local. Tiene siete años con su negocio y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de papelería y bazar. Lleva en el banco comunal ya por siete ciclos y le gusta por los créditos que ofrecen la institución.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the San Ignacio de Colon community bank meet in San Ignacio, in Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for its hard-working people who farm and raise livestock.

This is where we meet Ruth, age 55.  She is married, and they have seven children.  Her children are all adults, but the youngest one still lives with her.  He is studying medicine at the university.  Her husband is a driver.

She has a grocery store in her house.  She sells all types of products.  She sells as many basic needs products as variety store items, stationery products, drinks, and ice cream.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m., sometimes even longer.  Her son and her husband help her with her work when they have time.  However, she is almost always there.  That is where she keeps herself busy and where she takes delivery of the products she sells.  She has had her business for seven years, and it is going quite well.

She will use this loan to stock her store more.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, other variety store items and stationery products.  She has been in her communal bank for seven cycles, and she likes it because of the loans that the institution offers.

Her goals are to get ahead in her business and to grow more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, other variety store items and stationery products.

loans.name: Miwononvi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIWONONVI est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Louise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Louise est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Louise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Louise est mariée et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Louise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Louise vend depuis sept ans, des fruits et des condiments dans son quartier. Louise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu,  Louise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIWONONVI, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The MIWONONVI group is made up of three people who all live in the same quarter. This is the fourth time that they have sought a loan from ALIDé in order to boost business. The group leader, Louise, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 37 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school. Louise is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She lives with her husband and children, and the couple look after the family's needs together. In order to meet her family's demands, Louise has sold fruit and condiments in her quarter for the past seven years. She sources her goods from northern Benin. In order to satisfy growing customer demand and to boost revenue, Louise and the other group members are seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé. All three previous loans have been successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and condiments

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: La señora María , se dedica a comercializar ropa nueva y la venta de sopas. Su primer crédito lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería como pantalones, camisas, ropa interior de ambos sexo entre otros. También lo invirtió  en comprar productos como verduras, pollo y especies para su negocio de las sopas. Actualmente solicito el crédito para invertirlo en comprar sandalias shorts y blusas estilo verano para aprovechar la época de semana santa al igual que invertirá en su negocio de sopas ya que por tradición la sopa de queso incrementa sus ingreso en esta época. Ella es una de nuestra excelente cliente  está muy agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito  Su expectativas es agradar su negocio y establecer una comideria para continuar mejorando.
texts.en: Maria has a business selling new clothing and she also has a business selling soup.  She invested her first loan in the purchase of merchandise, including pants, shirts, undergarments for both men and women, and other items.  In addition, she bought products such as vegetables, chicken and spices for her business selling soup.  Now she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of sandals, shorts and summer blouses so that she can take advantage of the upcoming Holy Week (week before Easter).  She will also use the loan to invest in her soup business, because the traditional cheese soup increases her sales in this time of the year.  Maria is one of our best clients, and she is very grateful to Kiva and MiCredito.  Her expectations are to expand her business and set up an eatery so that she can continue to see improvement.

loans.use: to buy sandals, shorts and summer blouses

loans.name: Fanny Tobias Carrillo

texts.es: Fanny de 56 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 27 a 37 años.   Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de almuerzos a domicilio, actividad que inició desde hace 6 años, haciendo almuerzos para su hija, a quien le llevaba su almuerzo diariamente  y como a las compañeras de trabajo de esta,  les gustó la sazón con que los preparaba, la convencieron para que les hiciera los suyos; poco a poco otras empresas la reconocieron  y hoy tiene más de 45 clientes fijos diariamente.  Sus ventas las hace a crédito y no es posible comprar los insumos en mayor volumen, por eso cada dos días debe ir al mercado y así se incrementan los costos producidos por el transporte. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará arroz, aceite, carnes y otros insumos en mayor volumen,  para disminuir la frecuencia de compra y lograr tener un inventario para ampliar su oferta. Esta es justamente la  razón  de éxito de su inversión.
texts.en: Fanny, 56, lives with her partner and has 4 children aged 27 to 37 years old. She works in the preparation and sales of food delivered to homes, a business she started 6 years ago. She was making lunch for her daughter every day and her daughter’s friends liked the food she was preparing, so they convinced Fanny to make them their lunch, too. Little by little, other companies joined in and now she has over 45 fixed clients per day. Since she sells on credit, she’s not able to buy ingredients in large quantities, so she has to go to the market every two days, which increases her transportation costs. She’s requesting a Kiva loan, her 1st one with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy rice, oil, meats and other ingredients in large volume so she can diminish the frequency of shopping trips and still have a large inventory of products to offer her customers – this is why the loan will be a success.

loans.use: buy rice, oil, meats and other ingredients in large volume.

loans.name: Neffer Violeta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Neffer, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que también se  dedica a la cría de pollos con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta, tiene una pequeña granja en la cual mete hasta 200 pollos por temporada la misma que puede ser de dos a tres meses, también cría gallinas criollas las cuales se venden a mejor precio que los pollos de granja ya que su sabor es delicioso. Ella vende sus animalitos  a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa, también vende los pollos  enteros o por libras  a personas de la localidad o entrega en tiendas de su ciudad. Lleva más de seis años dedicada a esta actividad la misma que le permite distraerse y ganar algo por su cuenta.

Este crédito es para comprar más pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que tengan un mejor crecimiento. Este es su quinto ciclo en el Banco comunal y le gusta por el cumplimiento tanto de las socias como de la institución.
  
Sus sueños son tener una granja más grande y una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Nueva Luz' community bank meet in the city of Santa Ana.  This city is known for its beautiful landscape and for its freshwater pools which are very popular with tourists. 

Here we meet 57-year-old Neffer who is married and has four children who are already grown up and no longer dependent on her.  Her husband is a driver.

Neffer is a great homemaker who also raises chickens so that she can earn some money herself.  She has a small farm where she keeps 200 chickens a season.  Seasons can last two or three months.  She also raises Creole hens which she sells for a better price than the normal farmyard chickens because their flavor is delicious.  She sells her animals to salespeople who come to her home.  She also sells her chickens whole or by the pound to people in her town or delivers to local stores.  She has been in this business for more than six years and it allows her to enjoy herself and earn some money of her own.

Neffer will use this loan to buy more chickens, as well as feed and medicines for them so that they grow better.  This is her fifth loan cycle as a member of her community bank and she likes it because of the way in which both her fellow group members and the institution fulfill their requirements.

Neffer's dream is to have a larger farm and a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy chickens, as well as feed and medicines for them

loans.name: Linner Tatiana

texts.es:
En San Ignacio de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal San Ignacio De Colon.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Tatiana tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 14 y 8 años de edad, los dos mayores están en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
 
Ella estudia el decimo semestre de medicina en una Universidad de Manabí, además de estudiar una dura carrera como es la medicina también se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño bazar en su casa en el cual vende ropa, zapatos, cosas de regalo y productos de Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas).  Atiende su negocio en sus momentos  libres, los fines de semana y feriados, también vende sus productos en la universidad a sus compañeras de clase. Con este negocio ella ha podido pagar sus estudios y salir adelante. Lleva cinco años con su negocio y le ha ido bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos de bazar como: regalos, zapatos, ropa de todo tipo, perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la unión del grupo y las facilidades que brinda la institución. 

Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y ser una gran medico.
texts.en:
In San Ignacio, Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hard-working people dedicated to agriculture and cattle raising, the members of the San Ignacio de Colon Communal Bank gather every 15 days.

Here we meet Tatiana, who is 40 years old and married. The fruit of this relationship is 3 children, aged 16, 14, and 8 years old. The eldest 2 are in high school while the youngest is in primary school. Tatiana's husband is a driver.
 
Tatiana is in her 10th semester of medical school in the University of Manabi. In addition to studying for a demanding career, she has a small store in her home, where she sells clothing, shoes, gifts, and Yanbal and Avon beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies accessories. Tatiana attends to her store in her free moments, on weekends, and holidays. She also sells her products to classmates at the university. With this business, she has been able to pay for her studies and continue forging ahead. She has had the business for 5 years and things have gone fairly well.

The loan is to buy articles to sell, including gifts, shoes, clothing of all types, perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry among other things. This is the 5th loan cycle at her communal bank and she likes the group unity and the benefits that the institution offers.

Tatiana's dream is to complete her studies and become a great doctor.

loans.use: buy gifts, shoes, clothing, perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus  balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Rosa tiene 53 años  de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, el menor de sus hijos vive en su casa.

Ella aprendió corte y confección muy joven en una academia de la localidad, tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser  todo tipo de ropa, lo que más le gusta hacer es ropa de damas aunque también elabora camisas y ropa de niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también  en temporada de inicios de clases elabora uniformes para escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, lleva más de 15 años con su taller y casi nunca le ha faltado trabajo.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones  y otros materiales para la costura. Este es su quinto ciclo en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad donde también pueda vender sus obras.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, in the city of Santa Ana, known for its beautiful scenery and fresh water beaches that are frequented by many tourists, the communal bank Nueva Luz (New Light) has a meeting.

This is where we meet Señora Rosa.  She is 53 years old and a single mother of two grown children.  The youngest lives with her.

Señora Rosa learned dressmaking at a local school.  She has a small sewing workshop in her home, where she has been sewing all types of clothing for many years.  What she likes best is making women's clothing, although she also makes shirts and children's clothing.  She works from customers' individual orders and during the back to school season, she makes uniforms for local schools. Señora Rosa works every day from 6:00am until 10:00pm and sometimes even later if she has orders to deliver.  She has been in this business for more than 15 years and almost never has a lack of work.

This new loan will be used to purchase fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.  This is Señora Rosa's fifth cycle in the communal bank.  She likes the bank because the members are very united.
 
Señora Rosa's dreams are to have a bigger workshop and a store in the town center where she could sell her creations.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Carlos Rotela

texts.es:
El  Sr. Carlos es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 56 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Juana de 54 años de edad, Tienen 3 hijos todos mayores de edad, que trabajan en forma independiente.
Carlos se dedica a la compra, producción y venta de verduras, realiza su venta por las compañías vecinas y en el  Mercado Municipal de Santaní. Nos cuenta que tiene clientela formada, lo cual le ayuda a tener muy buen ingreso, y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, como ser tomates, locotes, cebollas, etc. Nos comenta que gracias a esto podrá abastecerse y tener mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is from the city of Santaní.  He is 56 years old and married to 54-year-old Juana.  They have three children who are all adults and work independently.  Carlos' business is buying, producing and selling vegetables.  He makes his sales to neighboring companies and in Santaní town market.  He tells us that he has an established customer base which helps him to make a very good income and thereby help his family.

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc.  He tells us that this will enable him to stock up and have a larger variety of products to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Don Anastacio  tiene 55 años, es soltero y vive en casa propia en la Ciudad de Carapeguá. Él se dedica a la venta de queso y leche, antes trabajaba como macatero, pero la edad y otras obligaciones le obligaron a que dejara ese trabajo.
También se dedica a la agricultura, tiene plantaciones de algodón, caña de azúcar y mandioca. Él se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que siempre lucha por ser mejor cada día y de esa forma ser cada vez mejor.
Solicito el crédito para la compra de vacas ya que la venta de leche y queso le deja una buena ganancia, y le ha ayudado a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Anastacio is 55 years old, single, and lives in his own home in the city of Carapeguá. His business is selling cheese and milk.  He previously worked as a traveling salesman but his age and other obligations meant that he had to leave that job.

Anastacio also farms.  He has cotton, sugarcane and cassava plantations.  He describes himself as a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person who always works hard to improve every day.

Anastacio requested this loan to buy a cow as milk and cheese sales make him good profits and have helped him to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana es una joven mujer de 20 años, soltera y sin hijos. Vive en Santo Domingo que es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador; su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. Toda la superficie de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas"  figura como parte del territorio montañoso de la región costa, de la cordillera occidental, históricamente conocida como Provincia de Yumbos y Capital de los Colibríes. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. Es una provincia considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Desde hace tres años Ana María vende ropa de manera ambulante; ella tiene su propia clientela y su recorrido. Quiere invertir en una nueva línea de ropa que es la de bebé y de esta manera satisfacer una demanda de su clientela e incurrir con nuevos clientes. Para ello ha acudido a Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre Ana María y KIVA, en busca de un crédito. A pesar de ser su primer crédito, la evaluación que se le ha realizado determina que es un cliente con bajo riesgo de incurrir en mora.

Ana María nos cuenta que un gran obstáculo es la falta de capital, pero ahora con este crédito ella podrá crecer y con ello obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su gran sueño es poder terminar los estudios superiores y esperamos que con este crédito esté más cerca de su sueño.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman of 20, single, with no children. She lives in Santo Domingo, which is the fourth most populous city in Ecuador. Its population is growing rapidly, as it has a thriving commercial sector and the largest livestock market in the country. 

The entire province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas forms part of the mountainous coastal area in the western cordillera. It is known historically as the "Province of Yumbos" (a reference to the indigenous people), and the "Hummingbird Capital." It is located in the humid tropical region of Latin America, and is a considered a new province, as it was created in 2007.

Ana María has been selling clothing as a street vendor for three years. She has her own clientele and a route she covers. She wants to invest in a new line of clothing for babies, and in this way satisfy customer demand and acquire new customers.  

This is why she has approached Fundación Alternativa, the intermediary institution between María and Kiva, seeking a loan. In spite of the fact that this is her first loan, the evaluation that was done determined that she is a client at low-risk of falling into arrears.

Ana María tells us that lack of working capital is a great obstacle. But now, with this loan she will be able to grow, and in this way obtain greater earnings and improve her quality of life. Her great dream is to be able to finish her post-secondary studies, and we hope that with this loan, she will be closer to her dream.

loans.use: To buy baby clothing.

loans.name: Medea

texts.en:
Medea, age 51, used to run a small family pig farm, but as a result of the pig virus that spread in Georgia a couple of years ago, all the family pigs died. Now the family is left without any agricultural business. According to Credo estimations, the family lives under the poverty line and they belong to the 'vulnerable poor' category. 

Medea lives in a village in Kakheti District with her husband Alex and their two grown sons, ages 28 and 31. All four family members work as agricultural workers in the village. They engage mainly in seasonal work in village vineyards. In the spring and summer months, as well as in early fall, the total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. In the winter, this income decreases. 
 
Medea has requested credit in order to start up her pig farm. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of business start-up capital and re-startup credits with generous conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Medea will purchase a pig, which will give her at least 12 piglets per year. She will raise the piglets and breed the pigs in the farm. Later, additional piglets will be sold and the income of the family will significantly increase: in fact, it is expected to double. The living conditions of the family will improve. In the future, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase a pig for re-starting a pig farm

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is 32 years old. He lives in a small village in Imereti region, East Georgia. Zviad is married and lives with his family: wife – Ia, 3-year-old daughter, 1-year-old son and parents-in-law. The only source of income for the family is a small-scale agricultural business – in particular, a milk cow. Dairy products are mainly consumed by the family and surplus cheese is sold by Zviad in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 150 laris. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the rural poor category.

Zviad requested credit for starting up an agricultural business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Zviad will build a greenhouse. He will grow greens and vegetables there during the whole year, which will be sold at the local open market. The income of the family will significantly increase and they will be able to create better living conditions for their children and themselves. Also, in the future, they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Victor Britez

texts.es:
El señor Víctor tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su mamá en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Desde los 14 años de edad empezó a salir a vender las colchas que ellos mismos producen con su mamá, después de 6 años se independizó y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia; lleva  productos artesanales de la zona a venderlos por las ciudades de Fernando de la  Mora y Asunción,  transportándose en su motocicleta que gracias  a este trabajo logró comprarse y también brindarle a su madre la mantención  necesaria  que prácticamente depende de él.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Víctor is 21 years old.  He’s single and lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá.  He began going out to sell the bedspreads that they produce when he was 14 years old.  Six years later he became independent and began working on his own.  He uses his motorcycle, which he was able to buy thanks to his work, to take arts and crafts from the zone to sell in the cities of Fernando de la Mora and Asunción.  This is how he is able to support his mother, who practically depends on him.

He is asking for this loan to order to buy hammocks, blankets, and sheets since he has many requests for these items and he wants to meet his customer’s demands.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets, and sheets.

loans.name: Claudelino Paredes

texts.es:
El señor Claudelino tiene 46 años de edad, es casado, vive en la ciudad de Villarrica, es dueño de una escuela de conducción que está ubicada en esa ciudad.
El es padre de 2 hijos. Solicito el crédito para poder adquirir un auto, que esta de oferta y con esta inversión tener más clientela y mejores ingresos, ya que tiene gran demanda de sus servicios.
El señor agradece a la Fundación por haberle ayudado y así poder tener apoyo ya que solamente con ayuda puede obtener sus beneficios y gracias a su perseverancia y su labor diaria de sol a sol le ayuda a educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudelino is 46 years old, married, and lives in the city of Villarrica.  He owns a driving school in this city.

Claudelino is the father of two children.  He has requested a loan to buy a car which is for sale.  This investment will make him more customers and better income because he has a lot of demand for his services.

Claudelino is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for having helped him and given him support as he is only able to obtain benefits with help.  Thanks to his perseverance and his daily work from dawn to dusk, he is able to help educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a car for his driving school

loans.name: Liz Morales

texts.es:
La señora Liz tiene 18 años de edad ella es soltera  vive en la ciudad de Caacupé, ella aun no tiene hijos.    
Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de joyas de todo tipo, lo cual hace en su motocicleta. Dice que le va muy bien, pues ya tiene una clientela bien marcada, pero también nos dice que quiere seguir trabajando y creciendo, para que de esa forma pueda seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes, ya que quiere anexar la venta de estos a sus joyas, ya que quiere crecer y de esa forma atraer a más clientes día con día.
texts.en:
Señora Liz is 18 years old and single.  She lives in the city of Caacupé, and has no children yet.

She tells us that she works selling all different kinds of jewelry, which she does from her motorcycle.  She says that things are going very well for here, as she already has a well-defined customer base.  However, she also tells us that she wants to continue working and growing, as in this way she will be able to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of perfumes, as she wants to start selling them in addition to her jewelry.  She wants to grow, and in this way she will be able to attract more customers on a daily basis.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes for sale.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 32 years old. She lives in a small village in Akhmeta District. Maya isn’t married; she lives with her mother, brother, and aunt. Maya’s mother is retired; her aunt has health problems and gets a monthly pension as a person with disabilities. Maya and her brother grow vegetables on a family-owned plot of land. Most of these vegetables are consumed by the family. The family's average monthly income is 170 GEL. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs in the vulnerable poor category. 

Maya used to run a trade business. She imported clothing from a neighboring country and sold it in Kakheti region. She sold directly to consumers, as well as to local clothing stores. But because of a shortage of turnover, she stopped the business. Maya requested credit for re-starting it. Her loan request was approved under the guidelines of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans for business start-up and re-startup to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit. They are often regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the credit Maya will purchase clothing from her old suppliers in Turkey and sell it in Kakheti stores and to the local population. The income of the family will increase by 300 – 350 GEL, which is an increase of approximately 200%. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Ramaz Danelia

texts.en:
Ramaz is 47 years old. He lives in a village in the Samegrelo region of West Georgia with his family: his wife Emma, three children (10, 7 and 1 years old) and his mother.  The older children go to a local school. 

The only source of the income for the family is a small-scale agricultural business. They have a milk cow, the dairy products from which are mainly consumed by the family members.  The small surplus is sold in the village. Also the family owns 150 nut trees and they sell nuts in season. The total average monthly income for this 6-member family is 300 Laris, including the monthly pension of Ramaz’s mother. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the rural poor. 

Ramaz requested credit to purchase 2 hectares of land.  His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisioning business start-ups and re-startups with credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Ramaz will purchase 2 hectares of land. He will sow maize on the land every year and sell the harvest in the fall.  The income for the family will double and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions significantly. In the future, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market.

loans.use: buy 2 hectares of land

loans.name: Marcos Choccña Martinez

texts.es:
El señor Marco es un hombre que se ha dedicado siempre a su familia y constantemente a buscado la manera de salir adelante, actualmente brinda el servicio de transporte en su vehículo lo que le permite adquirir los ingresos necesarios junto a su esposa que trabaja como Operaria en una fábrica de la ciudad de Ica, Perú.

Marco es un padre de familia al que le hubiese gustado estudiar mecánica pero debido a distintos percances familiares no pudo cumplir con este cometido, a pesar de este suceso, con el transcurso de los años ha luchado por salir adelante y hasta el momento lo está logrando trabajando 10 horas diarias, tiempo en el que atiende aproximadamente a 40 clientes.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Marco podrá realizar las mejoras que su vehículo necesita debido que tiene algunas fallas técnicas.  El sabe que con esta reparación podrá ahorrar el dinero que necesite en circunstancias emergentes. Marc quiere esforzarse mucho más y así poder comprarse una moto taxi, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y a su vez logar su gran sueño “Tener estabilidad económica”.
texts.en:
Marco is a man who is always dedicated to his family and looking for ways for them to get ahead.  He has a taxi and this, along with his wife’s earnings from her work in a factory in Ica, Peru, allows them to earn the money they need.

Marco is a father and would have liked to have learned mechanics but because of the family, he couldn’t finish.  Despite this, he has struggled to get ahead over the years and he is working 10 hours daily now and has about 40 customers.

With the help of the Kiva loan, Marco will be able to make some improvements on the vehicle since it has some technical problems.  He knows that this repair will help him save money that he needs for emergencies.  Marco wants to make a bigger effort so he can buy a motor taxi that will allow him to increase his income and at the same time, give him success with his big dream “To have economic stability”.

loans.use: to make improvements on his vehicle

loans.name: Doris Candiote Ccaico

texts.es:
La señora Doris es una mujer de 30 años que tiene 4 pequeños, ella y su esposo se esfuerzan para poder brindarles lo mejor a sus pequeños, es por eso que su esposo trabaja como chofer en un fundo, mientras que ella tiene una bodega en la que trabaja todo el día. Esta familia vive en la ciudad de Ica, Perú, lugar reconocido por el poseer el oasis de “La Huacachina”, centro turístico que es muy visitado por los turistas que visitan la ciudad, debido a la gran atracción que representa para ellos.

Doris es una mujer que trabaja en promedio 13 horas,  tiempo en el que atiende a sus principales clientes, los cuales se encuentran en la zona en donde reside. Ella cree que su negocio tiene éxito debido a que siempre brinda el menor precio que puede a sus clientes, sabe que esta es una parte primordial en el momento en el que el cliente efectúa la compra que necesita realizar.

Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, podrá realizar la compra de una congeladora, 3 andamios, 1 mostrador horizontal y 5 balones de gas doméstico, lo que le permitirá mejorar la presentación de sus productos en su tienda, a su vez también desea implementar un nuevo producto como lo es el gas doméstico. Ella sabe que con esta nueva inversión podrá tener una tienda en donde sus clientes aprecien bien sus productos y con las nuevas ganancias que genere desea surtir mucho más su tienda y a su vez la llevará poco a poco a cumplir su gran sueño “Tener un Market en el lugar en donde vivo”
texts.en:
Señora Doris is a 30-year-old woman with four children. She and her husband work hard to offer their little ones the best. For this reason, her husband works as a driver on an estate and she works all day in her grocery store. This family lives in the city of Ica, Peru. This area is known for being the home of the La Huacachina oasis, a popular destination which draws the tourists who visit the city.
Doras works an average of 13 hours per day. During this time, she tends to her customers, who all live nearby. She believes that her business is a success because she always offers the lowest possible price. She knows that good prices are a crucial aspect of customers' purchase decisions.
With the help of the Kiva lenders, she will be able to buy a freezer, three scaffolds, one horizontal display case, and five propane cylinders.This will allow her to improve the way in which she displays the products in her store. She also wants to start selling a new product: propane cylinders. She knows that this investment will mean that her customers will be better able to see her products. With the new income from this investment, she wants to stock her store even more and get a little closer to her dream: "Having a mini market in the area where I live."

loans.use: to buy a freezer, three scaffolds, one horizontal display case, and five propane cylinders.

loans.name: Willaim Alcivar

texts.es:
WILLAIM ALCIVAR tiene 34 años de edad estdo civil unión libre tiene 2 hijos,  vive con la conyugue y los hijos
 en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 25 DE FEBRERO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Guabito de la parroquia Zapotal, pertenece al cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

 WILLAIM ALCIVAR se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, café. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar plantas de cacao, café y naranja, abonos, líquido para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos para poder poner en los cultivos de cacao. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

El sueño es poder seguir viendo a los hijos que se han personas y bien y trabajadores. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son  en el campo en el caso de que pueda ser mordido por alguna serpiente.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor y boli.
texts.en:
Willaim Alcivar is 34 years old and lives in a common-law relationship.  He has two children and lives with his spouse and the children in Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.  He is a member of 25 de Febrero Communal Bank, located in the Guabito precinct of the parish of Zapotal, in Ventanas Canton, where they work in agriculture.

Willaim Alcivar works in agriculture growing corn, cacao, and coffee.  He is requesting the loan to be able to buy cacao, coffee, and orange plants; fertilizers; and herbicide.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the fertilizers for the cacao plants.  He buys and sells in Ventanas.

His dream is to be able to continue seeing his children become well-off and hardworking people.  The challenges he faces are in the fields, where he could be bitten by some snake.  In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: to buy cacao, coffee, and orange plants; fertilizers; and herbicide.

loans.name: Beatriz Del Carmen

texts.es:
BEATRIZ DEL CARMEN tiene 28 años de edad es divorciada tiene 1 hijo, vive con el hijo y con los familiares en Chimbo provincia de bolívar.

BEATRIZ DEL CARMEN tiene un puesto en el mercado se dedica a la venta de cd y videos juegos. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar mercadería cómo CD, Videos.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar el negocio . Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Chimbo o en San Miguel.

 El sueño es ampliar el negocio. El desafío al que se enfrenta es la competencia  y las enfermedades.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con el hijo.
texts.en:
Beatriz del Carmen, 28, is divorced and has one child.  She lives with her child and with family members in Chimbo, province of Bolívar.  Beatriz has a stall in the market.  She works selling CDs and video games.

She is requesting the loan to be able to buy merchandise such as CDs and video games.  With the help of the loan she will be able to increase her business selling CDs and video games.  She buys and sells in Chimbo or in San Miguel.

Her dream is to expand her business.  The challenges she faces are competition and illness.  In her free time she likes to go out with her son.

loans.use: to be able to buy merchandise such as CDs and video games.

loans.name: Santa Barbara De Casablanca Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Santa Bárbara de Casablanca” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran venta de artículos de paquetería, preparación de comida rápida, amasandería, servicio de taxi, artesanía en lana y costuras, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Casablanca, ubicada en la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Tomasa delegada del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila de pié, detrás del sofá es la tercera de izquierda a derecha, su cabello lo usa hasta el hombro, ondulado y es de color castaño oscuro, con chasquilla. Viste una polera sin mangas estampada, en la foto solo se alcanza a ver su brazo y una parte de su polera.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la cosmetología, realizando limpiezas de cutis y vendiendo cremas de belleza. Comenta que realizó un curso de cosmetología y se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 30 años.
Los productos que necesita para realizar sus servicios, los compra en un local especialista en productos de belleza para profesionales, en la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Además comenta que también se dedica a prestar servicios de coctelería, prepara y vende desde su casa, ya que estudió banquetería. Ella también arrienda sillas, mesas, manteles, servicios para comer, entre otros.
Con el crédito comprará manteles o una máquina para realizar masajes al cutis.
Tomasa vive junto a su marido y su hijo de 22 años de edad, quien estudia en la Universidad, la carrera de Trabajo Social.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que considera ha sido un tremendo apoyo para su negocio.
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal, comenta que son muy unidos y organizados.
Casablanca es una comuna de la provincia de Valparaíso, ubicada en la región del mismo nombre. Tiene un clima de tipo mediterráneo, con veranos de sequía prolongada y lluvias invernales cortas, pero muy fuertes. El nombre “Casablanca” proviene del siglo XVI cuando existía “una casa de muros blanquecinos” sobre una loma ubicada a un costado de uno de sus caminos más antiguos, llamado camino real de carretas. 
Actualmente su economía se basa en servicios, agricultura, transporte, agroindustria, turismo, comercio.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Santa Bárbara de Casablanca' and it has 19 members who are all entrepreneurs and work in different fields including: selling packaging items, preparing fast food, running a bakery business, providing a taxi service, knitting handicrafts, sewing, etc.  All of the bank's members live in the town of Casablanca, in Valparaíso province.

Tomasa is the community bank's delegate.  In the photo, she is standing in the second row behind the sofa.  She is the third person from the left.  She has dark-brown, shoulder-length, wavy hair and bangs (fringe).  She is wearing a patterned, sleeveless top.  In the photo you can just make out her arm and part of her top. 

Tomasa is in the cosmetology business.  She provides a skin cleansing service and sells beauty creams.  She says that she completed a cosmetology course and has been in this line of work for 30 years now.

Tomasa buys the products that she needs for her services in a specialist beauty product store that serves professionals, in the city of Viña del Mar.  She tells us that she also provides cocktail bar-tending services.  She completed a catering course and she prepares and sells her products from home.  She also hires out chairs, tables, tablecloths, dinner services, etc.

Tomasa will use her loan to buy tablecloths and a machine for carrying out skin massages.

Tomasa lives together with her husband and a 22-year-old son who is studying for a college degree in social work.  She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza as she considers it to be a tremendous support for her business.  Regarding her community bank, she says that they are very united and organized.

Casablanca is a town in Valparaíso province, which is located in the region of the same name.  This area has a Mediterranean-type climate with summers of prolonged drought and short, but heavy, winter rains.  The name 'Casablanca' comes from the 16th Century when there was a house with white walls on a hill to the side of one of the area's oldest roads called 'Camino Real de Carretas'.  The town's economy is currently based on services, farming, transport, agribusiness, tourism and commerce.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths and a machine for performing skin massages

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet wants a loan to buy sodas and sugar to sell.  She is aged thirty-six and lives in Masindi, Uganda.  She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her two children and her dream is to see them graduate.  She has saved UGX 500,000 and started a retail shop.  Her desire is to build a permanent house and expand her business into new markets.

loans.use: to buy sodas and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 34 años, es una mujer muy responsable; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Teodoro de 33 años y sus 03 hijos a quienes les desean brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Vilma, es empeñosa y sobre todo activa; desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron todo sobre los cultivos de plantas de cacao y café; productos que por su mayoría llegan a cultivar. Ella junto a su esposo llegaron a obtener sus propias tierras con plantas de cacao hace 15 años y comenta que le ha ido muy bien con sus cosechas porque gracias a sus ventas logró obtener su casa donde ahora reside. La necesidad que tiene ahora es poder realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas porque ya se viene sus próximas cosechas y necesita tener grandes producciones para poder solventar los gastos de su familia sobre todo con la educación de sus hijos. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP y se siente muy contenta de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero; siendo a sí ella se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus cuotas de pago. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria.
Con los 1.000 nuevos soles comprará abono y otros fertilizantes para mantener sus siembras.
texts.en:
Vilma, 34, is a very responsible woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Teodoro, 33, and their three children, for whom they want to provide a better quality of life. Vilma is a diligent and, above all, active woman. Since she was very young, her parents taught her everything about cultivating cacao and coffee, a majority of the crops they came to grow. 

Fifteen years ago, she and her husband acquired their own land, planted in cacao. She notes that they have done very well with their harvests because, thanks to their sales, they were able to buy the house where they now reside. Now they need to maintain their crops since harvest time is approaching and they require a large production in order to pay household expenses as well as their children’s school fees.

This will be Vilma’s first loan with MFP and she is very happy knowing that she will have financial support. She is committed to making her payments on time. She is a very active and caring member in her communal bank.

With the S/. 1,000 she will buy compost and other fertilizer to maintain her fields.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yonson

texts.es:
Yonson de 22 años es un joven entusiasta. Está casado con Sara, con quien tiene una hija: Miluska. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Purhuaracra, distrito de San Pedro de Cajas – Tarma. Yonson se dedica a la agricultura. Desde que unió su vida con la de su esposa decidió desenvolverse con responsabilidad en esta actividad. “Siembro zanahorias y papas de las variedades Yungay y de Color, porque es más rentable”, dice.
