La zanahoria es una de los frutos que le gusta cultivar, ya que su cosecha es cada 4 meses y siempre hay demanda, pero el problema es la baja de precios que muchas veces perjudicaron su economía, por eso también cultiva papas y otras verduras para equilibrar sus ingresos en todos los meses del año.
Afirma que esta empezando de a poco, pero que sus metas son claras. Desea ampliar su producción y salir de la ciudad con sus cosechas. Para ello deberá sembrar en más terrenos y ahorrar más dinero. Confía que lo logrará con esfuerzo y constancia. Yonson recibiría su crédito número 3 de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Productores de Purhuaracra” y se siente contento de tener socios solidarios y emprendedores. Con el dinero podrá comprar bolsas de abonos orgánicos como guano de corral y granja, para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de zanahorias y papas.
texts.en:
22-year-old Yonson is an enthusiastic young man.  He is married to Sara and the couple have one daughter: Miluska.  They live together in their own home, in Purhuaracra, in San Pedro de Cajas - Tarma.  Yonson is a farmer.  When he joined his own life with that of his wife he decided to develop responsibly in this business.  "I grow carrots and Yungay and Color varieties of potato because it is most profitable", he says.

Carrots are what Yonson most enjoys growing because he can harvest them every four months and there is always demand.  However, the problem he faces is the lowering of prices which very often damages his finances.  For this reason, he also grows potatoes and other vegetables to balance his income throughout all the months of the year.

Yonson says that he is starting slowly but his goals are well defined.  He would like to expand his production and take his harvests elsewhere to sell.  In order to achieve this, he will have to sow his crops on more land and save more money.  He believes that he will manage this with effort and perseverance.  Yonson will be receiving his third loan from MFP and he gives his word that he will be punctual in making his monthly repayments.  He is a member of “Los Productores de Purhuaracra” community bank and he feels happy because all the members are supportive and entrepreneurial.  He will use his money to buy bags of organic fertilizer such as guano and farmyard manure which he will spread over his carrot and potato crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.es: Rodelia de 47 años tiene 8 hijos cuyas edades oscilan entre los 25 y 7 años. Vive con 5 de todos ellos y su esposo en una casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Tiambra, distrito de Huasahuasi –Tarma. Desde niña le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y convivir con ella, “me gusta estar en el campo, me siento tranquila”, menciona. Ya tiene más de 30 años de experiencia, en todo este tiempo logró obtener grandes hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. En el transcurso del tiempo heredó a sus hijos, para no perder la tradición familiar. Siembra principalmente papas, habas y arvejas. Cuida con mucho esmero y cuidado toda su producción, pues confiesa que su principal pasatiempo es limpiar la maleza que crece entre los sembríos. Siembra de papas en distintas variedades y menciona que, ahí radica sus buenas ventas. Asimismo cuida de sus animales vacunos, los que le proporcionan un dinero extra, pues los enseba y comercializa a buen precio. Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo. Le gustaría sembrar en más terrenos agrícolas, pero para eso deberá ahorrar y comprarse otra parcela. Aún así Rodelia se siente contenta con su labor. Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se responsabiliza en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Por recomendación de vecinos y familiares, ahora pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, se siente contenta por tener socios solidarios y confiables. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos para fertilizar sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en:
Rodelia, 47, has 8 children whose ages oscillate between 25 and 7 years.  She lives with five of them and her husband in a house of her own located in Tiambra Annex, Huasahuasi-Tarma District.  

Since she was a little girl she was taught how to work the land and coexist with it.  “I like to be in the fields; I feel at peace,” she mentions.  She has more than 30 years’ experience already and in all this time she managed to obtain large hectares of farmland.  In time she passed some on to her children so as not to lose the family tradition.  She grows primarily potatoes, broad beans and peas.  She is very careful and dedicated to her crops because she admits that her main pastime is clearing weeds that grow among her crops.  She plants different varieties of potato and mentions that this is the source of the good sales.  

She also cares for her cattle that produce a little extra money because she fattens them up and sells them for good prices.  Her main difficulty is the lack of capital.  She’d like to plant more fields but to do so she must save up to buy another parcel of land.  Even so, Rodelia is happy with her work.

This would be her first loan with MFP so she takes on the commitment to be punctual with her monthly installment payments.  Thanks to recommendations from neighbors and family members she now belongs to the “Villa Visca” communal bank and she feels happy for having supportive, trustworthy fellow members.  She will invest the money in the purchase of sacks of organic manure to fertilize her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys de 32 años convive con Yony, el padre de su único hijo: Misael de 12 años. Gladys y su familia viven unidos en la casa de sus suegros, ubicada en el caserío Villa Visca, distrito de Huasahuasi – Tarma. Desde hace 5 años comenzó a realizar su principal actividad económica: la agricultura.  Sus más importantes sembríos constan de papa y arveja; los cuales abona constantemente para después vender su cosecha en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Afirma que la compra y venta de papa, es lo que más le gusta; pues viaja constantemente a la costa a comercializar sus cosechas. Además de tener el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como peón en diferentes cultivos, donde le pagan un jornal de 25 soles al día, obteniendo así una ganancia extra para poder solventar los gastos familiares y  la educación de su hijo, por lo que está pensando sembrar en mayores cantidades para ahorrar y así abrir un negocio en la que estará más tranquila. Éste sería su crédito número 6 que recibiría de MFP, por eso agradece anticipadamente el apoyo. Confirma que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, del que se siente a gusto por el trabajo en equipo. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos para esparcirlos en sus sembríos de papas.
texts.en:
Gladys, 42, lives with Yony, the father of her only son, Misael, 12.  Gladys and her family live together in her in-laws’ house located in the hamlet of Villa Visca, Huasahuasi-Tarma District.  Five years ago she started her main economic activity: farming.  Her most important crops are potatoes and peas which she constantly fertilizes in order to sell her harvests in the city of Tarma’s wholesale market.  

She affirms that what she enjoys most is buying and selling potatoes because she travels to the coast constantly to sell her crops.  Besides, her husband helps her working as a day laborer in various fields where they pay a laborer a daily wage of 25 soles thus obtaining extra income to cover family expenses and her son’s school costs.  She is thinking about planting larger amounts in order to save and open a business that she will be more tranquil in.

This would be loan #6 that she’d get from MFP so she is giving thanks in advance for the support.  She confirms that she will make her monthly installment payments punctually.  She belongs to the “Villa Visca” communal bank where she feels comfortable because of the teamwork.  She will use the money to buy sacks of organic manure to spread among her potato plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Yvoty Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la ciudad de  Caacupé. Ellas se encuentran en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, el grupo tiene 14 integrantes, donde el trabajo es lo esencial y también la ayuda mutua.
Adriana es la presidenta del grupo, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de carbón, en lo cual le va muy bien, debido a que últimamente este es muy utilizado ya que el gas está muy caro. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para una mejor vida. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón, lo cual le ayudara a poder abastecerse y de esa forma poder tener más en stock.
Todas las integrantes del comité están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva por el valioso apoyo que les brinda para poder mejorar sus condiciones financieras en la sociedad.
texts.en:
The women who belong to this committee are from the city of Caacupé.  They are in their third loan cycle within Fundación Paraguaya's "Entrepreneurial Women's Program".  The group has 14 members and work and mutual help are the most important things to them.

Adriana is the group's president and she tells us that her business is selling charcoal.  Her business is doing very well thanks to the fact that charcoal is very popular right now because gas is very expensive.  Thanks to her work, Adriana is able to help her family and give them what they need in order to live a better life.  She is requesting this loan to buy charcoal which will help her to stock up and have more produce available.

All the members of this committee are very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for their support which enables them to improve their financial situation as a group.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre “Divino Niño Jesús” y están en el Primer Ciclo  con 23  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas.   Tratan de trabajar siempre dentro de un ambiente de respeto, ayuda mutua y cooperación. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas misma y las de sus familias.
Diana es muy trabajadora, y cuenta que tiene una heladería desde hace ya un tiempo, en lo cual le va muy bien, puesto que en Paraguay el mayor tiempo del año hace calor, por lo que tiene mucha venta de helados. Su meta es por medio de su trabajo ir creciendo día a día y ser cada vez mejor.
Solicita la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya y de Kiva, para la compra de helados, con lo cual podrá tener una mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes, y de esa forma atender a la exigencia de estos.
texts.en:
This group is named “Divino Niño Jesús” (Divine Baby Jesus) and they are in their first loan cycle.  The group has 23 members and stands out in their neighborhood for being very supportive of each other and responsible.  They always try to work in an environment of respect, mutual help, and cooperation. Their goal is to improve their living conditions and those of their families. 

Diana is a hard worker.  She tells us she has had an ice cream shop for some time.  The business is going very well since it is hot in Paraguay most of the year, so she has a lot of ice cream sales.  Her goal is to grow day by day and improve through her business.  

She is requesting help from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to purchase ice cream so that she can have a greater variety to offer her customers and meet their demand.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream for sale.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité El Progreso está integrado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní. Ellas son vecinas y amigas de uno de los barrios de esa ciudad, y entraron a formar parte del programa de la fundación paraguaya pues vieron en esta una gran oportunidad de progreso, el cual les será de mucha ayuda en sus negocios.
Lorenza cría animales, como ser gallinas, patos, cerdos. Comenta que le gusta lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto, gracias al cual mantiene y ayuda a su familia. Ella día a día se esfuerza por salir adelante y poder progresar. Es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollitos y cerdos pequeños para la cría, y así tener más animales para poder venderlos. Agradece ella y también su grupo, por la ayuda que reciben, pues les es de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The community bank El Progreso [Progress] is made up of ten women from the city of Santaní. They are neighbors and friends from one of the neighborhoods of this city. They decided to become part of Fundación Paraguaya's program because they saw in it a great opportunity for progress, which would be a lot of help for them in their businesses. 

Lorenza raises animals like chickens, ducks and pigs. She says that she likes what she does, since it's a decent - and above all, honest - job. Thanks to her work she maintains and helps her family. Every day she works hard to get ahead and to make progress. She is a very determined and entrepreneurial woman. 

Lorenza is requesting a loan to buy chicks and piglets to raise, so that she'll have more animals to sell. She and her group appreciate the help they receive, which means a lot to them.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Juan Ramirez

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 62 años de edad, está casado con la señora Nymia también, tienen 2 hijos ya mayores de edad que los que ayudan en la casa.
Don Juan y su esposa tienen una sastrería en la cual confecciona trajes, sacos y chalecos para particulares y empresas muy conocidas de la capital del país. Comenta que se dedica a esto hace más de 20 años, por lo que ya tiene una vasta experiencia sobre este trabajo.
El señor Juan solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos y botones en cantidad ya que tiene una cantidad importante de prendas que confeccionar y desea cumplir con sus clientes.
El señor Juan es una persona muy seria y responsable y lo más importante para él es su familia y cumplir con sus obligaciones contraídas.
texts.en: Juan is 62 years old, married to Nymia and has 2 grown children who help around the house.  Juan and his wife have a tailor shop where he tailors suits, jackets and vests for important individuals and well-known businesses in the country's capitol.  He comments that he has been earning a living in this way for more than 20 years, and has quite a bit of experience in this line of work.  Juan is requesting this loan in order to purchase fabric, thread and buttons in bulk since he has quite a long list of outfits to tailor and he wants to be able to come through for his customers.  Juan is a very serious and responsible person and the most important thing for him is his family and to follow through with his contracted obligations.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread and buttons in bulk.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité es de la ciudad de Caacupé. Está integrado por 16 mujeres, todas vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad. Ellas se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, y su meta es poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Lilian, la presidenta del grupo, nos comenta que tiene una mercería donde todo tipo de artículos, como ser ropas, calzados, artículos de bazar, librería y demás. Su negocio tiene mucho éxito porque tiene mucha variedad de productos, y eso la ayuda mucho.
Solicita el crédto para poder abastecer su local con prendas y calzados, y de esa forma seguir teniendo bien surtido su negocio, el cual es el medio de sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The women of this communal bank group are from the city of Caacupé. The group is composed of 16 women, all neighbors and friends of this city.  They are in their fourth loan cycle of the Paraguay Foundation program for enterprising women and their goal is to be able to reach the maximum level of the program.  
Lilian, the president of the group, tells us that she has a general store where she sells all kinds of articles, such as clothes, footwear, knick knacks, stationary and more.  Her business has had a lot of success because she has a good variety of products, and that helps a lot.  She requests a loan to be able to supply her store with garments and footwear, and in that way to continue having a good assortment in her business, which is the sole means of earning a living for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear to supply the store.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
El comité “MUJERES VICTORIOSAS” Se inicio en el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Todas las integrantes del comité se esfuerzan día a día para el bienestar de sus familias, para que estas tengan un futuro mejor y distinto del que a ellas tocó vivir.
Maria, presidenta del grupo, nos comenta que es un poco difícil estar a cargo de muchas mujeres, pero que con la ayuda de ellas mismas, es un poco más ligero. Ella nos dice que se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, como ser empanadas, sándwich tortillas y demás. Dice que le va muy bien, pues sus clientes gustan de los alimentos que prepara.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, condimentos, verduras y demás insumos para seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende. Está contenta por formar parte del programa de la fundación paraguaya.
texts.en: The group “Mujeres Victoriosas” (Victorious Women) started the program of Entrepreneurial Women Foundation of Paraguay.  All the members of the group work hard every day for the well-being of their families, so that they can have a better and different future than the one they lived.  Maria, president of the group tells us that even though it's difficult to be in charge of these many women, with their own help the work is lighter.  She sells all kinds of food, such as empanadas, sandwiches, tortillas and others.  She says she does well because her clients enjoy the food she prepares.  She requests a loan to buy meat, chicken, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients to continue making food for sale.  She is happy to be part of the program of the Paraguayan Foundation.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Itacua Poty Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité Itacuá Poty, está integrado por 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, prueba de ello es que ya se encuentran en el ciclo número 16 del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Luz es una de las miembros del grupo, y ella se dedica a la venta de chipa, el cual es un alimento tradicional del Paraguay. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien, debido a que la chipa se come en todo momento del día, y del año. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de chipas, con lo cual podrá tener en stock, y de esa forma hacer frente a la demanda de sus clientes. decida Esta muy agradecida con la fundación por la ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
There are 12 women members of the Itacuá Poty communal bank in the city of Caacupé. These women are hardworking fighters, the proof of which is that they are in their 16th loan cycle with the women entrepreneurs program of the Paraguayan foundation.

Luz is one of the group's members. She sells "chipas," (cheese buns) which are a Paraguayan traditional food. She tells us it is going well because these buns are eaten throughout the day and year round. Her goal is to be able to keep working and supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy cheese buns to have in stock and, in this way, meet the demand of her customers. She says she is very grateful to the foundation for the help she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy cheese buns to sell.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
La Alegria es el grupo formado por 10 mujeres formado en la ciudad de Caacupé. Son personas con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor, y su meta es poder trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto tener un mejor estilo de vida. Actualmente están en el ciclo 3 del programa de comité de mujeres de la fundación paraguaya.
Nilda, una de las miembros, se define como una persona muy creativa, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías en madera que ella hace y vende. Nos cuenta que sus artesanías son muy reconocidas ya que las personas lo aprecian mucho.  Gracias a su habilidad es que ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia, y de esa forma darles lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de madera, barniz, y herramientas para seguir haciendo sus artesanías.
texts.en:
Alegria [Happiness] is a group of 10 women from the city of Caacupé. These women want to move ahead and have a great entrepreneurial spirit. Their goal is to be able to work together and, by working as a team, to have a better lifestyle. They are now in their 3rd loan cycle with the Paraguayan foundation's communal bank for women.

Nilda, one of the members, describes herself as creative and hard working, with a great desire to succeed. She sells wood handicrafts that she makes. She tells us that her handicrafts are well known, as people truly appreciate them. Her skill has allowed her to get ahead. She can also help her family this way and meet their needs each day.

She is requesting this loan to buy wood, varnish, and tools to continue making her handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, tools, etc.

loans.name: Lujan Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado lujan se conformo en la ciudad de Asunción. Actualmente este comité se encuentra en su 2do. ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad  en las participaciones en las actividades y en las reuniones y los deseos de progresar que tienen  cada una de las que integrantes, además de la responsabilidad en los pagos. Desean que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones laborales y educativas por eso se esfuerzan el doble para poder brindar a sus hijos oportunidades de progreso.
Emilce es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella nos cuenta que tiene una despensa, con la cual trabaja desde hace ya un tiempo. Gracias a su trabajo ha podido dar a su familia lo que necesitan para un mejor estilo de vida. Su deseo es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, panificados, lácteos y demás insumos necesarios para que pueda tener bien surtido su negocio, y de esa forma estar siempre abastecida para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Lujan," was formed in the city of Asunción.  Currently it is on its second loan, and the sense of responsibility in the participation in the activities and meetings stands out.  Each one of the members has a desire to progress, and they also feel responsibility with their payments.  They hope that their children don't have the same work and educational limitations, and that is why they put forth double the effort to offer their children opportunities of progress.

Emilce is one of the members of the group.  She tells us that she has a grocery store, which she has had for awhile now.  Thanks to her work, she has been able to give her family what they need to have a better lifestyle.  Her wish is to keep working and it that way to continue helping her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy drinks, baked goods, dairy products, and other necessary products so she can stock her business well.  In this way, she will always be supplied for her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock a grocery store.

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Prosperidad” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran confección de ropa, pastelería, peluquería, producción de queso, venta de ropa y preparación de comida rápida. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Sara delegada del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al final de la foto, en la última fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, usa su cabello corto y es de color castaño claro. 
Ella se dedica al rubro de la chocolatería y también a la vitrofusión (Arte de vidrio fundido a temperatura alta). Comenta que las temporadas de más alta demanda son a partir del mes de abril. Se desempeña en estos rubros desde hace 10 años. 
Su horario de trabajo es flexible, algunas horas durante la mañana y la tarde, de lunes a viernes. 
Promociona sus productos de boca en boca, ya que tiene bastante clientela. 
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes distribuidoras, vidrierías y mercados, en los cuales encuentra precios más convenientes económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará materiales e ingredientes para su negocio.
Sus metas son surgir en su negocio y tener la posibilidad de enseñarle a más personas, éste oficio.
Sara vive junto a sus dos hijas de 19 y 8 años de edad. Su hija mayor estudia en la Universidad, la carrera de enfermería.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que el grupo del cual forma parte es muy ameno y solidario.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Prosperity," and is made up of 19 entrepreneurs, who work in various sectors. These include dress-making, pastry shop, hairdressing, cheese-making, clothing sales, and fast-food preparation. All the members live in the city of Talca.

Sara is the representative of the communal bank group. She is seen in the back part of the photo, in the last row, occupying the second spot from left to right, and has short, light-brown hair. 

She has a chocolate-making business, and also does vitrofusion (a craft involving glass melted at high temperature). She says that the seasons with the highest demand are from April on. She has been carrying on this work for 10 years. Her work hours are flexible; a few hours during the morning and afternoon, from Monday to Friday.

She promotes her products via word-of-mouth, as she has quite a number of customers.  She buys her merchandise at various distributors, glassworks, and markets, where she finds more affordable prices. With the loan, she will buy materials and ingredients for her business. Her goals are to see her business grow, and have the chance to teach this trade to more people.

Sara lives with her two children, ages 19 and 8. Her eldest daughter goes to university, studying nursing. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, as it will allow her to invest in her business. She says that the group she belongs to is very nice and supportive.

Talca is part of Maule region, located in the central area of the country. It serves as the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region, being   the most important city in the Central Valley of Chile.  

There is a curious allusion to Talca in Chile, the expression "Talca, Paris, and London." Among the many myths about the matter, some say that it derives from something an English person once said, "Talca looks like London" [Spanish "parece" 'looks like' and "París" 'Paris' sound alike] because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in the winter season, similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: To buy materials and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Kuña Kyre'y Group

texts.es:
Kuña Kyre'y es el grupo formado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas son mujeres muy capaces y luchadoras, y han visto en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya una gran oportunidad de progreso y de ayuda. El grupo es reconocido en el barrio por la unión que demuestran a la hora de trabajar juntas.
Delia cría animales, y nos comenta que hace esto desde hace ya mucho tiempo. Cría gallinas, chanchos, patos, ovejas y demás tipos de animales, y nos dice que su sueño es poder tener una gran granja donde poder tener todo tipo de animales, los cuales podrá criar y luego vender.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para los animales, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la gran ayuda que le están dando.
texts.en:
The Kuña Kyre'y Group is comprised of ten women from the city of Santaní.  They are very capable and hardworking, and they view Fundación Paraguaya’s women entrepreneurs program as a great opportunity for progress and support.  The group is recognized in the neighborhood for the unity they show when working together.  

Delia raises animals and tells us that she has been involved in this activity for a long time.  She raises hens, sows, ducks, sheep, and other types of animals.  She tells us that her dream is to have a farm where she can raise all types of animals for later sale.  She is requesting the loan to purchase balanced feed for the animals, which will be a great help.  She is grateful to the foundation and Kiva for the support they are providing.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for the animals.

loans.name: Maria Paredes

texts.es:
La Sra Maria es casada tiene 2 hijas, vive en casa que con mucho esfuerzo tiene en la ciudad de Encarnación. Ella es dueña de un local de ventas de comidas en donde trabaja hace  más de 3 años.
Maria comenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que los platillos que se venden en su local son de muy buena calidad. Ya ha logrado formarse una clientela muy bien definida, lo que la ayuda con los ingresos del día a día. Su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder continuar ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos necesarios para su establecimiento de comida, como ser panificados, hortalizas, aderezos, y demás. Agradece, pues la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya y de Kiva le será muy beneficiosa.
texts.en:
Maria is married, has 2 daughters and lives in her own house in the city of Encarnación. She owns a food stall, where she has worked for more than 3 years. 

Maria tells us that her sales are good because the dishes she makes are very good quality. She already has a firm clientele, which helps her daily income. Her goal is to continue working in order to continue helping her family. 

She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients for her food stall, like bakery items, vegetables, seasoning and other. She is grateful to the Paraguayan Foundation and Kiva for the very beneficial help she’s about to receive.

loans.use: buy bakery items, vegetables, seasoning and other.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 27-year-old married woman with two children, aged between 7 and 3 years old. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home and from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. Her greatest monthly challenge is seasonality. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase cloth for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 53-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 26 to 34 years. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for twenty years and employs one staff member. Her business is located at a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Anne will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase another cow. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Humprey Tsuma

texts.en:
Humprey is a married man with one child who is still too young for school.  He owns a house that has piped water but not electricity.  His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past eight months, he has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) business, operating from town to town, where his potential clients are town dwellers. He faces a major challenge of competition from other bodaboda operators in the area. Humprey dreams of becoming a big supplier of poultry in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 he wants to start another business and purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed.  He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia Yaneth es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora ella actualmente se dedica al negocio de manualidades ella elabora diveros trabajos como servilletas,manteles entre otros,la socia a la vez trabaja en la compra y venta de mercaderia por campaña ,por ejemplo anteriormente estaba con la campaña navideña y actualmente la socia  vendera en esta camapaña escolar cuadernos,lapiceros,zapatos entre otros,la socia es una persona bien responsable siendo de esta manera que la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio de campaña escolar como cuadernos,zapatos y lapiceros.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a hardworking, enterprising woman who currently works selling crafts; she makes various things like napkins and tablecloths, among others.  At the same time she is a seasonal merchandise merchant.  For example, she was previously with the Christmas season and now she will start selling for the school season notebooks, pencils and shoes, among others.  She is a very responsible person and this is the way she supports her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her business during the school season like notebooks, shoes and pencils.  She is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and commits to make her installment payments according to the corresponding payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like notebooks, shoes and pencils.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia sells mobile phone credit at Mpohor near Takoradi. She is a single parent with one child. Anastasia has been selling mobile phone credit for two years now. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her child and pay school fees. She needs this loan to buy more mobile phone credit to sell. With the new profit, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more mobile phone credit to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a peddler in cosmetics at Mpohor near Takoradi. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason.  

She has been selling cosmetics for three years. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family.
 
Joyce will use her loan to purchase more cosmetics for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to acquire a shop for the sale of the cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 28-year old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a motorcyclist whereby he has to remit 50% of the daily earnings to his boss monthly. He also has to manage for the breakdowns of the motorcycle by himself. He also faces a challenge of high fuel and transportation costs. Through all these hardships, James is determined to buy his own motorcycle and start saving so as to meet his dream of building a permanent home and buying land to grow crops. He needs this loan to buy his own motorcycle for the transport business.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en: Geneva is a forty year old hardworking lady with three children living in Kasese Uganda. She has been selling clothes for fifteen years and her major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas and she has applied for a loan to help her buy more bithenge for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mimbi Group

texts.es:
16 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso se han unido con las ganas de ayudar a su familia por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas. Las miembros han visto en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, una gran ayuda, no solo para ella sino también para sus familias.
Leonidas forma parte de este grupo, y ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo. Trabaja todos los días de sol a sol, ya que desea poder ayudar siempre a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Ella desea sentirse útil, y es por ello que formo parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras.
Solicito el préstamo  para la compra de ropas, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio y de esa forma ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, y también atraer a nuevos.
texts.en:
Sixteen women from the city of Mariono Alonso have united with the desire of helping their families through working together.  The members view Fundación Paraguaya’s women entrepreneurs program as a great help, not only for themselves, but also for their families.  
Leonidas is part of this group and she tells us that she sells all types of clothing.  She works every day from dawn to dusk because she always wants to be able to help her family through this work.  She wants to feel useful and this is the reason she is a member of the women entrepreneurs program.  
She is requesting this loan to purchase clothing, with which she will stock her business.  In this way, she will be able to offer a wider variety of clothing to her customers and also attract new customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for re-sale.

loans.name: Francisco Manuel Martinez Cordero

texts.es: Francisco de 44 años, vive con su cónyuge y  tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 10 a 25 años. Él es propietario de una recicladora que tiene aproximadamente 3 años de estar en funcionamiento, producto de la iniciativa de su cónyuge y que está  ubicada en un corregimiento cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla; allí trabaja con su cónyuge    y su suegro, comercializando  cobre, aluminio, lata, acero, bronce, cartón y otros tipos de materiales reciclables.   Con los ingresos generados por esta actividad,  cubren sus gastos familiares y del negocio.  Con sus ventas que son principalmente a dos clientes importantes de la ciudad, cubren sus costos y gastos operativos, su capital de trabajo está representado básicamente en existencias de material reciclable, no tiene pasivos actualmente y cuenta con unos activos fijos básicos para el desempeño de su negocio. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propio camión para el traslado de los productos reciclados, pero su capital de trabajo es insuficiente en este momento para lograrlo. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará material reciclable en mayor cantidad,como cobre, aluminio, lata, acero, bronce, cartón, para atender la demanda de su clientela; el éxito de esta inversión radica en que la venta está garantizada y que responderán oportunamente a su mercado, pues hay veces se quedan cortos ante la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco, 44, lives with his spouse; they have five children whose ages range from 10 to 25 years.  He owns a recycling center that’s been in operation about three years and which arose through his spouse’s initiative and is located in a small town near the city of Barranquilla.  He works there with his spouse and his father-in-law selling copper, aluminum, tin, steel, bronze, cardboard and other types of recyclable materials.  With his sales that are mainly to two important clients in the city he’s able to cover family and operational costs.  He currently has no passives but has some basic fixed assets that are necessary for his business.  His goal for later on is to have a truck of his own to transport the recycled materials but his working capital is insufficient at the moment to reach it.

He’s currently applying for his first Kiva loan which is also his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy recyclables in larger amounts like copper, aluminum, tin, steel, bronze and cardboard to meet customer demand.  Success of the investment rests on the fact that his sale is guaranteed and they will be able to respond to their market in an opportune way because sometimes they fall short of meeting customer demand.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en: Phanice is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to establish another business of selling charcoal. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the previous loan, she was able to pay school fees for her children who attend school.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is a twenty nine year old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to have self education. He has been dealing in passion fruits for ten years, after starting with savings from farming. His major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and the high cost of fuel. However, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops. Denis needs a loan to buy bags of passion fruits to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of passion fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.She doesn’t have to take care of additional family members.

Angella has a business of selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Angella sells her products from home, by means of retail. Angella has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of passion fruits and oranges. She also generates additional income through selling beer and soda. The main business challenge(s) for Angella include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms. 

Angella lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, fees and electricity.

loans.use: to buy more bags of passion fruits and oranges.

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupé Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Caacupé es el grupo de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas son mujeres jefas de familias, que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder dar a sus familias todo aquello a lo cual ellas no pudieron tener acceso. Son mujeres muy entusiastas, que desean progresar y salir adelante, es por ello que siempre se ayudan las unas a las otras.
Neria es una de estas mujeres, ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora, que incansablemente día a día se esfuerza por darle lo mejor a los suyos. Ella se dedica a la costura y nos comenta que le va muy bien, debido a que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos y eso le ayuda a atraer a mas clientes. Su meta es seguir creciendo y así seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder abastecer su taller con telas, hilos, agujas, gomas, botones y demás insumos para seguir trabajando y creciendo. Ella, como el grupo, agradecen por la oportunidad de progreso que están recibiendo de kiva y fundacion paraguaya.
texts.en:
“Virgen de Caacupé” is the group from the city of Santaní.  They are female heads of household who strive to the maximum in order to provide their families with everything they themselves never had access to.  They are very enthusiastic women who want to make progress and to get ahead and this is why they always help each other out.

Neria is one of these women.  She defines herself as being a very hardworking person who tirelessly strives day to day to give her loved ones the best.  She is a seamstress and she comments that she does very well because she’s always known how to do good work and that helps her attract more customers.  Her goal is to continue growing and thus continue to help her family.

She requested the loan to stock her shop with fabric, needles, thread, adhesives, buttons and other supplies to continue working and growing.  She, like the group, are grateful for the opportunity to progress they are getting from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Diana Cortissoz De La Rosa

texts.es: Diana de 41 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad con sus dos hijas en las edades de 13 y 17 años, que en su condición de viuda ha logrado sacarlos adelante, mediante su trabajo en la tienda de su propiedad, donde vende ranchos víveres, carnes, pollos, abarrotes y en general todos los artículos de la canasta familiar. Su negocio inició desde hace 4 años, cuando debió dejar de ser empleada de una fábrica de calzado, y su madre quien cuidaba de sus hijas enfermó. Así fue como se ideó una manera de generar ingresos desde su hogar y al mismo tiempo mantenerse pendiente de la educación y el cuidado de sus hijas. Cuando indicó esta actividad,  lo hizo vendiendo chicha de maíz, galletas, bebidas de frutas tropicales congeladas o bolis y gelatinas. Poco a poco reunió dinero con sus ganancias y compró su primera vitrina y con ello paulatinamente artículos de tienda que surtieron su vitrina. Diana se siente satisfecha con su trabajo y desea continuar su crecimiento empresarial y desde hace 2 años accedió a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y hoy está aplicando a un credikiva,  tercer crédito que hace a esta organización, porque con su apoyo ha logrado capitalizar el negocio y avanzar en su vida productiva y familiar. Con su credikiva comprará víveres y mercancías para surtir su tienda , con lo cual aspira a tener un capital de trabajo adicional, que le permita aumentar sus ventas y obtener un poco mas de utilidades..
texts.en:
Diana, 41, lives in the south of the city with her two daughters who are 13 and 17 years old and who in her widowed state she’s been able to move ahead through her work in her grocery store where she sells foodstuffs, meat, chicken, groceries and in general everything that’s basic staple items for a family’s use.  

Her business began four years ago when she had to leave employment in a shoe factory and her mother who cared for her children became ill.  This is how she got the idea of generating income from home while still watching over her children’s education and care.  When she started this activity she began selling “chicha de maiz” [corn-based beverage], cookies, “bolis” or frozen tropical fruit drinks and gelatin.  She gradually amassed money from her profits and bought her first display case and started to stock it piecemeal.

Diana feels satisfied with her work and wants to continue business growth and two years ago she accessed her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Today, she’s applying for a Kiva loan, her third financing with this organization because with its support she’s succeeded in capitalizing the business and advance in her productive and family life.

She will use her Kiva loan to buy foodstuffs and merchandise to stock her store hoping to have additional working capital that will allow her to increase sales and obtain a little more profit.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a twenty-five-year-old hardworking man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent home. 

He has been operating a retail shop for four years now. He started with capital of 2,500,000 only and now his business is worth 5,000,000. The major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase enough stock. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and diversifying his business to include farming. 

Alfred needs the loan to buy rice and sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Khushbakht

texts.ru: Хушбахт житель города Истаравшан. Возраст, 27 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу и занимается торговлей. У него имеется пекарня, где он печет лепешку для торговли. Кредит берет для ремонта пекарни и дома.
texts.en: Khushbakht lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is 27 years old, married, and has two children. His wife takes care of the household. Khushbakht is an artisan and a merchant - he owns a bakery where he makes flatbreads for sale. He is taking this loan to repair his bakery and his home.

loans.use: to repair his bakery and his home

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is 61 years old and married with 8 children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.    

Mama needs a loan of WST 2000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 Talas per week) to support the immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Mama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Mama's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: buy farm supplies and equipment to grow  taro

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Because of her previous loan, Loan's family living conditions are more stable and her business is running smoothly. She plans to use her next loan to invest capital in her business by purchasing more foods and beverages for resale from her food stall / general store. She and her husband hope that the loan will assist them to earn more income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase food and beverages for resale from her food stall / general store

loans.name: Foketi

texts.en:
Foketi is 49 years of age and has two children.

Foketi owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Foketi needs a loan of WST 750.00 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2012, Foketi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Foketi's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Seese

texts.en:
Seese is 21 years of age and married with 1 child. She owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 1 year of experience in this business.

Seese needs a loan of 1000 Samoan talas (WST) to purchase young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas, or US $83 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Seese joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Seese's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase young crops to raise

loans.name: Faamanuiaga

texts.en:
Faamanuiaga is 47 years of age and married with 7 children. She owns and operates a business venture selling taro and banana chips in the local community. She has 3 years of experience in this business.

Faamanuiaga needs a loan of 1750 Samoan talas (WST) to purchase cooking oil,plastic bags,banana and taro . She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas, or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Faamanuiaga joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Faamanuiaga's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil,plastic bags,banana and taro .

loans.name: Malia  Pepe

texts.en:
Malia is 75 years old, a widow with seven children.

Malia Pepe owns & operates a business venture selling dairy products in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Malia Pepe needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 260 talas or US $108 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Malia Pepe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Malia Pepe's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Palolo

texts.en:
Palolo is twenty-one years of age and married.

Palolo is starting a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Palolo needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2012, Palolo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Palolo's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 49, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, a driver, and the mother of three children, all of whom are studying. She keeps herself busy attending to her kids and running a business that will help to sustain their daily expenses. 

Teresita operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families eat only home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to pay for cooking gas and food for one or two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Aside from this, she also sells silver accessories and processed meat for additional income.She also operates a jeepney unit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and also frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Teresita dreams of a good future for all her children. She wants her business to grow and have more customers. She hopes that her faith in God will continue to grow.  She faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* meetings because she wants to know more about Christ Jesus.  

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora, 39, a resident of Pasong Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Santiago, a heavy equipment operator, and she is the mother of their children. By the grace of God, Leonora has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to send her children to school. 

Leonora oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have two units of jeepney that has a capacity of 18 persons, which is paying them a boundary (daily quota) each day. Their regular customers are students and employees in the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney units. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Leonora dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
 
-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

La señora María es la tesorera del Banco, responsabilidad que ha llevado muy bien desde que se inicio el Banco, y le gusta mucho los beneficios adicionales que ofrece la Fundación Espoir.

Tiene 49 años de edad y está casada hace 29 años y tiene 4 hijos, tres de los cuales aun viven con ella, su esposo es Ing. agrónomo y se dedica a varios trabajos temporales de su profesión.
 
Ella estudio belleza en una Academia de Manabí, tiene un gabinete de belleza en su casa  en cual realiza diversidad de trabajos desde cortes de cabello, tinturados, pintado de uñas, maquillajes y varios trabajos más, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 con la ayuda de su hija ya que ella sola no puede atender a su numerosa clientela que la prefieren por el buen trabajo que realiza.  También allí mismo  vende productos de belleza y  cuidado personal el cual lo hace mientras realiza sus trabajos, ella tiene más de 8 años su salón y le va muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar tratamientos capilares, tintes, esmaltes, shampú y varios materiales más.  Lleva más de dos años en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le da la institución con los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener un SPA.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, in the city of Santa Ana, known for its beautiful scenery and fresh water beaches frequented by many tourists, the members of the communal bank Nueva Luz (New Light) have a meeting.

Señora María is the treasurer of the communal bank, a responsibility she has carried out out very well since the bank first formed.  She likes the communal bank because of the additional benefits offered by Fundación Espoir.

Señora María is 49 years old, has been married for 29 years and has 4 children, of whom three still live with her.  Her husband is an agronomist and makes his living in the various seasonal jobs of his profession.
 
Señora María studied beauty at a school in Manabí.  She has a beauty consultancy in her home.  She provides various treatments, such as hair cuts, hair coloring, nail painting, makeovers and a variety of other services.  She works every day from 8:00am until 6:00pm.  Her daughter helps her, since she alone cannot tend to her numerous clientele, who prefer to come to her because of her excellent work.  She also sells beauty and personal hygiene products, which she offers while she works on her clients.  Señora María has had her salon for more than 8 years, and it has been going very well for her.

This new loan will be used to purchase hair treatments, dyes, nail polishes, shampoos and various other items.  Señora María has been with the communal bank for more than two years, and she likes it because of the help the institution provides with the loans.

Señora María's dream is to have a SPA.

loans.use: to purchase hair treatments, dyes, nail polishes, shampoos etc.

loans.name: Dionesa

texts.en: Dionesa is widow with five children. She is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. Dionesa earns a living by providing transportation services to local community members. She has been doing this for three years, and every month she earns PHP 2,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair a vehicle used in the transport business. In 2009, Dionesa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Dionesa hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in her transportation business

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de Lourdes se formó con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las miembros formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Delia es una de estas mujeres, ella comenta que tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida, con la cual abastece a sus vecinos. Comenzó solo con la venta de algunas cosas, pero gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido crecer y salir adelante, y a la vez ayudar a su familia.
Ella quiere surtir su negocio, es por ello que solicita el crédito a la fundación paraguaya y Kiva, ya que desea comprar verduras, hortalizas, maíz, azúcar, manteca, etc., pues con ello podrá cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de Lourdes” committee was formed when several neighbors and friends from the city of Santaní joined together to form a very united group that’s capable of helping each other out through their teamwork.

Delia is one of these women.  She comments that she has a well-stocked small grocery store with which she supplies her neighbors.  She started selling just a few things but thanks to her effort she’s been able to grow and get ahead while at the same time helping her family.

She wants to stock her store so is asking Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for a loan because she wants to buy vegetables, greens, corn, sugar, lard, etc. so that she can meet customer demand with this.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, corn, sugar, lard, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Mbachio Group

texts.es:
El comité “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS DE MBACHIO” se encuentra en el séptimo ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas. Todas anhelan esperanzadas por un futuro mejor para sus familias e hijos.
Fatima es una persona muy creativa y lo demuestra en las zapatillas bordadas que hace. Comenta que sus zapatillas son muy pedidas por sus clientas, y es por ello que le va muy bien. Ella desea poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma sobresalir y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatillas, hilos, lentejuelas y demás insumos que necesita para hacer las zapatillas bordadas.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras de Mbachio” (Enterprising Women of Mbachio) committee is in its seventh cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women Program.  All the members carry out productive activities and all hope for a better future for their families and children.

Fátima is a very creative person.  She demonstrates this in the embroidered slippers she makes.  She comments that her slippers are in high demand by her customers so she does very well.  She wants to be able to continue to grow and stand out and help her family.

She’s asking for the loan to buy slippers, thread, sequins and other supplies she needs to make the embroidered slippers.

loans.use: to buy slippers, thread, sequins and other supplies.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es: Bernarda de 30 años de edad, tiene una bebé de meses de edad,cuenta con el apoyo economico de su compañero de vida que trabaja como docente  y asume los gastos del hogar. Bernarda tiene 6 años  de trabajar docente de secundaria,  solicita su  2do  crèdito para terminar  de construir una habitación de esta manera tener mejores condiciones en su hogar y darle mas valor a su propiedad,  esta pequeña familia  obtiene otros ingresos impartiendo clases privadas en sus horas libres. Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su bebe creza sano y fuerte y que su matrimonio permanezca unido.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 30 years old and has one baby who is a few months old.  She has the economic help of her life partner who works as a teacher and covers the household expenses.  Bernarda has worked for six years as a secondary school teacher, and she is asking for her second loan in order to finish construction of a room and in this way have better conditions in her home and improve the value of her property.  This small family gets other income giving private classes in their free time.

Her greatest dream in life is that her baby grow strong and healthy and that her marriage stay together.

loans.use: to complete construction of a room.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 55, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Dennis, a driver, and she is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Helen operates the family's van rental business. They have one van that they rent for local transportation or for out-of-town service. They provide their services within the city and nearby provinces. In addition, Helen also operates a small bakery to earn additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and residents of the local community. She earns a minimum of 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and to pay for maintenance of her van. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Helen hopes to have another branch and dreams to be able to give her children a high-quality education through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance for her rental vehicle.

loans.name: Kuljan

texts.ru:
Кулжан 47 лет, воспитывает дочь - третьеклассницу. Кулжан на протяжении 15 лет занимается предоставлением услуг общественного питания, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 30,000 сом (KGS). Профессиональная подготовка в поварском деле, упорный и настойчивый труд позволяет Кулжан иметь ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулжан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку витринного холодильника и закуп продуктов. Это позволит Кулжан расширить меню кафе  и обрести новых клиентов. Доходы от кредита Кулжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Kuljan is 47 years old. She is raising a daughter who attends third grade. For 15 years, Kuljan has been operating a cafe, having started her business with a sum of 30,000 som (KGS). Her formal training as a cook, as well as her hard and persistent work, allow Kuljan to earn 20,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her business, Kuljan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy a refrigerated display unit and to stock up on ingredients. This will allow Kuljan to expand the cafe's menu and to attract new customers. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and food products

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as spices, sugar, soap, noodles, canned goods, etc.  She is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her food vending business.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can send her 4 children to college in the future.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, 37, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice for over ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a mechanic who earns approximately USD 8 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Phalla is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a generator to run a business of electricity provider in the village. 

This purchase would enable her to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a concrete house to provide more convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a generator to run the business of electricity provider in the village

loans.name: Morm

texts.en:
Morm, sixty, is widowed and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about USD 5 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Morm is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money she saves on transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Merlinda has a retail shop where she buys and sells  groceries scanned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Merlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Janice has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Janice has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita works hard to support her family. She is married and earns a living by selling scrap and junk in the Philippines. She has applied for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more recycled materials to sell. She has been in this business for five years, and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La Dra. Nelly es soltera y tiene un hijo menor. Alquila un local en la ciudad de San Lorenzo donde funciona su consultorio odontológico, desde el año 2007.
Ella vive con su madre, donde ahora está construyendo un pequeño departamento. Nos cuenta que anhela poder construir su salón propio para trasladar su consultorio hasta allí y poder de esa forma trabajar sin tener que estar haciendo gastos innecesarios como ser el alquiler.
 Necesita de este crédito para comprar insumos de tratamientos odontológicos para los numerosos tratamientos e intervenciones de mayor grado que realiza a sus pacientes, ya que eso es esencial para su trabajo. Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad de progreso que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Dr. Nelly is single and has a minor son.  She rents a locale in the city of San Lorenzo where her dental office has been operating since 2007.

She lives with her mother where she’s currently building a small apartment.  She tells us that her wish is to build her own space and move her dental office there so that she can work without having unnecessary expenses like rent.

She needs this loan to buy dental supplies for the numerous treatments and interventions of a higher caliber that she carries out on her patients since this is essential for her work.  She is grateful for the opportunity to make progress she’s receiving.

loans.use: to buy dental supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia Benitez

texts.es:
La Sra. Cecilia, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Reinaldo hace 28 años, del matrimonio nacieron 5 hijos; todos ellos viven en su humilde casa de la Ciudad Coronel Oviedo. 
La Sra. Cecilia es comerciante hace más de 11 años, tiene una mercería-librería en su casa por la cual se desvive ya que es el sustento de la Familia. Comenzó con un pequeño local de Artículos de Librería que poco a poco fue creciendo con su empeño y la ayuda de su familia. Comenta que en esta época el tema del negocio es muy difícil porque hay mucha competencia por lo que hay que luchar para mantener a la clientela con buenos precios, variedad y por sobre todo carisma en el buen trato a todos que son clientes de su comercio. 
 Se acercó a la Fundación con el objetivo de solicitar una pequeña ayuda, ya que desea comprar insumos tales como cuadernos, carpetas, libros, hojas, mochilas, etc, con lo que podrá surtir su negocio y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 49, has been married to Reinaldo for 28 years; they have five children.  They all live together in their humble house in the city of Coronel Oviedo.

Cecilia has been a merchant for more than 11 years.  She has a variety store-stationery shop at home where she does everything she possibly can because it’s her family’s source of support.  She started out with a small space selling stationery items which gradually grew with her work and help from her family.  She comments that nowadays business is difficult because there is a lot of competition and one must struggle to retain customers with good prices, variety and above all charisma and good customer treatment for all who patronize her shop.

She called on the Fundación to ask for a small help because she wants to buy some supplies like notebooks, folders, books, sheets of paper, backpacks, etc. to stock the store and continue working.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Ivan Ernesto

texts.es: Ivan de 31 años de edad es casado, se desempeña como docente de secundaria del instituto el Almendro, solicita su primer crèdito para pagar una maestria en docencia universitaria ya que logro conseguir una media beca por medio del actual gobierno, el cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa quien tambien se desempeña como docente de secundaria en la misma escuela, ademàs obtienen ingresos mensuales de la venta de cosméticos y venta de ropa interior que en sus horas libres venden, ambos son reconocidos en el municipio son ser honesto y muy trabajadores, profesan la religion evangelica, su mayor sueño en la vida estar bien con Dios y que su familia siga en el buen camino.
texts.en:
Ivan is 31 years old and is married.  He works as a secondary school teacher in the Almendro institute.  He is requesting his first loan to pay for a masters degree in university teaching now that he has received a partial scholarship from the current government.  

He has the help of his wife who also works as a secondary school teacher in the same school.  They also have monthly income from the sale of cosmetics and underwear that they sell in their free time.  Both are known in town as honest and hard-working.  They are evangelicals and their greatest dream in life is to be well with God and that their family continue on the right path.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a masters degree.

loans.name: Rosa Adelaida Garcia Cevallos

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus  balnearios de agua dulce que son visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

La señora Adelaida tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad y estudian en universidad. Está en el Banco hace nueve  ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado en el transcurso de este tiempo para aumentar su negocio que es su fuente de ingreso.

Ella es una muy buena madre que para solventar los gastos de sus hijos se  dedica a la venta de ropa, de producto Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza y perfumería y accesorios para damas) y también vende productos naturales, lo que más vende es ropa interior de mujer que son muy solicitadas por las damas y los productos naturales, tiene muchos clientes que le comprar sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada ocho días, trabaja todos los días unas cinco horas y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, lleva más de 15 años dedicada al comercio y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, productos naturales y cosméticos.

Su sueño  es comprar una casa en la ciudad ya que donde viven es alquilado.
texts.en:
