El grupo las lupitas Agradece a la fundacion el apoyo y la confianza que les han dado al otorgarles este prestamo.
texts.en:
The group Las Lupitas is formed by nine joyful and hardworking ladies, each of them doing a different business activity:  Carmela, Maria de Guadalupe and Esperanza sell clothing; Reyna and Maricruz sell sodas, Guadalupe does tailoring and sells cosmetics, Luz Maria sells snacks, Virginia sells groceries and Elizabeth sells shoes, this group is located in the community of Vicente where one of the main sugar cane producers of the area is located called La Magarita and the majority of the inhabitants are workers in the plantations of sugar cane.

Maria Guadalupe sells clothing to help support her family.  Her husband works as a contractor but what he makes is not enough because the current economic situation gets worse each day.  Her business is very good, but she needs to re-stock it to increase her revenue and help her husband provide a better quality of life to their daughters.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of a variety of blouses, pants, dresses, shorts, skirts, undergarments, because she thinks that having a well stocked business with a variety of products sales will go up.  

Maria lives with her husband and two daughters ages eight and six.  All her income goes to provide for daily necessities and for school.  It is very important to her that her daughters get a good education so they can make a good life for themselves when they become adults.

Maria is a hardworking person and she wants to be a successful business woman.  She feels it's important to establish a good example to her children, so they can see that if you work hard you can have a better life.

The group Las Lupitas is thankful to the institution for the support and trust shown by giving them a loan.

loans.use: to buy different dresses, blouses, pants, shorts, t-shirts.

loans.name: Solidario Roma Group

texts.es:
Una integrante del grupo Solidario Roma es Elba María de 52 años quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 10 años ella inicio vendiendo chiverías, frescos y gaseosas. Su meta es convertir su venta en una gran distribuidora.

Las otras integrantes son Ana Jacoba quien vende cosméticos desde hace 3 años y Carmen se dedica a la venta de productos Avon, zermat y productos lácteos.
texts.en:
One member of the group Solidario Roma is Elba María. She is 52 years old and has had a small grocery store for ten years. She started selling dairy products, drinks and soda. Her goal is convert her store into a big distributor. 

The other members are Ana Jacoba, who has sold cosmetics for three years, and Carmen, who sells Avon and Zermat products, and dairy products.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 4 años en especial comercializa pantalones y camisas. Ella solicita el crédito mujer el cual está destinado para el uso personal de las clientas en especial el autocuido.
Ellas utilizaras para gastos médicos.
texts.en: Ms. Maria de Jesus is a hard-working woman and micro-entreprenuer who has been selling clothing for the last four years, especially pants and shirts. She is requesting a 'woman's personal care loan,' intended for clients use for their medical care. These loans are utilized to cover medical expenses.

loans.use: To obtain a medical checkup.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Christine is 22 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 4 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her small business which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more stock into the business and will help Christine to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house and buy a car for herself. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Christine's future prospects by helping her to learn life planning skills.

loans.use: to add more stock to the business

loans.name: Oscar Moises Ampie Moreno

texts.es: El señor Oscar, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su familia, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que gracias a los financiamientos obtenido por kiva, el cultivo de piña ha sido todo un éxito en cuanto a los cuidados para que se desarrolle bien la fruta y sea de muy buena calidad, el mayor problema está en la oferta que existe del producto, ya que él tiene que mejorar precio para vender su producto. Don Oscar espera que el próximo año les vaya mejor. El necesita el financiamiento para seguirle dando el mantenimiento al cultivo  y necesita comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para iniciar la inducción.
texts.en: Mr. Oscar lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his family, their future plans are to improve their life conditions, because thanks to the five loans from Kiva, the pineapple plantation is doing really good in terms of its conditions and development of the fruit for it to be of very good quality, the biggest problem is that he is facing with his product is that he has to offer a better price to sell more pineapple. Oscar hopes that next year will go better.  He needs the loan to give maintenance to the plantation and and to purchase fertilizer and other agricultural inputs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Arely Del Socorro Salazar Lopez

texts.es: La señora Arely mujer emprendedora que se dedica al comercio, hace ya 10 años de contar con la bendicion de su pulperia. Arelys le complace la confianza que le han brindado Afodenic y kiva, mismos que han sido el motor para ella ofrecerle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo con necesidades especiales; aunque goza con el apoyo moral y economico de su señor esposo su anhelo es seguir agrandando su negocio, que es su principal fuente de ingreso; razon por la que este nuevo credito lo invertira en la compra de los siguientes productos: granos basicos (arroz, frijol, aceite, maiz) cosmeticos, productos farmaceuticos, golosinas, articulos escolares, ropa, leña entre otros. Su plan a futuro es convertir su pulperia en una gran miscelanea y producto a sus ganacias seguir haciendole mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Arely is an enterprising woman who works as a merchant, has had the blessing of her store for ten years already.  Arely is happy about the trust placed in her by AFODENIC and Kiva, which have been her driving force for giving the best to her young son who is still in secondary school.

Even though she has the moral and financial support of her husband, her desire is to continue expanding her business, which is her main source of income.  This is the reason for this new loan, which she will invest in buying the following products: basic necessities (rice, beans, oil, corn), cosmetics, pharmaceutical products, sweets, school supplies, clothing, and firewood, among others.

Her plan for the future is to convert her store into a big general store and continue making improvements on her home with the profits.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities and other items for her store.

loans.name: Rhina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rhina, tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene tres hijos, que aun son dependientes, ella administra una tienda de productos domésticos, ella tiene un año de estar en el negocio, este surgió por iniciativa propia y con la ayuda de su esposo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de pan dulce, boquitas, paletas, bombones, chocolates, y otros más productos que son necesarios para atender a los clientes que son demandantes, lo que le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio y mejorar las ventas.
La aspiración de Rhina es mantener el negocio bien surtido, contar con bastantes clientes demandantes, y proveer a sus hijos lo necesario.
texts.en:
Rhina, who is 25 years old, lives with her husband and has three children, who are still dependents. She runs a domestic products store. She has had this business for a year, and it sprang up from her own initiative and with the help of her husband.

She is applying for a loan to purchase sweet breads, snacks, popsicles, confections, chocolates, and other products that are in demand and are needed to serve the customers and that will help her strengthen her business and improve sales.

Rhina's aspiration is to keep her business well stocked, to have enough customer demand, and to provide the necessities for her children.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread, snacks, popsicles, confections, and chocolates.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 8 children and all them are not in school. She takes care of one additional family member (father). She is a tailor. She operates her business from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 6 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads. Her major business challenges are increase in prices of clothing materials and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to start a tailoring school and also to open up a boutique. She lives in her own house but the family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and threads

loans.name: Asina

texts.en:
Asina's group is comprised of hard-working women. Asina is 23 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. For the past 3 years Asina has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells traditional clothes. 

To help expand her business, Asina has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more stock into the business, which will help Asina to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Asina hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a car and build a house of her own. 

Asina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Asina's future prospects by helping her to learn about herself.

loans.use: to add more stock into the business.

loans.name: Agness' Group

texts.en:
Agness's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Agness is 22 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, Agness has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells row food. 

To help expand her business, Agness has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and will help Agness to generate greater profits, pay school fees for her children, and add to her business. Agness hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Agness is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Agness's future prospects by helping her to learn life planning skills.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de pollo frito, vive con sus tres hijos menores de edad y que son dependientes de ella, Ana se dedica a la compra de pollo para venderlo ya frito, ella lo compra crudo y lo cocina para ofrecer las piezas, tiene dos años en el negocio, que surgió por iniciativa propia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo  para la compra de pollo, aceite y gas propano, estos materiales son los que necesita para que el negocio siga bien, produciendo más pollo frito para fortalecer sus ingresos.
La aspiración de Ana es mejorar su condición económica a través de su desarrollo en el negocio, apoyando a sus hijos para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Ana makes a living selling fried chicken.  She lives with her three children, who are young and still dependent on her.  Ana purchases raw chicken and then cooks it and sells pieces of fried chicken.  She has had this business for two years, and developed it through her own initiative.   
  
Ana is asking for a loan so she can purchase chicken, oil, and propane.  These are the items she needs for her business in order to keep producing fried chicken and thus improve her income.  

Ana’s main goal is to support her children and improve her economic situation by developing her business and continuing to make progress.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, oil, and propane.

loans.name: Tamaz Jimshitashvili

texts.en:
Tamaz is 38 years old. He lives in a village near the town of Telavi, Kakheti Region. Tamaz is married and lives with his family: his wife, Lali, and 21-year-old son. 

Tamaz is a car artisan. He has his own workshop in the village where he works together with his son. They mainly serve the population of Telavi and nearby villages. Tamaz and his son are experienced artisans and provide quality service to their clients; therefore they have enough clients to make their business profitable. The family's total average monthly income is 950 Laris. 

Tamaz requested credit for purchasing additional tools and equipment for the workshop. With new tools and equipment they will be able to diversify the services provided to the drivers and thus attract additional clients. The profit of the workshop will increase. Tamaz plans to reinvest the increased profit for further development of the workshop, in order to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for his auto repair workshop

loans.name: Ayimevo Group

texts.fr: AYIMEVO est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui exercent leurs activités dans le même marché. Le représentant du groupe du nom de Joachim (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 42 ans. Joachim est marié et a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Joachim vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme et assure ensemble avec sa femme les charges de la maison. Joachim n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Joachim mène comme activité la vente d'articles de quincaillerie depuis une vingtaine d'année au Benin. Joachim s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Joachim sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe AYIMEVO, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group Ayimevo is composed of four people working in the same market. The group’s representative, by the name of Joachim (raising his hand in the photo) is 42 years old. Joachim is married and has four children, all in school and in their parents’ care. Joachim lives together with his wife and children and, jointly with his wife, provides for various household needs. Joachim did not attend school. In order to support himself, for about 20 years Joachim has been selling hardware supplies in Benin. Joachim stocks up in a market of Benin. With the goal of better meeting expectations of his growing customer base and increasing his profits, Joachim, together with the other members of the Ayimevo group, is requesting his fifth loan from ALIDé. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy hardware supplies.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Heriberto es de la ciudad de Luque, está casado con  la señora Benita, tienen con 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio.
El señor anteriormente trabajaba con sus padres en la compra y venta de mercaderías, pero hoy en día él se dedica a la venta de guitarras, sombreros, arpas, etc. 
Actualmente no cuenta con un local propio ya que se dedica a la venta directa, posee varios clientes por la zona de Luque y alrededores. Le gustaría  contar con un local propio mas adelante y que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria ya que el no tuvo la misma suerte, ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos. 
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de Guitarras. Arpas, Sombreros etc., con lo cual podrá surtirse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Heriberto is from the city of Luque. He is married to Señora Benita. They have two children who are in school.

In the past he worked with his parents in the purchase and sale of merchandise, but now he sells guitars, sombreros, harps, and so forth.

At this time he does not have his own shop, since he works in direct sales. He has a number of customers in the zone of Luque and the surrounding areas. In the future he would like to have his own shop and have his children complete university studies, since he did not have the same luck, since his parents had few resources.

He is applying for the loan to purchase guitars, harps, sombreros, and so forth, with which he will be able to increase his stock and fill the demands of his customers.

loans.use: to buy guitars, harps, sombreros, etc.

loans.name: Zubaydullo

texts.ru: Зубайдулло занимается торговлей сим-карты панелей телефонов. Ему 29 лет. Торговлей он занимается уже шесть лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Zubaydullo sells SIM cards and faceplates for mobile phones. He is 29 years old and has been in sales for six years. Zubaydullo is married and has two children. His is taking this loan to increase his merchandise turnover.

loans.use: to buy SIM cards, faceplates, and spare parts for mobile phones

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es madre de 3 hijos los cuyas edades comprenden 14, 10,8, a los cuales ama muchísimo y son su razón de vivir; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que es muy conocida por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo por sus hermosas playas y por la sazón de sus pobladores ya que preparan riquísimos platos. En su tiempo libre a Aurelia le gusta apoyar en sus hijos en las tareas y sobre todo preparar uno de sus platos favoritos que es el “Salpicón de Pollo”; ella solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesora; por ello se esfuerza todos los días para sacar adelante a sus hijos y sean mejores que ella.

Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de jugos de fruta en especial de naranja; ella trabaja alrededor de 5 horas y puede atender hasta 70 clientes ya que ella  tiene su negocio cerca a las oficinas de los centros de trabajo en su ciudad y siempre la mayoría de los clientes sale sin tomar desayuno y siempre compran su producto; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque atiende de manera amable y la buena preparacion d esus jugos.

Aurelia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar fruta al por mayor, lo que le permitirá tener más ingresos ya que comprara las frutas a menor precio; así seguirá trabajando para salir adelante día a día y cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una carrera universitaria a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a mother of 3 ages 14, 10 and 8, she loves them very much and they are her reason to live; her home is located in the city of Chicha, known for being the home to successful starts of Peruvian sports, as well as its beautiful beaches and the great flavors of its cuisine prepared by the people that live there.  During her free time, Aurelia likes to help her children with homework and cook for them their favorite meal which is "salpicon de pollo" (chicken with onion, tomato and peppers).  She only studied 5th grade of secondary school but she would have liked to study to become a teacher, for this reason she makes an effort every day to get her children ahead so they can be better than her.

With much effort and savings she was able to start her own business of selling fresh fruit juice, particularly orange; she works approximately 5 hours and can serve up to 70 customers because her business is close to offices and work places of the city, and usually her clients go to work without eating breakfast and thus they buy her product; she thinks she does well because she provides good customer services and prepares the juices well.

Aurelia is very thankful with the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy fruit at wholesale prices, which will allow her to have more income by reducing her costs; this way she will continue to work to get ahead every day and achieve her biggest dream: Provide for a university degree to her children.

loans.use: to buy fruit at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Сафар житель города Куляб. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его дети маленькие. Сафар занимается торговлей запчастей автомобилей. Этим видом деятельности он занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Safar lives in the town of Kulob. He is 50 years old, married and has four small children. Safar sells auto parts. He has been in in this business for eight years. He is taking out the loan to increase the variety of his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the cars of make by Hyundai.

loans.name: Abdusaid

texts.ru: Абдусаид житель Яванского района. Возраст, 51 год. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Абдусаид более пяти лет занимается разведением мелко - рогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Abdusaid is a resident of the Yavan region. He is 51 years old, married and has six children. Abdusaid has been breeding small horned cattle for more than five years. He is taking out the loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Nuridin

texts.ru: Нуридин житель района Яван. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его сын находится на заработках заграницей. Сам он уже полтора года как предоставляет услугу. Он берет кредит для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Nuridin lives in the region of Yavan. He is 48 years old, married and has five children. His son is now working abroad. He has been providing a service for a year and a half now. He is taking out the loan to repair the vehicle.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle.

loans.name: Boborajab

texts.ru: Боборачаб житель Яванского района. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Двое его сыновей работают в России. Сам Боборачаб занимается купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 18 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Boborajab is a resident of the Yavan region. He is 54 years old, married and has seven children. His two sons work in Russia. Boborajab buys and sells large horned cattle. He has been in this business for eighteen years. He is taking out the loan to buy large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Tunjura

texts.ru: Тунжура три года как занимается торговлей тканей. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж тоже занимается торговлей тканей на центральном рынке. Сама она берет кредит для покупки новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Tunjura has been selling fabrics for three years. She is 45 years old, married and has three children. Her husband also sells fabrics on the central market. She is taking out the loan to buy new kinds of fabrics.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of fabrics.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo, tiene tres hijos, todos son independientes, ella administra una tienda donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, trabaja de 6:00am hasta las 9:00pm, atendiendo en su propio hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de gas propano por mayor, y productos como aceite, harina, azúcar, sal, boquitas para mantener el negocio, estos productos son necesarios y la clientela los demanda, aumentando la posibilidad de venta.
La aspiración de María es crecer en el negocio, ampliarse para atender la clientela.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband, three children, they are all independent, she manages a store where she offers basic necessity products, she works from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm serving clients from her own home.

She requests a loan to buy gas propane at wholesale prices and products such as oil, flour, sugar and salt to supply the business, these products are necessary and requested by her clients, which will increase her sales.  Her wish is to grow the business and expand to serve her clients.

loans.use: To buy gas propane, oil, flour, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Laura Alvarez

texts.es:
La señora Laura es de la ciudad de Santaní. Ella es dueña de una despensa hace más de nueve años en su propia casa. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo ella puede ayudar a su familia con los gastos que día a día surgen en la casa.
Laura se define como una persona con muchas ganas de sobresalir y ser alguien en la vida, es por ello que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para poder ir creciendo.
Solicito el crédito para comprar útiles escolares, con lo cual podrá abastecer su despensa y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. La señora se mostro muy agradecida por la ayuda y confía en seguir creciendo con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en: Laura is from the city of Santani.  She owns a store that she's served for more than 9 years from her own home.  She mentions that thanks to her work she is able to help her family with the expenses that day by day are needed at home.  Laura defines herself as a person with high interests in getting ahead and become someone in life, this is why she works to the max to continue growing.  She requested a loan to buy school supplies, with which to stock her store and meet the demand of her customers.  She was very thankful for the help and hopes to continue to grow with Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy school supplies for her store.

loans.name: Deddeh

texts.en: Deddeh, 28, lives in West Point. She is single with four children between 2 and 9 years old. For  years now she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in the market, and she learned the business from her mother. She likes her business because she makes lots of profit. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, onions, rice, charcoal and oil for her  business. Her  plan is to build a house for  her children.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, onions, rice, charcoal and oil for her  business
